Thank you everyone so much for all your help! Chapters 1-3 are up for everyone to read. :)

--

One day -- it was on a Thursday evening late in the fall -- the weather was wild and rough outside, and it was cruelly dark. The rain was falling and the wind blowing, until the walls of the cottage shook. They were all sitting around the fire, busy with this thing and that. Then all at once something gave three taps on the window. The father went out to see what was the matter. Outside, what should he see but a great big white bear.

~The beginning of East of the Sun, West of the Moon, upon which The Illuminated Heart is based.

 

Dagný’s only brother, Kaj, is dead. He died of illness before his life had really begun, and Dagný blames God for it.

About a week after his death, Kaj comes back as a draugur, a creature intent on the ruin of those it had known in life. With his unholy power, he kills their crops, causes their animals to go insane, and brings them to the brink of starvation. Every single member of Dagný’s village, convinced that her family has brought this curse upon themselves through sin, leaves them alone to die.

Then, one day, a polar bear arrives at their door with a proposition:

“Give me your youngest daughter, and I will make you wealthy.”

The adventure that follows thrusts Dagný into a world where the supernatural intrudes on the natural as a matter of course, where she must act without any assurance of safety, and where she must decide whether to throw away all she’s believed or finally trust in it for the first time.

Read the first three chapters here.

--

On April 5th of this year, while sitting behind a computer running powerpoint for a conference called "Source Code: Reprogram for Tomorrow or Repeat Yesterday", I was ready to bawl my eyes out.

As I'd been changing the slides and singing along with the music, I caught myself giving sidelong glances at the audience to see if anyone was looking at me. And wondered why I did it.

I'd done this often, especially when singing during a worship service in church, wondering if anyone else was listening to me. Was I too loud? Too quiet? A pleasure to listen to? Did I sound like I was focussing on God? It was downright distracting. I thought I'd gotten over it.

And there I was, doing it again at a conference while doing powerpoint, and I asked myself why.

And the answer broke me.

"Does anyone notice me?"

You know how some things can just jab right down past all the layers and stuck right into the depths of your heart and twist? That did it for me. All I wanted to do was cry like a little baby, but I had a job to do, so I held it in for the whole evening, telling those tears with the utmost tenderness: "I'll deal with you when I get home."

Which I did. When I got home, I went into my bedroom and cried and cried and cried.

Memories had been surfacing the whole day, memories of friends who had never communicated with me, people who had acted like they didn't care about me, people who I had desperately wanted to connect with but who did nothing to connect with me.

All I wanted to do was cry like I had when I was little, those times when you didn't worry about stopping and you just cried on your mom's shirt until you had cried all the things you could cry.

And I remembered.

When I was nine, my parents informed me that we would be moving to Alabama, a world away from everything I knew. When I was ten, we were there. And I fell into a depression.

Legit depression, complete with suicidal thoughts and periods where I'd forgotten how to feel.

And, in the moments when I was bawling my eyes out before going to sleep, I would pray to God for a best friend, someone who would know what I was going through but wasn't themselves. Someone who could be like a big sister. Someone who would listen.

He said he'd give me her.

But it didn't happen. I had to wait.

So I asked him to talk to me. To say something.

All I heard was static.

So I asked him to hold me, like I wanted my mom to hold me, but I didn't dare go and interrupt her in the night because she needed her sleep (I'd already asked him to wake up my parents and tell them to come to me, but that hadn't happened, either).

But, no matter what happened, I couldn't tell if the arms I felt were real or just in my imagination.

Finally, as I realized the night of the conference, despite going back to God every time I couldn't handle it, I believed that God had abandoned me. And now there I was, sobbing into my blankets, telling him that it wasn't enough that he noticed me, because he. Had. Left. Me.

And I had decided to get everyone else to notice me, but they hadn't because they were all noticing themselves (no hard feelings about that, really) and even if the whole world noticed me it wouldn't matter because I was empty on the inside.

Because. He. Had. Left. Me.

That night, though, I didn't want to be empty any more, so I crawled back into his arms, accused him of abandonment, and begged him to show me the truth of what had happened all those years ago. The real truth. The one that confirmed the God I've always loved lives up to his word. The one that confirmed that he would never leave me. The one that confirmed that he had worked for my benefit and my benefit alone.

It was a tall order. I figured, if anyone could fill it, they'd be worthy of my life.

I'd be lying if I told you that The Illuminated Heart was about Dagný. It's about me. It's about me in that moment trying to make sense of a life I'd lived with the black stain of depression clawing through it even after the depression had gone. It's about me in all my inadequacies and failings, in all my disconnect from myself and all my illogical choices. In all my coy attempts to manipulate God with sporadically placed trust.

Obviously, I didn't meet a talking bear, and neither have I faced the undead, Norse or otherwise.

But I did find that life is much less about conflict and much more about a change in perspective.

Because when I had been so focussed on exactly how I wanted God to speak to me, he'd been saying something else:

"Tell me how you feel."

Why?

Because I didn't even know, half the time. Because I had no-one else to talk to, and I needed to pour out my heart before it ate me from the inside.

But, most of all, because he had noticed me.

He had noticed me bawling my eyes out.

You want to know what your money will get you?

Don't be shy about it. People give to see something happen, preferably something that will benefit them in some way. Even if it's just to feel happy about making a good thing happen.

With this, you get more.

You get a book that comes straight from the heart, that pulls no punches, that breaks new ground.

You get a book with a soul, a sword, and a telescope.

You get a book that will change the way you think about why God does what he does. Forever.

story:
The Evolving Thread ...

Excerpt from ‘When Destiny Meets Intuition’, my new book-project-in-progress; and 'subtle-story-frame' for this MA/PhD research. 

TO LISTEN: https://soundcloud.com/sarah-whiteley/whendesti...

'Destiny and Intuition were guardians of the Evolving Thread, dear and trusted fellow travelers for Aeons.

And, as had happened so many times before ... they sensed a new and distant Pulse resonating just beyond the visible.  A Pulse so powerful that even Perception needed recalibrating not once, not twice, but thrice.

As they slowly leaned towards the Pulse, they glimpsed the emerging outline of a Portal, opening to the most magnificent multi-dimensional world imaginable.  It was a world where the Attractor Field lived and Higher Consciousness evolved.  Listening deeper and deeper ... the Pulse responded, and released a Wave ~ ~ ~ ~ full of glistening gossamer, and weaving threads of Philosophy, Subtle Artistry and Conscious Evolution into the richest of tapestries ... and the Portal expanded. 

The message was clear.  It was time for Destiny and Intuition to say YES and journey once again. 

Yet before they would step into the new, they called Invitation and Celebration to host a gathering with others to witness the Evolving Thread's most recent adventures - and a Trilogy - who had bravely chronicled the journey with the help of a Weaver. 

And so with Celebration as their host, friends, family, loved ones and newly found ones raised their glasses to the Evolving Thread in honour all that had been lived and embraced the turning of the tide. They gave thanks to all 'The Order of Creation', 'Release the Winged Ones' and 'The Fine Line of Destiny' had chronicled and the Weaver had woven.  They also invoked safe passage into the next Wave, inviting others who were also exploring these lesser known worlds to join with Purpose, Clarity, Ease and Grace, the Trilogy's most trusted companions to date.

And soon, as the revellers retired to their beds, Destiny and Intuition knew they were ready to stand at The Threshold and freefall into the call of dancing airwaves.  They also knew they each held a Key - now laid across their opened palms - and it was time to use them, not alone ... but together.

They were dear and trusted Soul Friends, their moment of meeting Aeons-old.  And yet, as distant as the Portal appeared and as strong as the Pulse now emanated Wave after Wave just beyond the visible, they were once again ready to step into the magnificent journey opening before them...'

 

Who am I

I am Sarah Whiteley, author, poet, practice leader and action researcher of systemic transformation, subtle artistry and conscious evolution.  I am also a philosopher, tracker, field-weaver and host.

I am now developing the Philosophy and 'Subtle Artistry of Conscious Evolution' via a Combined MA/PhD program with The Wisdom School of Graduate Studies at The Ubiquity University.

 

Action Research So Far

My research-thread has evolved through co-creating a series of practice 'portals' that include co-initiating the global practice, The Art of Hosting, co-founding the systemic learning centre, Axladitsa Avatakia, Greece; co-evolving the systemic pattern and practice of Living Wholeness  and founding Conscious Evolution. 

The Research findings has been shared via three self-published books: two poetry: 'The Order of Creation' © 2011 and 'Release the Winged Ones' © 2012 - that chronicle and illuminate personal-to-universal journeying through 'poetic motifs'; and, 'The Fine Line of Destiny' © 2012 (Limited Edition), an autobiographical memoir, Modern Myth and Practice guide - that chronicles the evolutionary arc of living wholeness and its service to systemic transformation and conscious, intentional evolution, including the narratives of portals (named above) and, practice-stories from Greece, the U.S., the UK, Eastern Mediterranean and the Middle East.

The three books (including 'The Fine Line of Destiny' Second Edition* © 2013) will act as Credits for my Masters Degree.

 

The Next Wave of Research

I invite you to support, stengthen and co-evolve the next phase of research within my MA/PhD Studies.

Since launching this Campaign, my participation in the MA/PhD program has been officially accepted - 25.7.13 - and therefore my research process has evolved: from 'Scoping' to 'Study-Engagement' and shifted in timing, not content:

My Research Intention and Core Questions have also been Approved, and remain as previously shown:

My intention is to chronicle the multiple waves and intentional moments and movements of intersection between Destiny, Intuition, Subtle Artistry, Elder Wisdom, Earth Wisdom and Cosmology - to illuminate the keys to conscious evolution and the evolution of consciousness at this time on the planet.

1. How does Intuitive Leadership best serve conscious evolution now?

2. What Earth-wisdom is held within 'grooves', energy 'ley' lines and power portals (places of power) and how do we create a coherent field to accelerate the collective sphere of consciousness, including people and place?
 
3. What 'Ancients' and 'Elder' wisdom is most needed at this time, and how might we bear witness to and accelerate key transmissions from 'wisdom-holders' to those ready to receive them?
 
4. How may Cosmological engagement transform Earth's destiny line to higher consciousness, and inform the bigger Galactic picture?
 
PREVIOUSLY ... in the first 10 day of the Campaign: I wrote: I will participate in a research-scoping journey - that will include a Workshop, exploring Earth-Wisdom of the Canyonlands of Utah, and being in Council with an Elder Pipe Carrier, in the Western United States.
 
Now ...
 
The research-scoping journey elements have evolved into Independent Study (details to be co-designed with WU Faculty) and linked in space-time when journeying to Mexico to participate in the global learning community gathering of Graduate Studies: 'Exploring the Edge of Evolution, The Intimate Community as Leader' at the Teotihuacan Pyramids, the first Credit-program for my Studies.  

*Additional monies, beyond the Campaign 'target' will go towards book, poetry and research writing in the Fall.  The Workshop previously part of the research scoping, will not be possible, but attended at a later date.
 
*Therefore 'Perks' that offer 'hot off the press' poetry from the U.S. journey will now be received later in the Fall.
 
 

Contribute

By contributing to this Campaign, you will weave yourself into the evolving thread of research, and will specifically support:

The first phase of Research in the U.S and Mexico as part of my Combined MA/PhD, including Travel, workshop fees and subsistence.

The writing of poetry, harvest articles and blogs 'live from the road', including supporting the publishing of my 3rd Book of Poetry © 2014.  Funds will also support the writing of the first of the 'Subtle Artists Storybook Series: 'The Fine Line of Destiny, by Destiny' and research for the second Book of this series, 'When Destiny meets Intuition' part of the ongoing work, in support of my Studies.

Research Events and Gatherings during and post-learning journey.  I intend to offer opportunities with a network of resonant practitioners to co-create, illuminate and amplify the evolving thread of this research. Insights will contribute to the research and written outputs.

Participate

By participating in this Research, you strengthen the Attractor Field of this Research journey and Study.  You can participate by:

Exploring the PERKS*, and deciding what level of engagement you wish to activate.

Sharing your inspiration with others about this Campaign, actively amplifying this wave of research.

Joining the conversations and research opportunities, to co-weave the 'Evolving Thread' of the Philosophy and Subtle Artistry of Conscious Evolution.

 

Looking forward to welcoming you into the Research Journey.

 

With love,

Sarah

........

Sarah Whiteley

Conscious Evolution

 

* 'The Fine Line of Destiny' Second Edition © 2013 was to be published in April 2013 - eagerly awaited by many - but the Manuscript took another turn in her own destiny line.  The FLoD is almost ready to fly - being launched in this Campaign, and available with 'PERKS': 'Weaver of Waves', 'Expander of Waves', and 'Evolver of Attractor Fields'.

story:
"...dry eye, a condition that affects as many as 25 million Americans...It's an epidemic now..." - Wall Street Journal, Tuesday, July 9, 2013

My Goal with a Successful Raise:

If you research the dry eye blogs, it doesn't take long before you read some of the terrible stories that sufferers are enduring.   Many of the stories have a similar tone - the pain is constant, the quality of life has been lost, it's difficult to stay focused, depression has set in, the pain makes it difficult to keep a job, there is no cure for dry eye, some even share their thoughts of suicide.  Many of the stories remind me of what I went through.   

My goal is to get this information out to as many of those people as I can.  The technique I used to solve my problem may not solve everyone's problem but I want them to have another option - a reason for hope, a chance to get back to living a normal life.

The book is complete but I would like to raise the funds to create a print version and use that print version as a way to market the book to eye specialists, holistic providers and media and book stores throughout the country.  If we don't raise the money, I won't immediately create a print version which will slow down my efforts to get the word out.

Thank you for your help!!

 

My Story

Hi!  My name is Anthony DeSimone and I am a former sufferer of severe dry eye.  I discovered a solution to solving my dry eye and it worked so well for me I decided to write a book about it to teach my technique to anyone suffering from dry eye.  I’m the author of the book “Dry Eye No More – how to solve your dry eye naturally.”  Let me share some of my story with you.

My eyes were always dry and red and I was living in constant pain. My eyes would feel extremely heavy and every time I blinked it felt like I was rubbing sandpaper over my eyeballs.

 

I was in so much pain, I began going to the eye doctors for pain relief treatment once or twice a month to the point that I became a regular at the office.


I became reclusive because I did not want people to see how bad my eyes looked and I did not want to talk about it.  I was also having problems with the brightness of office and store lights.  It got so bad, I began wearing sunglasses at night while driving to block out the headlights of the oncoming cars and the ones that were flashing in my rear view and side mirrors.  As bad as I was feeling then, I began to worry about how much worse it was going to be in a year or five years or twenty years.


I tried many prescription and non-prescription drops and ointments and nothing seemed to help.  If anything, it seemed like my eyes were getting worse.


I was having extreme difficulty with performing my job and living my life. My eyes were on fire!


And unfortunately, the worst part was the experts - the eye doctors - had no answers.  I discovered there is no cure for Dry Eye.

I realized I needed to solve my own problem.  So, after some trial and error, I created a technique that included data collection of my day-to-day life.  I began measuring the dryness in the air and comparing it to the dryness in my eyes and after several days, I began seeing trends that I never noticed before.

I thought I was always in the same amount of pain, but I discovered that wasn’t true.  Once I began measuring and rating my eye dryness, I discovered there were times during each day where my eyes would feel better.

By measuring and charting the dryness, it became very easy for me to recognize the activities that were causing the greatest amount of dryness and the activities and procedures that were helping reduce the dryness.

I began to experiment and discovered how to combine these activities that made my eyes feel better until I put the right formula together to become pain free; free from dry eye, every day.


This book shares my story and provides the step-by-step process on how to solve your moderate to severe dry eye problem without prescription drugs and without paying significant amounts of money. The book also includes all the easy-to-use data collection templates needed to get started right away.

You’re closer than you think to having your life back.  Please fund my campaign and become one of the first to get my book before it’s available to the public.

"...dry eye, a condition that
affects as many as 25 million Americans...It's an epidemic now..." - Wall Street Journal, Tuesday, July 9, 2013

My Goal with a Successful Raise:
If you research the dry eye blogs, it doesn't take long before you read some of the terrible stories that sufferers are enduring.   Many of the stories have a similar tone - the pain is constant, the quality of life has been lost, it's difficult to stay focused, depression has set in, the pain makes it difficult to keep a job, there is no cure for dry eye, some even share their thoughts of suicide.  Many of the stories remind me of what I went through.   
My goal is to get this information out to as many of those people as I can.  The technique I used to solve my problem may not solve everyone's problem but I want them to have another option - a reason for hope, a chance to get back to living a normal life.
The book is complete but I would like to raise the funds to create a print version and use that print version as a way to market the book to eye specialists, holistic providers and media and book stores throughout the country.  If we don't raise the money, I won't immediately create a print version which will slow down my efforts to get the word out.
Thank you for your help!!

I was living in constant pain. My eyes would feel extremely heavy and every

story:
About the Book

The goal is to photograph portraits of adults living with CF. Beside each of their portraits will be something they have personally written - it could be their feelings, an experience, thoughts about their future, whatever. The goal is to raise awareness that people are living longer because of advances made in the medical community, advances made through generous donations. The public perception is that CF is still very much a childhood disease. By putting a new face on Cystic Fibrosis we want to change the perception, and show that research through donations is making a significant change for the better. But adults are dealing with other problems as well, and this is to also shed some light and understanding on the other issues adults with CF deal with.



I am looking to photograph minimum 50 people, even upwards of 100 (depending on funding) right across North America.

I have to be very clear that a good portion of the money raised will be used for the production of the project - car rentals, hotels, GAS, gear rentals, etc. HOW FAR I can travel depends on donations!!!!!

I am looking to raise (at least) $10,000... but more is of course better.
This will provide enough to produce the project, and still have enough for a great donation... hopefully.


(Portrait #1 taken. James, age 34)


I am a portrait and fashion photographer (and art director) based in Hamilton, ON (Canada). I am also a 45 year old male with Cystic Fibrosis. Luckily my diagnosis is considered a milder variant of the disease, but it is CF nonetheless. I was diagnosed about 7 years ago. Before that I had no idea, but looking back on my life I always had the symptoms, just no one ever knew it was CF (like incredibly salty sweat). It wasn’t until I was unable to have children I was finally diagnosed, with F508 del and L206T mutations.

How many times have people said “Really? But you’re 45.” when I tell them I have CF. It is still assumed by many that it is a childhood disease.
Life expectancy, even 20 years ago, wasn’t that great when diagnosed with CF. That has changed now, and my goal is to bring awareness that because of these medical advances, overall life expectancy has greatly increased. This is only done through research, and donations.

But what many don’t realize is adults living with CF have a whole host of other issues to deal with, many of them psychological. Besides having to deal with the main physiological symptoms of CF, studies are finding adults living longer with the disease are battling depression, Quality of Life issues, panic attacks, coping with these major life changes, self-esteem issues, substance abuse, and more.


The main goals:
• CF awareness leading to donation.

• Awareness of issues regarding Adults with CF.

• Get people to sign their Organ Donor Cards!!!!!!!

• To get people to donate as much as possible - either through this fundraiser or to the foundations directly. 

• Book deal with international publisher, all proceeds to CF.

• Tentative: awareness through travelling gallery show, large prints.

WHAT YOU GET:

• The book. At least 50 portraits of people living and dealing with this disease.

My focus is mainly North America, due to the cost of travel. But could this go International? Why not! With the right support and funding lets go worldwide. The plan is to have this as a multi-tiered project: awareness will be gained by the exposure of the project in a final book form, that can be promoted (i.e. morning talk shows etc). 


What is CF?
Cystic fibrosis (CF) is a life-threatening genetic disease that primarily affects the lungs and digestive system. An estimated 70,000 worldwide have CF.
There is no cure. Cystic fibrosis causes various effects on the body, but mainly affects the digestive system and lungs. The degree of cystic fibrosis involvement differs from person to person. However, the persistence and ongoing infection in the lungs, with destruction of lungs and loss of lung function, eventually causes death in the majority of people who have cystic fibrosis. Typical complications caused by cystic fibrosis are difficulty in digesting fats and proteins; vitamin deficiencies due to loss of pancreatic enzymes; and progressive loss of lung function. The life expectancy of a child with CF has doubled in the last 30 years, and research to find a cure is more promising than ever before.

From www.cff.org
“In the 1950s, few children with cystic fibrosis lived to attend elementary school. Today, advances in research and medical treatments have further enhanced and extended life for children and adults with CF. Many people with the disease can now expect to live into their 30s, 40s and beyond. More than 45% of the CF patient population is age 18 or older.”



My project focuses only on adults, giving a new face to CF that it hasn’t had in the past.

More info

http://www.ianpettigrew.com/adults-with-cf-project.html

story:
Overview:

Hi! My name is Summer Rayne Oakes and I'm an environmental scientist and entomologist by training and have done quite a bit of work in the field—from reclaiming mine sites to working in agroforestry. Sometimes it's challenging to communicate how these efforts impact us, so in 2005 I moved to Brooklyn to explore how I could apply my environmental knowledge to industries that noticeably impact our everyday lives—from what we wear to what we eat.

Growing up in the country, I had never imagined myself living in the city for so long. One way I have felt at "home" in the city has been by bringing and caring for plants indoors. I think a lot of people are like me—rural transplants in an urban environment, seeking a way to live more sustainably and in sync with nature. Even for those of us who have never stepped barefoot on a blade of grass, there's something inherently in us that is connected to nature—on a much deeper, biological level. 

In 2016 my home went viral due to the amount of plants I have (I grow ~700 plants indoors!) This spawned much curiosity, excitement, questions and intrigue, so that's how How to Make a Plant Love You: Houseplant Masterclass was born! This is a way for newbie plant lovers and well-seasoned plantaholics get to know more about plants, demystify plant care, and create the indoor jungle of their dreams. I would like to see all of us be able to have a closer relationship with nature—both indoors and out—and if we can do that through learning to think like a plant, then my mission will feel complete! 

About the Campaign

Some of what this course will cover includes: 

You can also plan on having beautiful imagery, illustrations and animated visuals to help you not only understand plant care—but help you think more like a plant!

 

What We Need & What You Get:

We already raised the basic funding to pay our artists, illustrators, editors and videographers to help complete the course, but I'd love to raise the rest of the funds to meet some of our stretch goals to take the online experience offline. Some of these include

  • Producing How to Make a Plant Love You tours and in-person workshops across various cities—connecting with plant friends in real life (#PlantFriendsIRL); 
  • Creating a hardcover book
  • Donating 500 copies of the book to under-served schools and libraries; 
  • Creating and performing immersive experiences across cities, and 
  • Putting How To Make a Plant Love You: Houseplant Masterclass principles to work by helping refurbish and improve three community gardens in Brooklyn, NY.

We'd love your help in achieving these goals! 

 

You'll be able to access some awesome perks including: 

Risks & Challenges:

Risks for the project are low. I have quite a lot of experience in this field, having produced multiple videos for the past 10 years, including producing and editing weekly online videos for my show Plant One On Me on YouTube, online workshops for my other venture: www.sugardetox.me, several books, and a myriad of events. 

I also have an incredible network of trustworthy, talented artists and designers that I've been working with for the past decade who are ready and willing to contribute to this initiative.

To further minimize risks, I started working on this project last year, researching, writing, and planning.

Other Ways You Can Support:

If you cannot give or support the campaign financially, then I encourage you to follow along and to share too!

story:
CAMPAIGN CLOSES APRIL 26, 2020!!! BE THE FIRST TO SNAG A COPY!

 

WHATS THE BOOK ABOUT

In Bring the Joy, Jessica Janzen shares her experience in following those nudges of her heart to find true and lasting joy. From the bliss of her dramatic, romantic saga with her now husband, to the trials and triumph of her career journey as a young woman, to the devastating loss of her son when he was only six months old, Jessica’s commitment to follow the nudges of her heart have seen her through every season. Through her hilarious, inspiring stories and refreshing honesty, Jessica will challenge you to start looking for ways to bring more joy to your life and the lives of those around you. Life lived to the fullest can only happen when you bring the joy.

WHY A CAMPAIGN

So why a crowd funding campaign? Writing a book is an expensive undertaking It will be about a $90,000 project when it is done. WOWZERS! Between editing, designing, printing, publishing and marketing the book, it all adds up quick. This pre-order campaign will give the project a HUGE jump start, and also give you an exclusive discounted price with fun perks! Definitely a win-win situation.

By contributing to this project, you'll not only be personally inspired by Jess's story, you'll help thousands of others be inspired as well. Our hope is that everyone who reads Jess's story will know, "If she can do it, I can too."

Jess's hope is that it won't take losing your child to wake you up to living your fullest, most joy-filled life. A life on purpose – for a purpose. 

 

Who is Jessica?

Jessica Janzen Olstad is a speaker, social media influencer, clothing line designer, and the founder and Executive Director of the Love for Lewiston Foundation. Raised a farm girl, she's now a city dweller living in Calgary, Alberta, Canada. Four days before her 30th birthday, she ditched her corporate gig and the 9 -5 grind to live her most authentic, bold, joyful life. She had no idea her world was about to get flipped upside down. 

In November 2016, Jessica lost her 6 month old son Lewiston to a rare genetic disease called SMA (Spinal Muscular Atrophy). It took her losing her son to really wake Jess up to living her life to the fullest. She hopes by sharing her story through this book, others will be motivated to chase their big dreams – right now – without having to go through tragedy. 

Jessica is most proud of being a wife to her hubby "Hot Ronnie" and Mama to her three kids Swayzie, Lewiston and Hollis. When she's not busy with her family, Jessica runs the Love for Lewiston Foundation which has raised over $620,000 for the SMA & Alberta Children's Hospital Foundation.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $90,000.  BIG NUMBER - CRAZY RIGHT - BUT PUBLISHING A BOOK IS NO JOKE!. The US Dollar is strong and the Canadian dollar is not doing so well right now, along with editing, printing, audio recordings, consulting fees it all adds up. Your support will get the book from manuscript status into the hands of experienced publishers (The Fedd Agency), and eventually printed and into your hands! Working with The Fedd Agency is super important to Jess because, though she loves telling her story in person, writing it can be a challenge. The Fedd Agency will help Jess tell her story, her family's story, and Lewiston's story with excellence. By writing this book, so many more can hear it than Jess could possibly tell face to face.  It is a dive into the mess of life and not just in 15 seconds clips on Instagram. 

When you contribute to this campaign you get discount pricing on her book "Bring the Joy" and fun perks only available during this presale. 

All money raised will go towards publishing and printing the first run of books, whether our goal is met or not. You will have the book in your hands by May 2020, even if it means taking out a loan or maxing our credit cards - which we really don't want to do! 

The Impact

This book is essentially a play book of how to take your life experiences (the good, bad and ugly) learn from them, and leverage them to bring the most impact and joy into your life. As many books as we can sell, that's how many lives will potentially be changed by this message. The potential for the impact of this story is unlimited.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge is to raise the full amount (it's a lot - we know!) But even if the full amount isn't raised, we will take out a small business loan to complete the project on time. Jessica has set a goal and won't stop until this project is complete. 

Another challenge is the self doubt and discouragement that can come out with putting yourself out there for a project like this. That's why Jess is working with a book launch coach and a team of people to support and hold her accountable to her plan!

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone will be able to contribute financially to this project. But another powerful way to help is by sharing this campaign with your circle of friends. Posting about it on facebook or instagram, or emailing friends you think might be interested will make a huge difference in getting the word out! This will make a perfect gift for Christmas - we will have postcards explaining your gift to stick in a stocking  or wrap up - please just remember the book will not be printed until May 2020. 

Also if you have connections to any local media outlets, or people you think we should connect with, please don't hesitate to reach out and let us know.

Great News!!

Time is ticking down and it seems the goal is insurmountable, but that isn't true! Thanks to some non-monetary donations, this research can still happen with just a little more help. At $375 I can get discount airline tickets, at $600 I could get a rental car. Less than 20 people contributing $10 each can make this happen! Add what you can and encourage your friends so we can start making a difference where it matters - in the imagination. http://igg.me/at/deltashadows/x/5998027 


Party Time!

The campaign's almost over and my birthday's almost here, so I'm celebrating by giving away two valuable gifts!

While my expertise is in all things writing related and I’m an amateur investigator into climate science, the topic of our conversation can be anything you want it to be, within reason of course.

  • Want to talk about your latest project and get a little feedback on it? That’s totally fine. Send me some of it before we talk and I’ll be thrilled to offer some constructive feedback.
  • Interested in knowing more about what the crowd funding experience is really like? I’m ready to share.
  • Want to share your favorite version of climate change predictions and discuss why it’s better than all the rest? I’m all ears.
  • What do you want to talk about?

A futuristic tale of climate change, human survival, and rebuilding society to sustainably co-exist with the Earth.

A Novel Set in a Future World

The storms were already pretty bad when I was a kid, and the world was failing, but we still held out hope. Multi-legged funnel storms stalked across the land, whirling away everything in their paths. You never knew who you'd be losing. Drenching storms threatened to flood us out if we tried to go underground. If it wasn't storms, it was fires. Fresh water was too precious to use on fires we couldn't control anyway so they raged across the land unchecked. The power grids fell and all my books disappeared with the last battery charge. Then everyone got sick. We ran out of medicine, or we couldn't get the medicine, or we didn't have the right kind of medicine. I don't quite know, I was very young. Not many of us survived after all that. We did what we could to organize, but we didn't do it well enough.

We tried to form into organized Trader Guilds, those few of us who remained. I thought we were doing it to organize our people into more effective units, each of which would cooperate for the betterment of the whole. That isn't what happened. Now the most ruthless are in charge, hoarding the best resources for themselves, the majority of people enslaved without a clue that things were once better and could be again. But those two, they might be the answer.

I raised Mark myself. I saw something heroic in the boy when he put himself out there to protect the little girl he'd just met. I was hopeful he would be the one to turn things around. Maybe the task was too big for him, maybe he just couldn't understand the importance. So far, he's been a minor disappointment to me, but I still hope for him.

Lissa's a different story. Her mother was a beautiful woman who couldn't abide being locked within doors to keep her safe from the Slavers. I helped her set up a secret Teaching Room where we could discreetly send students to learn some of the things the Trader Guilds tried to keep hidden from their slaves. She kept Lissa away from here, most of the time. I don't know where - she'd never tell me. But she taught that girl a lot, much more than what we have in the Teaching Room. And Lissa has her spirit. It will be hard to keep that girl down.

I wish I could help, but dead men can't interfere in the lives of the living. Now that Lissa's grown and making her own choices, what can she accomplish, and will my Mark play a role?

The Impact

Some of the topics to be explored in this work of fiction:

  • Climate change
  • Sustainability
  • Alternative farming techniques
  • Innovation
  • Eco-punk (steampunk based on new power technologies)
  • Increased awareness of the needs of the Mississippi Delta region

By including these topics within an engaging work of fiction, this story will be able to introduce more people to the concepts surrounding climate change and inspire more pro-active action on the part of its readers. With a strong female engineering-oriented protagonist, it will also provide girls with a positive role model and encourage innovation among readers.

*As a professional technical writer, I am also interested to explore the possibility of using crowd-funding to support academic-level research.

How You Can Help

While more than 50,000 words have been written toward the completion of this work, the characters are operating without a stage. But there are just some things you can't learn from books or the internet. To give this story the authenticity it needs, I need to conduct more in-depth, on-the-ground research in the Mississippi Delta region where the story takes place. All funding raised through this campaign will contribute to travel expenses and ground accommodations as this research is being conducted (airfare, rental car, hotel, food).

Rewards

Any contribution to the campaign will give you the option of joining the bi-monthly e-mail update list. Bi-monthly emails will be sent out giving you updates of progress on the story and invite you to make contributions as the story progresses. At higher levels of contribution, you gain a vote on the final title and cover design, guest appearances in the story, and free copies of the finished work. At this time, only e-books are being considered (to reduce environmental impact), but you will be among the first to know and receive if a print book becomes available.

Stretching Goals

If I can raise as much as $4800, you will have funded two full weeks of research on the ground as well as additional research materials. The extra time would be helpful as I work to forge important friendships from the area. Enabling me to purchase additional research materials would mean you're also indirectly supporting other research covering the main concepts explored within the book.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand if you can’t contribute financially, but you can still help. 

Please:

• Share this campaign with your friends and family

• Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, etc.

5 Frequently Asked Questions

Why do you need to physically be there? It’s fiction, make it up.

Great question and one I’ve heard before. I’m sure lots of folks want to know this one. I can make up a lot of things, and since this is primarily a work of fiction set in a hypothetical future, I will need to make some things up no matter how good my research. However, having grown up in multiple areas of the country, I know that the feel of a place is often much different from the reality reflected in books and on the internet. I can learn a lot through reference materials, but I’ll learn a lot more a lot faster if I actually go there and see things like the lay of the land, the types of vegetation and how it interacts both in cultivated areas and in the more untamed portions. These are things books don’t often talk about directly, but which are the breath of life in creative works.

Why this region?

The Mississippi Delta is the poorest region of our country where people live in Third World conditions. In spite of this, the people who live there have shown incredible innovation and resilience using whatever comes their way to help them scratch out a living from the land without the benefit of modern education, technology or industry. It is that spirit of never giving up, always using the tools and materials that come your way to create what you need, and inventiveness that will lead to the development of a vibrant, sustainable community which produces the main character, Lissa, and provides, through her, hope for the future.

Is this science fiction? How realistic?

Technically speaking, yes, this could easily be classified as science fiction in that it tells of a future world and focuses on the science and technology of the time. Because much of our current technology is rendered useless by the climactic and population changes that have taken place, this distinction may be called into question a bit; however, book two of the series will take us more into what I’m calling eco-punk (a derivative of steampunk) and the entire story is based on real principles of science including scientific predictions of a future Earth and real technological concepts that may or may not have been proven yet.

Is it strictly or predominantly written to raise awareness or is it more of a novel?

It is my belief that every story has the power to change the world if it gets into the right hands, captures the imagination, and provides room to grow. Most of the efforts to raise awareness about climate change have focused on delivering the facts – for good reason. Important decisions that can drastically affect the economy should be based on scientific evidence.

Unfortunately, that isn’t how human brains work. People only get excited/involved when their emotions and imaginations are engaged. The goal of this book, which is very decidedly focused on being a novel, is to engage imaginations and emotions based on real facts and data as well as the most up-to-date scientific predictions I can find. The eco-punk elements are designed to give readers a direction to follow regardless of their current living circumstances or socioeconomic status.

What experience do you bring in this area and how will that help the project?

My background is full of writing – as a journalist, a freelance technical writer, a copywriter, a grant writer, a creative writer, and as a teacher. As a Master’s student, I specialized in American literature and Rhetoric, so I understand how the written word can be used to greatest effect. I’m also a member of Al Gore’s Climate Reality Project Team and have been a passionate advocate for the environment for several years. My proximity to experts and leaders in the field through the various positions I’ve held both enable me to see the ‘big picture’ as well as understand the frustration and helpless feelings of the average individual. I’m also well aware of the importance of providing solid, accurate, scientifically-based information to be sure readers are able to make an educated choice for themselves and I want to introduce the excitement of innovation and discovery to my readers through the inventive and resourceful character of Lissa, a backwoods engineer without a clue that what she does is special.

story:
Story of My Book

Follow is about developing and cultivating healthy rhythms, practices, and habits that will help you become the person you were created to be and desire to be. We thrive by following (1) the rhythms we create and (2) the good plans God has for our life. This book will cover what rhythm is, how to create rhythm in specific areas, and how these principles apply in various stages of life.

My name is Joseph Tolonen, and I am the author of Follow. I wrote this book as a result of my experiences as a high school teacher. It broke my heart to see how heavy and weary my students (and sometimes colleagues) were. This strong feeling of discontent grew inside me, both personally and communally. It gave way to this feeling of “there has to be more in life,” and this book is about how we can create and find that “more” through the rhythms we develop and follow as we grow in our faith walk. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover a much deeper sense of purpose and joy in your life. Through this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for developing and cultivating healthy rhythms and practices. And then, ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you take down what is standing in your way, creating in that space healthy rhythms that will help you thrive in your life, as well as help you deepen your faith walk.

In this book, you'll learn about identifying what holds you back, how to create lasting change, and how to implement the principles of rhythm at various stages of life:

  • When my younger brother and I were young, we used to play an iPhone game called Pocket God. As the “god” of our own island, it was fun being in control and deciding how we would use our power (whether for good or for evil). The biblical narrative calls us kings and queens, but we have a choice how to use our power. Ultimately, we were designed to follow God and order our lives after His plans and purposes. To create healthy rhythms, we first need to stop playing “pocket god” and relinquish control over our lives to God’s greater plans and order.
  • We are not in this journey alone. A good friend shared with me his journey to overcoming an addiction to pornography. A good strategy to developing and cultivating healthy rhythms is a mix of spiritual and practical. The spiritual side was submitting the addiction to God and asking for His help. Practically, this meant leaning into relationships, community, and accountability (specific rhythms that are discussed in the book). These relationships have helped spur him on as he continues to work on developing healthier rhythms and pursue freedom.
  • There are generally two types of rhythm changes, proactive and reactive. My pastor friend, Phil Kerlin, shared with me how we can be proactive about anticipating and preparing for changes such as getting married or having kids. On the other hand, something like a worldwide pandemic forces reactive changes. Especially in challenging times like these, having a good foundation of rhythm is important so that instead of being capsized by the storm, we can use it to our advantage.

You will love this book if you are a young adult or young professional (although, the principles apply to any age demographic!). If you’re a parent, teacher, or someone who works a lot with younger people, this book will be valuable to you as you guide them. Those who like systems and getting things done (like me) will enjoy all the practical tips and systems that can be used and developed. If you’re unhappy with your life, stressed and overwhelmed all the time, and always feel like everything’s out of control, this is the book for you.

Follow is a non-fiction book that speaks to young adults/professionals and parents and teachers who are looking at creating healthy rhythms and habits and finding a deeper sense of purpose and fulfillment in life for the first time.

 

The Book - Follow

The book is written in 3 Parts....

Part 1 contains the introduction, a “success” story, and chapters 1-6. This part of the book is all about understanding what rhythm is, the science behind creating healthy habits, and addressing the spiritual importance of rhythm in life. While people tend to talk about “balance,” the concept of rhythm is superior due to its flexibility (whereas balance is usually static). Looking at the science behind the power of habit will help us use whatever life throws at us to our advantage and start building small habits that steer us in the right direction. Before rhythm can be created, a strong foundation needs to be built. This means being self-aware of what inhibits us from growing, tearing those strongholds down, and forming a vision of the person we want to become.

Part 2 contains chapters 7-12. The second part of the book discusses the specifics of developing a “rhythm of life.” It references something practiced by monks called the “rule of life.” We will look at specific rhythms that can be developed, including relationships and community, boundaries, rest-work relationship, worship and prayer, and service and hospitality. Each chapter will include some background on the specific rhythm being discussed, as well as practical ways to start practicing and integrating it into your life, including questions and charts you can fill out on your own. This part will be the most “nitty-gritty” of the book, as it focuses primarily on how each rhythm pertains to the current season of life you are in.

Part 3 contains chapters 13-16. The last part of the book focuses on how these above principles and rhythms can be integrated into various stages of life. These stages include: middle and high school, college, early career/young professionals, and mid-points (or looking to change). Each chapter will contain specific suggestions for each rhythm in part two, as well as experiences from those in the same stage of life. The book will end with the second half of the “success” story from the beginning, which will give you a picture of how much your life could change (for the better) as you learn to cultivate healthy rhythms and follow the good plans God has for your life.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go toward the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020
  • The Cover Design of my book - the mockups you see currently are placeholders!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for my book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Winter

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now. When I publish, you will receive the following:

  • A personally signed copy of my book 
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experience of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

Joseph Tolonen is the assistant music director at Lutheran High School West in Rocky River, Ohio. He is also currently pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Ministerial Leadership.

Joseph wrote this book for three reasons. First, it's been his dream for the past few years to do so. Second, he is passionate about cultivating healthy rhythms, as he has seen what a difference it had made in his own life. Third, he wants to share with others what he has learned and help them grow and become all that they were created to be.

Outside of work, school, and writing, Joseph has a dog named Jericho and spends a lot of time on his other passion in life — playing and writing music.

For more information, you can connect with Joseph on Instagram @joseph_tolonen.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #ThrivingByFollowing and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Joseph Tolonen

If you’re unhappy with your life, stressed and overwhelmed all the time, and always feel like everything’s out of control, this is the book for you.Follow is a non-fiction book that speaks to young adults/professionals and parents and teachers who are looking at creating healthy rhythms and habits and finding a deeper sense of purpose and fulfillment in life for the first time.
 
The Book - Follow
The book is written in 3 Parts....Part 1 contains the introduction, a “success” story, and chapters 1-6. This part of the book is all about understanding what rhythm is, the science behind creating healthy habits, and addressing the spiritual importance of rhythm in life. While people tend to talk about “balance,” the concept of rhythm is superior due to its flexibility (whereas balance is usually static). Looking at the science behind the power of habit will help us use whatever life throws at us to our advantage and start building small habits that steer us in the right direction. Before rhythm can be created, a strong foundation needs to be built. This means being self-aware of what inhibits us from growing, tearing those strongholds down, and forming a vision of the person we want to become.Part 2 contains chapters 7-12. The second part of the book discusses the specifics of developing a “rhythm of life.” It references something practiced by monks called the “rule of life.” We will look at specific rhythms that can be developed, including relationships and community, boundaries, rest-work relationship, worship and prayer, and service and hospitality. Each chapter will include some background on the specific rhythm being discussed, as well as practical ways to start practicing and integrating it into your life, including questions and charts you can fill out on your own. This part will be the most “nitty-gritty” of the book, as it focuses primarily on how each rhythm pertains to the current season of life you are in.Part 3 contains chapters 13-16. The last part of the book focuses on how these above principles and rhythms can be integrated into various stages of life. These stages include: middle and high school, college, early career/young professionals, and mid-points (or looking to change). Each chapter will contain specific suggestions for each rhythm in part two, as well as experiences from those in the same stage of life. The book will end with the second half of the “success” story from the beginning, which will give you a picture of how much your life could change (for the better) as you learn to cultivate healthy rhythms and follow the good plans God has for your life.
 
What I Need & What You'll Get
This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go toward the following:

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020
The Cover Design of my book - the mockups you see currently are placeholders!
The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
The Copyediting for my book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Winter

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now. When I publish, you will receive the following:

A personally signed copy of my book 
A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
Your name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experience of writing my book
And more...

 
About the Author
Joseph Tolonen is the assistant music director at Lutheran High School West in Rocky River, Ohio. He is also currently pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Ministerial Leadership.Joseph wrote this book for three reasons. First, it's been his dream for the past few years to do so. Second, he is passionate about cultivating healthy rhythms, as he has seen what a difference it had made in his own life. Third, he wants to share with others what he has learned and help them grow and become all that they were created to be.Outside of work, school, and writing, Joseph has a dog named Jericho and spends a lot of time on his other passion in life — playing and writing music.For more information, you can connect with Joseph on Instagram @joseph_tolonen.

story:
Story of My Book 

Thank you for everyone who made me reach my first goal of $5000. The final goal is $8000 ... can we do it? 

 

The Future of Palestine: True leaders accept diversity is a non-fiction book that provides non-Palestinians with a background about the Palestinian-Israeli conflict. It also addresses Palestinians through focusing on learning about diversity in the Holy Land and on how to appreciate it based on theoretical readings of the Palestinian society. The end goal is to have a positive impact in one's community.

My name is Tamar Haddad, and I am the author of The Future of Palestine: True Leaders Accept Diversity. I hope that in reading this book you will discover that the conflict Palestinians encounter is not merely related to Israel. Despite Palestinians’ lack of mobility, water, electricity and control over their own land and air by the Israeli law, conflicts within arise everyday. Such issues occur towards Palestinians who are different from what is widely agreed to be the norm, and those who are considered the Other or minorities.

In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for social justice in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you accept people of different religion, race, gender, sexual orientation and class. Unfortunately, we live in a world submerged in a dark, gooey and filthy liquid that consists of prejudice towards people of other or even no religion, racism, misogyny, homophobia and capitalism. 

The Future of Palestine is your chance to accept and appreciate diversity through:
  • engaging in theoretical readings like nationalism, the race theory, feminism, queer theory, marxism, post colonialism, psychoanalysis and Orientalism,
  • sharing stories of Palestinians who do not fit into the norm,
  • paying it forward and making a change in one’s own community.

You will love this book if you are fed up with people dying everyday because they are not accepted, and you wish to make a difference about it. 

The Future of Palestine speaks to Palestinians and non-Palestinians who want to grapple with accepting diversity within Palestine and gaining knowledge about the Palestinian-Israel conflict in a new way.

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. Coming together and discussing Palestinian identity and trauma, the notion of religion, women, race, LGBT, and class will change us all for the better. 

The Book - The Future of Palestine: True Leaders Accept Diversity 

A road map of the book 

The Future of Palestine is written in 3 main Parts:

Part 1 introduces the history of Palestine and how Israel was formed, from an objective point of view. Moreover, it explains the shared collective trauma of Palestinians and the predicted loss of their identity. This part is mainly directed towards non-Palestinians and those who are interested in knowing more about the Palestinian-Israeli conflict. 

Part 2 dives into the stories of those Palestinians who are discriminated against within the Palestinian society for their religious beliefs, race, gender, sexual orientation or class. Theoretical criticism is applied to these stories. This section of the book targets Palestinians, especially those who want to eliminate all prejudices. 

Part 3 sheds light on possible advantages within the Palestinian community, and directs readers on how to make a change. This part is for all readers. 

What I Need & What you'll Get 

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020.
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this December.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now.
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish, plus:

  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author

Tamar Haddad is a non-profit program developer and implementer, content writer at Hub101, and an event coordinator at the School of Management at Californian Lutheran University. Leadership has a huge impact on Tamar. She has been part of many leadership programs throughout her life like the Clinton Global Initiative University (CGI U), International Women Leaders, the Middle East Partnership Initiative - Student Leaders program (MEPI) at Georgetown University where she designs and implements projects that have a positive impact in her own community. Thus, leadership and making a change were the first ideas to cross her mind when her editors and publishers asked about a potential topic of her book. 

When Tamar is not running around her campus between classes, work, and Model United Nations club meetings, one often finds her traveling. Yes ... most of her trips require her to attend annual conferences like the United Nations Commission on the Status of Women, yet she finds the time to explore and experience new places. When traveling internationally, she enjoys experiencing new cultures. 

I wrote this book because my classmate and friend, Israa Ghrayeb, was brutally murdered by her male family members. Her homicide was justified as Honor Killing, like many others before her. Israa’s “dishonor” was the simple act of going outside, in broad daylight, with her fiancé and his sister, an act her cousin insisted was unacceptable in a conservative society. The uncle, along with her father and her brother-in-law, beat her and broke her spine. Later, as she was hospitalized, the men argued they had to punish the Djin (or evil spirit) that they alleged possessed her, claiming that it was her alleged bewitchment that led to her eventual death. Surprisingly, this argument was a valid one at local court. Doctors determined Israa’s death to have resulted from the repeated beating’s affect on her respiratory system. Her killers are still free today and still using “magic” as their defense.

For more information you can connect with Tamar at:

Email: Tamar.Haddad@gmail.com

Instagram: @Tamar_TheFutureOfPalestine

LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/tamar-haddad/

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheFutureOfPalestine and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Tamar

story:
The Archives Association of Ontario (AAO) is a volunteer-led organization that supports archival associations, those working in archives, as well as users and supporters of archives. The history of the organization goes back forty years to the earliest regional chapters and eventually the establishment of the Ontario Association of Archivists (OAA) and the Ontario Council of Archives (OCA). The OAA and OCA amalgamated to form the AAO on May 14th, 1993.

 

Despite the fact that this association is four decades in the making, no concerted effort has been made to document this evolution - until now! This organizational history book will be an invaluable resource for AAO volunteers acting on committees and sitting on the Board, for archives and libraries to provide to researchers across the province, and for heritage organizations across Canada that can learn from the AAO’s history.

 

What We Need and What You’ll Get

A volunteer group of writers have been hard at work researching and writing the text. They are John Smart, Brian Beaven, Ellen Millar, Anne Hepplewhite, and Marissan Paron. This material is overseen by a group of volunteer editors comprised of Brian Beaven, Karen Teeple, and Paul Henry. Additionally, a volunteer Organizational History Committee oversees aspects of the project such as the collection of photographs for the book, publication issues, and fundraising. Although we are blessed that so many people are volunteering their time to produce this book, we do have costs associated with the publication, including:

  • Printing costs
  • Binding costs
  • Graphic design costs

 

If you support this project now, you can take advantage of these exciting perks!

  • Item Level Supporters will receive a softcover copy of the book.
  • File Level Supporters will receive a hardcover copy of the book.
  • Series Level Supporters will receive a hardcover copy of the book and their name printed in the book.
  • Fonds Level Supporters will receive a hardcover copy of the book, their name printed in the book, and an exclusive AAO 25th anniversary bookmark.
  • Repository Level Supporters will receive a hardcover copy of the book, their name printed in the book, an exclusive AAO 25th anniversary bookmark, and acknowledgement at the book launch celebration.

 

If we are not able to reach our goal, the Archives Association of Ontario has generously offered to offset our costs with funds from their reserves. However, we are optimistic that this project can contribute revenue to the association instead of consuming scarce resources.

 

The Impact

This project is truly unique. An organizational history has never been written for the Archives Association of Ontario, or for any other provincial archival associations across Canada. You can be a part of history by supporting this publication!

 

In Pursuit of the Archival Endeavour will be an invaluable resource for future AAO staff and Board members by collecting the organization’s knowledge and memories in an accessible medium. It is also a valuable resource for past and present AAO members interested in the history of the organization, and it has academic value for anyone studying archival networks and archival associations in Ontario. This book will make clear how the AAO’s programs have informed and educated archivists when other types of training were not easily accessible. We can understand how the profession has changed over the past forty years.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also help us by spreading the word! Use the Indiegogo share tools to share far and wide about this campaign.

 

Special Thank You

We are extending a special thank you to our two corporate sponsors for this book. Carr McLean and Flume Media Archiving have both generously donated funds for the completion of the project. We truly appreciate the support!
