story:
We will be printing a limited edition of "The Little Prince” by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry, using historic letterpress technology at the TYPA studio. As an artist-run initiative to gather and care for historic printing presses, we will be combining this unique technology and one of the most notable stories ever published. Using historic craftsmanship in homage to the original edition from 1943 will result in a book truly like no other.

 

THE PROCESS

Several legacy technologies and machines will be used, which date back to the early 20th century. Relying on equipment which predates computerized automation and demands both intuition and skill from the operator is our way of connecting with the author. Saint-Exupéry is today known for his books, but his true passion was the skies. While our presses do not take flight, we know of the struggle to control the machinery.

The text of the book will be cast line by line from molten lead using a Linotype typecasting machine. Once the workhorse of all printing houses, the Linotype is like a giant typewriter, that operates to a constant clicking of little brass matrices, each a mold for a single letter. One by one the matrices are assembled by key presses, formed into a line, cast into lead and then re-sorted back into their places. The intricate machinery behind this has fascinated enthusiasts then and now, and many would still argue the Linotype to be one of the finest examples of engineering.

 

Illustrations will be initially digitized for clean-up and then etched onto metal plates with acid, utilizing a technology known as photozincography. This process dates back to the middle of the 19th century and was one of the earliest methods of producing exact printing plates from film. The etched plates are nailed onto wooden blocks to raise them to the same height as the lead lines from the Linotype machine.

 

The cast lines and metal plates will be assembled into pages in precise layout. Care has to be taken to place pages in the correct order for later folding, to calculate the margins and gutters. Neither millimeters nor inches are used for this job, as all layout units are instead based on the typographical units of points, picas or quads. The assembled pages, the printing forme, will be fed into a cylinder press, where a central steel cylinder will roll over the letters to create an impression on the paper.

 

The sheer direct pressure imparted on the paper will leave characteristic embossing and marks that are witness to an imprecise technology. While in many ways inferior to modern offset or digital printing, letterpress has its own merits. Not only will the occasional defect be felt with your fingertips, one could also claim that the print is richer in intensity and therefore easier to read. While personal taste differs, letterpress printed texts have a distinctly different character from other technologies.

 

 

THE BOOKS

We offer the book in three variants with an added option of joining us for a private workshop and a chance to participate in the making of your own copy.

Letterpress edition: a limited edition letterpress printed copy of the book, individually numbered and cloth bound, including a little prince on the front over and a four color dust jacket.

 

Collector’s edition: the same printed edition, bound by hand using colorful thread, including marbled endpapers and a binders mark in addition to the other characteristics of letterpress printing.

 

Exclusive gift edition: based on the collector’s edition, the exclusive gift edition will feature an extra title page with letterpress printed dedication. The text of the dedication can be up to 50 characters long using Latin script and will be typeset entirely by hand. When choosing this option, please do get in touch with us to send us your dedication.

 

Hands-on edition: the book in this edition is the same as the exclusive gift edition, but we also invite you to a private workshop at TYPA. You will meet the team and participate in the making of your copy. While most of the work will have been done by this time, you get to typeset and print your own dedication, try your hand at marbling and bookbinding. We will agree on the final schedule and activities together to ensure a unique experience. If there's a special person you want to take along, we will more than encourage this!

Please note: the price includes the book and the private workshop, but no travels or accommodation. These have to be arranged and paid by yourself, though we can of course provide advice.

 

ABOUT TYPA

Here at TYPA studio, we gather and care for historic letterpress technology. We are a non-profit organization born out of passion for technology and strive to keep alive crafts that have been mostly lost to automation.

In addition to printing limited edition works, we host guided tours, run courses and workshops, coordinate an international artist in residence program and collaborate with professionals from around the world.

The proceeds from this and other future book projects will be used to fund our ongoing activities, such as preservation, maintenance and research of legacy equipment with historic value, and educational outreach programs.
story_txt: We will be printing a limited edition of "The Little Prince” by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry, using historic letterpress technology at the TYPA studio. As an artist-run initiative to gather and care for historic printing presses, we will be combining this unique technology and one of the most notable stories ever published. Using historic craftsmanship in homage to the original edition from 1943 will result in a book truly like no other. THE PROCESSSeveral legacy technologies and machines will be used, which date back to the early 20th century. Relying on equipment which predates computerized automation and demands both intuition and skill from the operator is our way of connecting with the author. Saint-Exupéry is today known for his books, but his true passion was the skies. While our presses do not take flight, we know of the struggle to control the machinery.The text of the book will be cast line by line from molten lead using a Linotype typecasting machine. Once the workhorse of all printing houses, the Linotype is like a giant typewriter, that operates to a constant clicking of little brass matrices, each a mold for a single letter. One by one the matrices are assembled by key presses, formed into a line, cast into lead and then re-sorted back into their places. The intricate machinery behind this has fascinated enthusiasts then and now, and many would still argue the Linotype to be one of the finest examples of engineering. Illustrations will be initially digitized for clean-up and then etched onto metal plates with acid, utilizing a technology known as photozincography. This process dates back to the middle of the 19th century and was one of the earliest methods of producing exact printing plates from film. The etched plates are nailed onto wooden blocks to raise them to the same height as the lead lines from the Linotype machine. The cast lines and metal plates will be assembled into pages in precise layout. Care has to be taken to place pages in the correct order for later folding, to calculate the margins and gutters. Neither millimeters nor inches are used for this job, as all layout units are instead based on the typographical units of points, picas or quads. The assembled pages, the printing forme, will be fed into a cylinder press, where a central steel cylinder will roll over the letters to create an impression on the paper. The sheer direct pressure imparted on the paper will leave characteristic embossing and marks that are witness to an imprecise technology. While in many ways inferior to modern offset or digital printing, letterpress has its own merits. Not only will the occasional defect be felt with your fingertips, one could also claim that the print is richer in intensity and therefore easier to read. While personal taste differs, letterpress printed texts have a distinctly different character from other technologies.  THE BOOKSWe offer the book in three variants with an added option of joining us for a private workshop and a chance to participate in the making of your own copy.Letterpress edition: a limited edition letterpress printed copy of the book, individually numbered and cloth bound, including a little prince on the front over and a four color dust jacket. Collector’s edition: the same printed edition, bound by hand using colorful thread, including marbled endpapers and a binders mark in addition to the other characteristics of letterpress printing. Exclusive gift edition: based on the collector’s edition, the exclusive gift edition will feature an extra title page with letterpress printed dedication. The text of the dedication can be up to 50 characters long using Latin script and will be typeset entirely by hand. When choosing this option, please do get in touch with us to send us your dedication. Hands-on edition: the book in this edition is the same as the exclusive gift edition, but we also invite you to a private workshop at TYPA. You will meet the team and participate in the making of your copy. While most of the work will have been done by this time, you get to typeset and print your own dedication, try your hand at marbling and bookbinding. We will agree on the final schedule and activities together to ensure a unique experience. If there's a special person you want to take along, we will more than encourage this!Please note: the price includes the book and the private workshop, but no travels or accommodation. These have to be arranged and paid by yourself, though we can of course provide advice. ABOUT TYPAHere at TYPA studio, we gather and care for historic letterpress technology. We are a non-profit organization born out of passion for technology and strive to keep alive crafts that have been mostly lost to automation.In addition to printing limited edition works, we host guided tours, run courses and workshops, coordinate an international artist in residence program and collaborate with professionals from around the world.The proceeds from this and other future book projects will be used to fund our ongoing activities, such as preservation, maintenance and research of legacy equipment with historic value, and educational outreach programs.

story:
Short Summary

Tin House Summer Writer's Workshop is like the most amazing semester of Creative Fiction you could ever hope to take, complete with a rock star line up of instructors, all squished in to a week. They also put out one of the finest, regularaly anthologized literary journals, and operate a press which publishes the acclaimed "Tin House New Voices" series.

There were over 600 applicants this year and, based on the strength of my writing sample, I was one accepted. However, I wasn't a recipent of one of the eight scholarships. I could use a little help... 

What We Need & What You Get

Here's the break down:

*The conference is $1675, which includes room and board

*A plane ticket from Long Beach to Portland is $265

*I'm asking for help with $1500 (which is more like $1300 after crowd funding takes its cut) and will freelance my behind off to cover the rest

*In return for your help, I want to give back (see perks over there --->)

The Impact

Look, I know there are a lot bigger problems in the world than a 37 year old mother of 6 with two fistfuls of talent and a dream to get to a writing conference; but I think it's also a beautiful thing to live in a world where we can focus on more than where our next meal will come from, where we can produce and share in the written word and the human experience, and where we can help each other out with a few dollars here and there to make a dream come true.

Giving  to my project will take me to the next level as a writer, inspire me to finish the novella I started last year, and connect me to other talented literary folk moving in the same direction as myself.

***Any money earned above my goal will go to purchase books for the local woman's shelter or contributed to Books for Africa.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, I'll still love you forever. Thanks for reading and maybe share this if you can?

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
My Story

My name is Brock Picken, and I'm a writer, interviewer, and storyteller. Two years ago I was miserable, feeling lost, and floated from one career to the next, wondering if I would ever find a way to be happy. While having a heart-to-heart talk with my wife, I realized that it was, and always had been baseball that was my biggest passion.  A short time thereafter, I was presented with the opportunity to host my own baseball talk-show, called “The Dugout”. Over the course of a year, I interviewed media legends like Dan Shulman, World Series Champs such as Matt Stairs, Roberto Alomar, and Cito Gaston, and numerous other exciting guests. My show re-ignited my passion for baseball, and so now I have decided to fulfill a childhood dream. The decision I made next, was something I had longed to do since taking a creative writing course in high school, which was to write a book.

The Book

This book – this campaign, is the next step, and a very important one for me, towards a career in baseball. This is an opportunity for me to seize a dream, and create something special for baseball lovers and story lovers alike. This book will be a compilation of many unique stories based on interviews I conduct with current and former MLB professional players, female professional players from the AAGPBL (1943-1954), and a few special guests, such as Babe Ruth’s Granddaughter, Linda Ruth Tosetti. I have connected with George Castle, a baseball historian and author of 11 baseball books. He has covered baseball for 35 seasons, based in Chicago. George will be my historical reference for the book.  

What I Need

I’ve been presented with the rare and incredible opportunity to attend and cover, as accredited media personnel, three separate baseball events this season. In Kansas City, The Negro League Baseball Museum will be having their inaugural “Hall of Game Ceremony”, inducting their first ever “Hall of Famers”. In St. Louis, the Cardinals organization with be unveiling their new Hall of Fame Museum in their Ballpark Village, for which I have been invited to the Ribbon-cutting Ceremony. And in Iowa, The Field of Dreams Movie Site (made famous by Kevin Costner) is hosting their Team of Dreams Event, a charity softball tournament that last year had 14 former Major League Baseball stars (including 10 Hall of Famers) participate. I will be conducting interviews at each of these events for my book.

The funds being raised will go to cover the cost of:

 - Travel

 - Accommodations

 - Audio & Video Equipment Purchase/Rental

 - Book Cover Layout & Design

 - Costs associated with editing & publishing

What You Get

Through the generosity of several amazing people, I’ve been able to provide you with some kick-ass rewards. I’m offering exclusive peeks at video and audio recordings of some of the interviews as well as an opportunity to be a guest on my podcast. Also, for the baseball memorabilia collector, there are some amazing pieces donated such as baseballs autographed by Fergie Jenkins and Matt Stairs. Linda Ruth Tosetti (Babe Ruth’s Granddaughter) has autographed some baseballs and prints, and I’m also including some unique, limited edition Blue Jays prints from Chris Ripley at www.BlueJaysArt.ca.

The Impact

This isn’t about making money, traveling, or selling a ton of books. This is about living a dream, and inviting you to be a part of the process in creating something unique and special. This is also about inspiring others to go after their dreams. I'm really just a regular guy. But I have an incredible passion for baseball, and in just a short time I have accomplished so much, interviewing some of the most recognizable names in the sport. With your help, I can accomplish so much more, and share some incredible baseball stories that the world hasn't heard yet. You can help this regular guy do something extraordinary. 

Even if you decide not to back this, you can still help me.

The only way ideas spread are if those who are moved by them share them, one person at a time. If you decide not to back my project, but would still like to see my book made, please consider sharing this project with those you know would be interested, and please consider using the Indiegogo share tools to spread it on Facebook, Twitter, and other social media sites. It would mean so much to me. Also, please leave your comments below, I’d love to hear from you.

story:
Somos un equipo de comunicadores apasionados por la historia de superación y constancia de Inés Melchor. Desde inicios del 2015, venimos registrando diversos momentos de su preparación rumbo a Río 2016.

Buscamos recaudar fondos para la realización de la película ya que "Prueba de fondo" nos parece una historia que merece ser contada. Durante 15 años, Inés Melchor se colgó medallas en diversas competencias de larga distancia en las que participó representando al Perú.  Ahora deberá enfrentar su mayor desafío: subir al podio olímpico. 

Con tu contribución podremos realizar, de forma óptima, el documental que acompañará a Inés en la prueba deportiva que paralizará no sólo un país. Un continente estará detrás de ella.

Financiamiento

Los 30000 dólares de financiamiento serán destinados exclusivamente a los días de rodaje que están pendientes. Tanto los días de entrenamiento en Lima y Huancayo, fechas previas a las Olimpiadas, y la semana que corresponde a la maratón olímpica de Río de Janeiro. Con la contribución cubriremos costos de viaje, estadía y alquiler de equipos.

El equipo de producción está sosteniendo diversas reuniones con instituciones que podrían estar interesadas en auspiciar el proyecto, de manera que el documental se realice aún si no llegásemos a la meta planteada.

Impacto 

Con tu contribución podremos poner en valor la historia de una peruana que a través de su esfuerzo y tenacidad ha logrado los mayores lauros para el Perú. Por primera vez, se realiza una película sobre una de las disciplinas que mayor cantidad de personas practican en nuestro país, y que, sin embargo, no ha tenido una fuerte atención de parte de los medios masivos tradicionales.


Riesgos y desafíos


Nuestro mayor desafío es obtener el financiamiento que requerimos. Llevamos cerca un año de filmación, siendo todo autofinanciado. Sin embargo, lograr acompañar a Inés a las Olimpiadas es la parte mas complicada del camino. Sabemos que de un modo u otro lograremos nuestro objetivo.

Otras formas de contribuir 

Cualquier contribución será de gran ayuda para nuestro proyecto. No importa la cantidad. Depende de ti que podamos acompañar a una de nuestras mejores atletas en el camino a la consagración olímpica en Río de Janeiro.
Comparte el link del proyecto con todos tus amigos y conocidos, queremos que todo el mundo conozca este proyecto, que busca visibilizar el esfuerzo de una atleta de élite que corre por el honor sin buscar recompensas .
Usa las herramientas de Indiegogo para compartir nuestra historia.

story:
Experimental Film Society

Experimental Film Society is an independent filmmaking collective that produces, screens, promotes, and archives films by its members. This international organisation has been active since 2000, and based in Dublin, Ireland since 2004 where it has become the centre of a new wave of Irish experimental filmmaking. Its founder and director is noted underground filmmaker Rouzbeh Rashidi. 

The work of its nine current members is distinguished by an uncompromising devotion to personal, experimental cinema. They have in common an exploratory approach to filmmaking, and their films foreground mood, atmosphere, visual rhythms, the interplay of sound and picture, and the nature and subjectivity of the image. These films have been widely screened in cinemas, festivals and art venues around the world. The radical creative vision that animates the collective has been recognised as a distinctive and sometimes challenging force in contemporary alternative cinema.

experimentalfilmsociety.com

facebook.com/experimentalfilmsociety

 

 

Luminous Void

Over the past two years, Rashidi has been gathering material for Luminous Void, a book-length history of EFS and the ideas behind it. This insightful series of essays, documents and in-depth interviews with EFS members is now ready for publication! All that’s needed is funding to cover the costs of designing and printing the book. 

We’re asking you to become a part of this project through helping us take the last steps in documenting a significant contribution to contemporary underground culture. 

This fully illustrated volume will contain:

  • An account of the history of EFS from its inception in turn-of-the-millenium Iran through its development into a fully international organisation.
  • An article on EFS cinema by renowned film critic Adrian Martin.
  • An introductory essay by Dublin-based curators Alice Butler and Daniel Fitzpatrick of AEMI (Artists’ and Experimental Moving Image).
  • EFS Statements: the manifesto behind the movies.
  • An in-depth interview with EFS founder and director Rouzbeh Rashidi.
  • An interview with EFS members Esperanza Collado, Michael Higgins, Dean Kavanagh, Maximilian Le Cain and Atoosa Pour Hosseini.
  • Things Said Once, text of a performance/lecture by Esperanza Collado.
  • A Few Thoughts on the Moving Image, reflections on the responsibilities of making experimental films in the 21st century by Maximilian Le Cain.  
  • A statement on contemporary alternative cinema by Daniel Fawcett and Clara Pais of The Underground Film Studio, a sister organisation to EFS.

 

 

How You Can Help!

In order to place this book in your hands, we need:

  • To design the volume. Typographer Borna Izadpanah will be applying his expertise to the look and layout of Luminous Void.
  • To commission a special cover image from Pouya Ahmadi, a noted graphic designer and former EFS member.
  • To cover the print costs of the volume.

In return for your assistance, we are happy to offer downloads of EFS films, copies of the book, and to include your name on Luminous Void’s acknowledgements page, making you an integral part of the project.   

Please share this campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools and help us add EFS to the annals of film history.

story:
Positive is an international forum platform founded in 2007 by Giacomo Cosua, together with Marco Folin and Livio Chiodega.

“Our  idea was to create an online space where people can find great pieces of journalism, amazing photos and projects, all aimed at embodying one fundamental element: quality”.

Our goal was to create an arena that allows different viewpoints around the world to be presented comprehensively.

From 2007 until today, we have been focusing on few but important keywords:

1) Creativity
2) Independence
3) Quality

(our first cover, featuring Paul Watson, Founder of Sea Shepherd)

WHAT WE HAVE WORKED ON SO FAR

We first launched Positive as a PDF-formatted Magazine whose contents were entirely free for anyone to download, and we have in fact been keeping them free for everyone ever since.

In 2008 we started the website www.positive-magazine.com, and in 2013 we decided to expand our content offers by creating a new platform for our Italian readers (www.italy.positive-magazine.com)

Until today, 14 issues have been released online, which contain thousands of pages featuring interviews, photographs, critical reviews and overviews on various projects from all over the world.

In may 2015, at Bruno Bookshop in Venice, during the opening of the International Art Biennale, we presented our first print issue, which lately has been worldwide distributed and sold from New York to Melbourne.

WHAT YOU CAN FIND INSIDE POSITIVE:

Photography: You can find interviews with established young photographers, reviews and presentations of innovative and unreleased projects, plus one or more focuses on new trends.

Reportage: Initially set up as an ad-hoc project, these pieces talk about various international topics both chosen by the editorial staff and suggested by the contributors’ network of POSI+TIVE.

Art: Reviews and interviews with emerging artists together with particular attention to Italian and overseas events.

Design&Architecture: Interviews and reviews concerning emerging and established designers and architects.

Fashion: Realization of interviews, reviews and editorials dedicated to Italian and foreign fashion and emerging stylists, with a special focus on the Made-in-Italy.

Street Culture: Here the readers can find a showcase with the latest trends and cultural models concerning new medias, music and sports.


FACTS:

1) We distributed more than 2.000 articles online on our 2 websites from 2007 onwards.

2) On Issuu, one of the most important platforms for online magazines, we have gained almost 2.000.000 views on our 14 editions.

3) We covered significant affairs all around the world:

a. The Arab spring for instance, documenting the revolution which took place in Egypt day by day.

b. Cultural events, such as the Venice Film Festival, The Venice Art & Architecture Biennale, the G20 in Canada, The Cop21 in Paris, the international design week in Milan and many others.

c. The Fashion weeks all around the world, ranging from Milan, Paris, Berlin to London, showing the backstage scenes and the shows of the most noteworthy and emerging brands.

4) Social Media activity: With more than 26.000 likes on Facebook, we keep our followers updated everyday with new articles and all the other contents we have been creating.

story:
In 2006, after a tumultuous but fascinating life, Samer Alshaibi left this world. He was 28 years old. Before his death he entrusted me with a pile of manuscripts and asked that I make sure they are given an audience.

From within the walls of an Illinois prison he scribbled an otherworldly novel. An escape from the stark testosterone saturated environment of lock-up, Moths and Flowers is a lush exploration of the world of a lithe female protagonist. The descriptions within are both beautiful and terrifying. Heady Islamic motifs blend with a dense and tangible corporeality.

In addition to the novel Samer penned a number of surreal short stories in his final two years of life, all ripe with the whimsy and horror of classic fairytales. He left us a legacy of poetic treasures, and now I need your help to collect all of it together in one book. This is my gift to my beloved brother-in-law, but also to readers who wish to know the talent behind the intense eyes and overflowing charm. Anyone who knew him will tell you that he made an indelible impression. The same is true of his writing.

Your donation will allow you entry into this literary adventure. All contributors will get a copy of the book (be it the eBook version or a beautiful hardbound limited edition). The more donations received, the higher quality the final product, and the more copies will be available in bookstores and on-line. If the full fundraising goal is met, I will hire a professional editor to pull together the very best presentation of Samer’s novel, short stories, and a few equally beautiful letters written to family and friends.

Those who were close to Samer may also include a note in the final publication.

Excerpts from Moths and Flowers:

“We have heavy Siberian Black hair, long and wicked. We have Horrid Big eyes because there is something wrong with us. We have Purgatory Grey irises, though my pupils are perennially contracted inherited from my lulled, decaying father. We have the Wandering Arab skin stretched on brittle body. We have wistful hair above our Suffocated Blue Dry lips implying a smear of dirt. We have an arch shoving our lower back forward saying we are offering our little belly or our little butt but I think we are not. We have the Mongolian Purple aureoles besieging the Sudanese Purple nipples surmounting boyish bumps. Her cunt is concave, mine convex; hers suggests entry, mine irritation. Our mouth is wide and queer and lurid. I have one fang among my upper teeth. It is on the left. I tease it with my tongue. Our face is religiously pretty though the whole theme synthesized with our body exalts us to a thing profane.”

“A tinier girl than my present smallness I stretched on the bed my playful, scabby limbs I implored this god for a micro act for a micro girl. A very fair request if one knows what fair is. Or cares. There and then heavy epileptic jolts shook those limbs. A superfluous answer for a tiny query and a puny girl, I might say. I will say. Did He not consider how fragile I was and how huge I know He must be?”

story:
Many of us work hard, spend wisely and try to 'save for a rainy day'. But at times a financial setback can leave us just too "close to the edge".  Close to half of working Americans are eligible for financial helping hand ups from nonprofit programs—often your neighbor, maybe you! 

    Each year we Americans donate more than $40 billion to nonprofit programs earmarked to help those of us who need just a little bit of help to 'stay even' that month.  A Hand Up, not a handout ,..so someone working hard can have enough money for gas to get to work,  the roof over their head AND food on the table.

   So why aren't the eligible applying?  Millions of folks believe they're ineligible because they work! Or because they have no kids, or are single.  Many don't know even programs exist.  There are over 130,000 nonprofits that lend a helping hand to those of us on thin ice' financially... lists and lists online of hundreds of programs offering almost anything a family needs.  So how does any individual or family find and apply to the right 25-30 programs?!

Do you know what 250% of Federal Poverty Level means?

    Neither do many millions of eligible Americans!  No book and very few websites provide much-needed guidance.  When my kids and I were homeless due to unpaid child support, I was a nonprofit grant writer...so I already knew where to look, how to apply.  But still I was sometimes confused by the process!  With this as a navigation tool,  today's 'middle class' (those earning appx. $12K-$52K a year) can find as many as 30 programs from among the thousands which specifically 'fit'  family needs, size, income level, accurately submit application paperwork.  

     

     Remember, these are Hand ups--not handouts. Not government assistance. These are dollars donated purposely to help others to get back up or to stay up on their feet...

    When guided to find these dollars, eligible families can access $1,000s per person.  For example:  Counselors trained by The Ohio Benefit Bank have helped Ohio residents access an average of more than $4,500 per person. 

Together we can distribute this powerful navigation tool!

Pledge your support, OR simply Email the campaign URL to friends and family!
We are relying on the passion and caring of people like you to spread the word.
_________________________

    Today's hungry working-poor are not the stark images we see of people living under bridges in cardboard boxes.  These are often your neighbors, co-workers...  The costs for two very basic needs—housing and driving to/from work—have risen greatly in recent years. But incomes have not!  So Americans have less income for "wealth-building" such as short- and long-term savings!  Good people working hard, yet barely financially getting by, unable to save, paycheck-to-paycheck. In these homes, a large car repair or brief family medical issue can change whether there's food in their frig—or not.    

Why This Book is Needed More than Ever

    In 1980 there were only a few hundred food banks; today there are over 50,000. The need is there—working people forced to line their pockets with toiletries from work or food from social events to keep clean and feed their hungry kids—just like I did. 

   This book is needed also because financially hurting families can't just 'push a button' to get the help they need!  Before each nonprofit can give away $200, $500, $1000, they must obtain proof of eligibility; they must follow rules—including some IRS rules!  And those of us who donate to the nonprofits want to know our dollars were used wisely! This HowTo book provides detailed instructions  to efficiently submit accurate applications the first time.

Almost 1 in 3 kids goes to bed hungry some nights...like mine did (that's my son, who's now a young adult!) ...simply because their parents can't find the help that is out there.  My unique personal experience and professional expertise can guide parents to assistance for the sports teams, the tutoring, the summer camps that help grow successful adults. (Yes this book can help find and apply for free tutoring, low cost braces...and so much more!)  In this book I share every detail I learned, everything you need—so other kids can have a better, kinder childhood than mine did.

Many of us work hard, spend wisely and try to 'save for a rainy day'. But at times a financial setback can leave us just too "close to the edge".  Close to half of working Americans are eligible for financial helping hand ups from nonprofit programs—often your neighbor, maybe you!     Each year we Americans donate more than $40 billion to nonprofit programs earmarked to help those of us who need just a little bit of help to 'stay even' that month.  A Hand Up, not a handout ,..so someone working hard can have enough money for gas to get to work,  the roof over their head AND food on the table.   So why aren't the eligible applying?  Millions of folks believe they're ineligible because they work! Or because they have no kids, or are single.  Many don't know even programs exist.  There are over 130,000 nonprofits that lend a helping hand to those of us on thin ice' financially... lists and lists online of hundreds of programs offering almost anything a family needs.  So how does any individual or family find and apply to the right 25-30 programs?!Do you know what 250% of Federal Poverty Level means?     Neither do many millions of eligible Americans!  No book and very few websites provide much-needed guidance.  When my kids and I were homeless due to unpaid child support, I was a nonprofit grant writer...so I already knew where to look, how to apply.  But still I was sometimes confused by the process!  With this as a navigation tool,  today's 'middle class' (those earning appx. $12K-$52K a year) can find as many as 30 programs from among the thousands which specifically 'fit'  family needs, size, income level, accurately submit application paperwork.             Remember, these are Hand ups--not handouts. Not government assistance. These are dollars donated purposely to help others to get back up or to stay up on their feet...     When guided to find these dollars, eligible families can access $1,000s per person.  For example:  Counselors trained by The Ohio Benefit Bank have helped Ohio residents access an average of more than $4,500 per person.  Together we can distribute this powerful navigation tool! story:
WHO: Author & Privacy Expert

My name is Frank M. Ahearn I am the author of How to Disappear & The Digital Hit Man. My books are considered the leading books in the world of privacy and personal freedom. I work with victims of stalkers and individuals who need help with unfortunate digital issues. I also travel the world sharing my ideas and thoughts about the future of privacy.

WHAT: How to Disappear From BIG BROTHER

I planned on publishing my new book How to Disappear From BIG BROTHER with a traditional publisher. However, after much thought about the current state of privacy in the world I believe my book would be best served if I write without any publisher interference and make it affordable to all.

THE PLAN:

To release How to Disappear From BIG BROTHER and make it affordable to all. I will release the book and download it at a standard retail price and after ninety days I will reduce the digital download to $0.99 and the softcover book for under $7.99. For eternity!

WHY:

Because privacy matters! If you know what NSA stands for you know we are losing our privacy quite rapidly. My new books teaches people how to be more private in a world where the government is violating our privacy. 

MORE:

The first draft of the manuscript has been completed. I will use the 20,000 euros for an editor, an interior book designer and cover design. 

SAMPLE: Removing Yourself From The Digital Connections

Imagine it’s a Friday night and you are at the school dance and you make the mistake of asking the bully’s significant other to dance. The bully finds out and you are dead meat. The next few days the bully tries hunting you down but you avoided capture. As the saying goes you cannot run forever.

The following week you are delivering pizza and as you pull up to the house that ordered the pie you discover it is the home of the bully. Ringing the bell leads to the losing of teeth and not delivering the pizza results in teenage unemployment. 

The question is how does the teen go about delivering the pizza without getting beat up. Ideally it would be best to get another delivery person to deliver the pie, however, the teen cannot go back to the pizza shop and ask another delivery person. 

The answer is quite simple. The teen rolls up to the schoolyard and convinces another teen to deliver the pizza for the tip money. The bully gets the pizza, the pizza shop gets the money, the schoolyard teen gets the tip and the teen keep his teeth. The resolution is the act of being a "Virtual Zentity" which is removing one’s self from danger or capture.

This simple analogy is exactly what people who disappear deal with each moment of their day. Think about the society we live in, the digital surveillance, the cell phone surveillance and the camera surveillance in public and private places. We typically assume only big brother has access to these databases, however, that is untrue. A private investigator with a good source or a skip trace with a good pretext can access the private information.

People who disappear tend to rush into or not think through the process of disappearing and such is the their downfall. Disappearing is more than going from point A to point B. It is about evolving into the Cool Hand Luke of disappearing, but also embracing a mindset and philosophy, hence the name ZEN-ENTITY.

In the example above, Ringing the bully’s doorbell would create a connection between the teen and bully. In the world of disappearing, the doorbell represents anything and everything digital. The minute you press a button, be it send, enter or download, you have created a connection that can be traced. The new philosophy I proffer is to remove yourself from the trail or at the very least consciously control the footprints you leave behind on the digital trail.

story:
¿Qué?

Aquellas galletas de canela habla acerca del aprendizaje, del crecimiento personal, de la amistad y de la entrega a los demás.

Ágata es una chica sin demasiadas amistades. Su tía Amelia es, de hecho, su profesora y su única amiga. Con ella habla de literatura y de amores próximos y lejanos, y así se establece entre ellas una relación de amistad que crece cada vez más. En sus encuentros comentan extractos literarios de grandes autores. Estas referencias sirven como reflejo para ellas, que sufren las mismas dolencias y los mismos pesares que los héroes literarios universales caracterizados a lo largo de los siglos. De pronto, un día, Ágata decide aprender a tocar la vieja guitarra de su tía y todo cambia.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de publicar obras poco convencionales pero de indudable calidad, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para promocionar cada título cuando esta todavía se encuentra en proceso de edición.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Cristian Olivé.

Licenciado en Filología, ha enfocado su carrera hacia el mundo de la docencia. Como profesor de secundaria en un instituto, imparte la materia de Lengua y Literatura con constancia y dedicación. Es un entusiasta lector y procura contagiar esta pasión en sus clases mediante actividades que a menudo traspasan la barrera de la literatura convencional. A menudo comparte sus experiencias educativas a través de las redes sociales, lo que ha provocado, en alguna ocasión, que los medios de comunicación se hayan hecho eco de sus innovaciones pedagógicas. Desde muy joven, buena parte de su tiempo libre lo ha dedicado a escribir de manera incansable.

Aquellas galletas de canela es su primera novela con la que culmina la unión de sus dos grandes pasiones: la enseñanza y la literatura.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«—Sigues esperándolo —dije sin pensar.
          —Jamás pretendí lo contrario. Un día encontré el amor y al otro lo perdí.
          Supuse que no había más que añadir. No pude evitar imaginarme a mi tía durante todos estos años. Esperando a alguien que jamás regresaría. Idealizando aquella breve historia de amor. Disponía solo de una carta cuyo contenido era más bien difuso, y de una fotografía vieja en un paraje paradisíaco. Ahora ya irreal. Todo se había desvanecido. No quedaba nada más que un recuerdo fugaz e idealizado. Un instante en la memoria que no podía dilatarse porque ya no significaba nada. 
          —Me da rabia —dije de nuevo sin medir mis palabras—. No has rehecho tu vida por haber idealizado a Jamie.
          —Creo que te equivocas, Ágata, y me duele decírtelo porque ojalá fuera como dices. Nunca vi a Jamie como el hombre perfecto de quien podía enamorarme. No lo he idealizado a él; he idealizado lo que hubo entre nosotros. Me obligué a creer que no habría nadie mejor con quien pasar el resto de mi vida. Me ensimismé y ahora ya es tarde.
          —¿Te arrepientes?
          —No».

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 880€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Aviso para navegantes: La opción BACK IT es únicamente para realizar donaciones a la edición, por lo que no habrá comunicaciones posteriores en busca de datos de envío... cualquiera de las opciones válidas de reserva exige cumplimentar formulario para poder servir el pedido.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Cristian Olivé vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

¿Qué?
Aquellas galletas de canela habla acerca del aprendizaje, del crecimiento personal, de la amistad y de la entrega a los demás.
Ágata es una chica sin demasiadas amistades. Su tía Amelia es, de hecho, su profesora y su única amiga. Con ella habla de literatura y de amores próximos y lejanos, y así se establece entre ellas una relación de amistad que crece cada vez más. En sus encuentros comentan extractos literarios de grandes autores. Estas referencias sirven como reflejo para ellas, que sufren las mismas dolencias y los mismos pesares que los héroes literarios universales caracterizados a lo largo de los siglos. De pronto, un día, Ágata decide aprender a tocar la vieja guitarra de su tía y todo cambia.
¿Quiénes?
Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de publicar obras poco convencionales pero de indudable calidad, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para promocionar cada título cuando esta todavía se encuentra en proceso de edición.

Hoy te presentamos a Cristian Olivé.
Licenciado en Filología, ha enfocado su carrera hacia el mundo de la docencia. Como profesor de secundaria en un instituto, imparte la materia de Lengua y Literatura con constancia y dedicación. Es un entusiasta lector y procura contagiar esta pasión en sus clases mediante actividades que a menudo traspasan la barrera de la literatura convencional. A menudo comparte sus experiencias educativas a través de las redes sociales, lo que ha provocado, en alguna ocasión, que los medios de comunicación se hayan hecho eco de sus innovaciones pedagógicas. Desde muy joven, buena parte de su tiempo libre lo ha dedicado a escribir de manera incansable.
Aquellas galletas de canela es su primera novela con la que culmina la unión de sus dos grandes pasiones: la enseñanza y la literatura.

story:
I ENCOURAGE YOU TO WATCH THE VIDEO PROVIDED OF LAST YEAR'S CONTESTANT PLATFORM SPEECHES. LISTEN TO WHAT WE, AS A COMMUNITY FIGHT FOR EVERYDAY.

My name is Jennifer Kumiyama. I am a former Ms. Wheelchair California for 2010 and now the State Coordinator for the Ms. Wheelchair California Foundation. In January I will be hosting my second state pageant to find Ms. Wheelchair California 2014 at The Hilton Hotel Long Beach.

My goal is to stand by The Ms. Wheelchair California Foundation's mission: to recognize and celebrate women of achievement who use wheelchairs. This pageant defies traditional pageants by focusing on contestants’ achievements, advocacy efforts, communication skills and presentation style. This unique organization provides the titleholder with the platform to advocate, educate and motivate the state government and public to view people with disabilities as “people first.” This is accomplished through having the titleholder serve on various municipal and state committees and commissions that develop policies for the disabled community. The titleholder also attends various events such as conferences, forums, parades, festivals, corporate awareness events and grade school and university empathy events across California.

This past year, Ms. Wheelchair California 2013 - Margarita Elizondo has continued the tradition of the title holders before her, including traveling to The Ms. Wheelchair America Pageant in Houston, Texas! She did very well and we are so proud of her. Little Miss Wheelchair California 2013 - Lourdes Mack has been very busy this year, motivating youth with disabilities all over California. Our ladies work very hard to empower the disability community!

My passion for doing this begins as far back as my early childhood. I've been in a wheelchair all of my life. I have limited mobility in all of my limbs, leaving me dependent on assistance for most or all of my daily living needs. I was faced with obstacles everydayand even kept in special education classes though it was ot necessary for me to be there. I missed out on a few field trips because school busses with lifts cost too much and there was no funding. My parents were my advocates, and it was difficult for them. It wasn't until The ADA was signed in 1990, that I learned my rights. I was 10 and I transferred myself into a regular education classroom. Growing up with those hardhips made me want to advocate for the rights of others like me - who might not have the ability to (literally) speak for themselves. I want to provide my community, the disability community, with Ms. Wheelchair California - someone who will continually strive to break attitudinal barriers and stigmas of our community. She will be our strong voice to remind societ that disability rights ARE civil rights.

I realize that in today's economic situation, giving money isn't something we can do freely. I'm asking that you consider making a donation - regardless of the amount. Every dollar helps. Please help me by contributing and by spreading the word about The 2014 Ms. Wheelchair California Leadership Forum and Pageant. Thank you all so much!

story:
¿Qué?

En los ojos de Carmen hace justicia a varias generaciones de mujeres que sufrieron las consecuencias de la sociedad franquista: clasismo, machismo y supremacía católica...

Carmen es una niña, después adolescente, más tarde joven mujer, que ha nacido a finales de los años cuarenta en una familia bien española que trata de darle todo lo mejor que ellos entienden pueden entregarle y enseñarle. A través de las distintas etapas de las edades de Carmen y, también, a través de sus ojos de mirada inocente, vemos sus condicionamientos y los de otras mujeres por haber nacido en aquella época. Conocemos la España del franquismo siempre desde sus ojos muy abiertos y curiosos que observan el entorno sin juzgarlo ni tampoco acabar de entenderlo. Eso sí, intentando siempre encontrarle un significado que nos va exponiendo desde un inocente y amable sentido del humor, que te hará reír con ganas muchas veces a lo largo de la lectura.

Y esto es lo que nos comenta Pilar Manso, filóloga clásica y actriz, acerca de En los ojos de Carmen.

Cuando Constanza Rúa, muy generosa, me permitió leer el manuscrito de su obra sucedió que me quedé fascinada y también reconocida en la mirada de la protagonista, limpia y, a su pesar, verazmente crítica. Los ojos de Carmen, abiertos y redondos, como un agujero negro que atrapa todo cuanto sucede en su entorno, son también los ojos de la niña o niño que todos hemos sido y que somos en alguna esquina del corazón. La inocencia de esa mirada infantil llega a ser devastadora desde su objetividad imparcial reflejando con un fino humor lleno de candor, las formas y las esencias de una sociedad rígida, estrecha, pacata, mezquina.

Partimos de 1950 para llegar a la década de los setenta creciendo con la protagonista, una niña de familia bien de provincias, imaginativa, sensible e inteligente; un espíritu libre al que los cambios y libertades sociales le alcanzan siempre con retraso. Retrato fidedigno (como sino lo pretendiera) de la sociedad española del franquismo con sus abrumadoras diferencias de clase, su sexismo, su machismo, su estrechez de miras, su catolicismo manipulador y mal entendido, su actitud represiva, sus miserias morales y sus déficits culturales y educativos. Carmen realiza su tránsito de niña a adulta en un momento adverso tanto para la mujer como para todos los seres sensibles y libres que se cuestionan con ojos limpios las injusticias y carencias de su tiempo.

La población de personajes con los que la protagonista se encuentra desde su infancia hasta su juventud tienen todos su propia historia, su mini-novela, que Carmen, siempre curiosa y atenta, trata de desvelar para comprenderlos mejor. En los Ojos de Carmen es una historia sencilla narrada por una niña común que llega a su madurez tomando decisiones valientes y honestas que la convierten en un personaje singular.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy se nos presenta Constanza Rúa.

Comencé a leer a los dos años de edad, mi familia me rodeaba de libros de cuentos y tebeos maravillosos que me transportaban a lugares y situaciones apasionantes. Tenía un armario lleno de libros, cuando no había ninguno recién comprado me sentaba en el suelo frente al armario abierto y seleccionaba lo que ese día quería volver a leer... Nunca me cansaba de ellos aunque volviese a leerlos miles de veces...

Era un mundo aparte, lleno de luz.

Siempre decía que de mayor quería ser escritora y me emocionaba la idea de poderme comunicar con personas de países lejanos a través de la letra impresa. Imaginar que puedo estar conectada con alguien de cualquier edad, raza, cultura religión, en cualquier lugar del mundo, me produce una satisfacción vital plena y profunda. 

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 840€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de En los ojos de Carmen que saldría después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Constanza Rúa vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, my name is Jordan Krall. I run Dunhams Manor Press which is the Weird Fiction imprint of Dynatox Ministries. Since December 2012, I've published such authors as Wilum Pugmire, D.P. Watt, Joseph Pulver Sr., DJ Tyrer, Thomas Ligotti, Scott Nicolay, Michael Griffin, Christopher Slatsky, Glynn Owen Barrass, Edward Morris, Tom Lynch, and John Claude Smith among many others.

Since 2007, I've also been an author, writing books for Eraserhead Press, Black Rainbows Press, LegumeMan Books, Copeland Valley Press, and MorbidBooks. 

I also edited and published the anthology MIGHTY IN SORROW, a tribute to Current 93 and David Tibet. Not only has it been approved by David Tibet himself, a copy was recently given to Nick Cave by David himself!

So far the Dunhams Manor books we have planned are: 

-PURGE STATUS by Shawn Mann

-THE INFUSORIUM by Jon Padgett

-WHEN IT'S TIME FOR DEAD THINGS TO DIE by Clint Smith

-FACTS IN THE CASE OF CLARISSA COLLYER by S.J. Chambers

-PASSAGE TO THE DREAMTIME: A Play by Anya Martin

-CASINO CARCOSA: A Tale of the Yellow King by Mark McLaughlin and Michael Sheehan, Jr. 

-COMING DOWN IN THREE PART HARMONY by Garrett Cook

-XNOYBIS: A Journal of Weird Fiction (fiction, nonfiction, interviews, and art)

-AEON by Jordan Krall

-THE FALL OF THE HOUSE OF DRAKE by Adam Bolivar

-THE QUEEN IN GREEN by Gina Ranalli

-ALECTRYOMANCER AND OTHER WEIRD TALES by Christopher Slatsky 

And THE TEMPORARY TOMB OF VIRGINIA POE by Selena Chambers which is ONLY

available as part of the POE PERK or the SKELETON KEY perk or HIGHER. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • I'm trying to raise $2,500 for three purposes. One, I'd like to pay the authors more. Two, I'd like to afford more artists for covers and interior art in order to add to the wonderful stories I'm publishing. This is especially the case for the new journal I'll be editing. Lastly, I'd like to be able to send copies of Dunhams Manor Press books to people around the country (or world) in order to act as liaisons at conventions.
  • Perks? We got them. Considering DMP is a small press, we do limited editions that have become quite collectible in the Weird Fiction community. Most publications are published in runs of 50 copies and they go fast. Contributing to this campaign will guarantee you one title or more.

The Impact

  • My purpose in running Dunhams Manor Press is to make available a wide variety of quality Weird Fiction in attractive and collectible editions. I think of these stories not as products but as works of art. 
  • So far I've run two successful Indiegogo campaigns two years in a row for my annual writer's convention KrallCon.

Risks & Challenges

  • Let's face it: authors work hard and deserve to be paid. Luckily I've worked with authors who understand that I'm a small press and can only pay so much but I'd like to afford to pay them a bit more. Artists also deserve money for their work. Most of the covers I've done myself. Others have been graciously done by artists who were willing to work within my budget. But I'd like to afford to pay them more.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you know any fans of Weird Fiction, please share this link!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to share this on your Facebook, Twitter, blogs, etc.

 Perks? We got them. Considering DMP is a small press, we do limited editions that have become quite collectible in the Weird Fiction community. Most publications are published in runs of 50 copies and they go fast. Contributing to this campaign will guarantee you one title or more.    The Impact  My purpose in running Dunhams Manor Press is to make available a wide variety of quality Weird Fiction in attractive and collectible editions. I think of these stories not as products but as works of art.  So far I've run two successful Indiegogo campaigns two years in a row for my annual writer's convention KrallCon.    Risks & Challenges  Let's face it: authors work hard and deserve to be paid. Luckily I've worked with authors who understand that I'm a small press and can only pay so much but I'd like to afford to pay them a bit more. Artists also deserve money for their work. Most of the covers I've done myself. Others have been graciously done by artists who were willing to work within my budget. But I'd like to afford to pay them more.    Other Ways You Can Help  If you know any fans of Weird Fiction, please share this link! Use the Indiegogo share tools to share this on your Facebook, Twitter, blogs, etc.

story:
Story of My Book

From morning to midnight, social media consumes and documents nearly every waking hour of our lives. Ten percent of Americans actually wake up to check their feeds again in the dead of night. With every post, tweet, snap, status and ‘gram, we’re building a detailed archive of not only our lives but the lives of our loved ones, too. An archive that may outlive us all.

What does happen to all of this information once we’re gone?
  • Do you want your family picture from your beach trip to vanish from Facebook once you are gone?
  • Will that post on Instagram be how you are remembered by your great-granddaughter?
  • Will all of these posts be used to create a digital version of you in the future? One that can use all the information you have put online to predict answers you might give after you are gone?

Digital Remains is a book that not only identifies the options you have with your online presence after you or a loved one dies but also shares stories and insights about new perspectives and options you didn’t know you NEED to know.

My name is J. Howard Harrington, and I’m a funeral director, embalmer, and author of Digital Remains. As a funeral director, I help others prepare and plan the legacy they’ll leave behind. I wrote this book because I realized that if the archive of one’s life has the potential to become someone’s legacy, we must prepare in ways we never had to before. End of life planning today is more than just an exploration of the new funeral options available, which I also address. It’s also an excavation of our detailed archives and an overhaul of our Digital Remains.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you’ll discover funeral options that truly are right for you, rather than be steered toward an option deemed “better” than others. In this book, I hope to impress upon you the importance of taking control of your Digital Remains — your entire life’s worth of data online — and the complications we’ll leave behind if we continue to ignore them. Then, ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool. A tool to help you discover what the choices that need to be made are. These choices focus on both your Physical Remains (including how we got here and what new options exist) as well as your Digital Remains (ranging from what to do with your Facebook page to who has the rights to your hologram).

In this book, you'll learn about firsthand experiences with loss and social media and insights about questions you have always wanted to know the answer to but never thought to ask:
  • What are ashes and are they good for your garden?.
  • If newspapers vanish how will we hear about deaths in our community without the Obituary section?
  • What and how will all the information you have put online over your life be used once you are gone?
  • Who owns your Hologram after you are gone?
  • And much more!

You will like this book if you are curious. You will love this book if you are exploring what you need to know before planning a funeral.

Digital Remains is a non-fiction book that speaks to Social Media Users and Forward Thinkers who are looking at Death, Dying and Remembrance in the Tech Generation for the first time.

-Technology - Social Media - Death Notifications - Future Options - Holograms -  

 

The Book - Digital Remains

The book is written in 4 Parts.

Part 1 - What should I say to someone who has lost a loved one? How realistic are TV shows like HBO’s series Six Feet Under? What is the makeup of cremated ashes and would they be beneficial to my garden? We dig into these and other perspectives on encountering death in the digital world and the physical world.

Part 2 - We delve deeper into how we hear about deaths of people that are close to us and those that we haven’t heard from for years. As the means by which we learn of deaths change, death notifications can come with added complications. What will change when physical newspapers near extinction, along with the obituaries sections we’ve grown accustomed to finding inside them? What lessons can we learn from the lives that came before us? And, now that our networks have moved online, how far do our connections really go? Find out who might actually be affected in a new way by news you share online.

Part 3 - In a technologically focused world, many aspects of our lives center around instant access and practicality. Useable technologies can be added to visible memorials, as though providing a digital connection to those we have lost. In this section, we discuss new technologies through the logic of selecting some options that have been used in the past or might be used in the future.

Part 4 - We offer a Social Media Clean Up Guide, providing site-by-site advice on what to do with a deceased person’s social media and email accounts, plus tips to help you plan ahead.

-Facebook - Twitter - Instagram - Email - TikTok - SnapChat - WhatsApp - Twitter - Posts- 
 

What I Need & What You'll Get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 
  • The Editor - with whom I’ll work to revise and publish my manuscript in July 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for my Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Summer.

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish Digital Remains.
When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook.
When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.
Additionally, I will be able to offer expended languages in both Spanish and Chinese Editions.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”). That’s right, YOUR NAME will appear PRINTED in a PUBLISHED BOOK!
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author

Jarred Harrington is a former Industry Expert for the United States Department of Labor and a fifth-generation funeral director and embalmer. Using his advanced degrees in Thanatology, Jarred strives to increase the knowledge and accessibility of end-of-life and funeral options to the widest possible audience.

I wrote this book to share insights and knowledge that is critical in a modern and technologically focused world. These insights center around the subject social media, death and new tech, answering questions you never realized you’d always wanted to ask.

How we choose to spend eternity is an individual choice that gives each and every person the chance to do what is right for them and their family, be that a carnival for the community to highlight someone's favorite memories from childhood or a simple graveside funeral with close family. What is right for one person does not have to be what is right for you. And today, you have more options than ever before.

For more information, you can connect with Jarred by: 

  • Email at jhowardharrington@gmail.com.
  • Instagram at @authorjhharrington  
  • LinkedIn at https://www.linkedin.com/in/jarred-harrington/
  • Twitter at @JarrHarrington

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #DigitalRemains and tag me @authorjhharrington as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media to make sure they know how much they might enjoy or learn from this book!

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Jarred
J. Howard Harrington

story:
"Ze let hirself rise, barely buoyant, into the tapering tip. A little broken, blue light flickered down to meet hir. Ze reached for it, watching it play over hir skin. It tickled. Lyuko giggled, tugging away reflexively – and the light came too. Ze could see the coral’s new growth clearly, now softly gleaming. Intrigued, Lyuko pulled again, and blue light blossomed within the bulb. Ze rolled it, spun it, and webbed the walls in soft blue lace. It was more pliant and responsive to hir touch than water alone had ever been.

Kouso was surprised, but overjoyed: hir child, a sculptor not of currents, but of light. The colony had never seen the like."

- from "Moments of Light" by Toby MacNutt, published in Capricious Issue 2

 

 

Gender diverse pronouns - like the "ze" and "hir" used above, or singular they, or any of a number of possibilities - are an increasing part of many people's vocabulary. They can be used to describe people for whom "he" or "she" are not a good fit, or to refer to a person, real or hypothetical, of unknown gender.

But - with some notable exceptions - they’re under-utilised in science fiction and fantasy - despite the fact that they’re necessary just to depict our world accurately, let alone the myriad worlds of the imagination. While some editors are welcoming, others are dismissive, meaning authors are taking a risk in writing these stories, and readers don’t see enough of them.

As the editor of Capricious magazine (and a non-binary person myself) I want to create a special issue of speculative stories which not only use gender diverse pronouns, but embrace them. Stories with gender diverse characters, in worlds where gender is conceptualised in many different ways - or not at all.

We’ve published two such stories: “The Need for Overwhelming Sensation” by Bogi Takács and “Moments of Light” by Toby MacNutt, both of which use multiple sets of gender diverse pronouns - and such pronoun usage is very welcome in every issue of Capricious. Now we want to specifically celebrate it and showcase the possibilities it allows.

 

 

Our main photo depicts a Capricious fuzzhog engaging in research into historical uses of singular they in literature. Want your own? Check out the rewards. Fuzziness garanteed, research capabilities may vary.

Gender Diverse Pronouns

A pronoun - or, more specifically in this case, a personal pronoun, is a word you can use in place of someone’s name. Rather than saying “Ryan picked up the book but Ryan decided it wasn’t the sort of thing Ryan enjoyed reading” you would more typically say “Ryan picked up the book but she decided it wasn’t the sort of thing she enjoyed reading”. She is the personal pronoun.

In English, the personal pronouns we’re most used to are he and she. Not only do these require the speaker to know the gender of the person they’re talking about, but they only really cover two genders. Humans don’t always fit in these boxes.

Fortunately, there are a range of gender neutral pronouns  - and they’re not all modern inventions. They are used mainly to either refer to an individual for whom “he” or “she” isn’t appropriate (that individual might identify as non-binary or genderqueer) or for a hypothetical person whose gender is not established (“when you find out who the person in charge is, tell them I need to talk to them”).

What's the difference between gender neutral and gender diverse pronouns? There’s significant overlap between the two, but I chose the "gender diverse" terminology for this project because we also welcome stories in which pronouns do signify specific a gender, but in different ways to he and she.

So we’re looking for stories that use singular they, or xe, or e, or per or any one of many possibilities - including those of the authors' invention. We’re looking for stories that use culturally specific pronouns, or pronouns created by the author for a fictional world. We'd love to see stories that also address other ways in which languages are gendered, and stories with multiply-marginalised characters. And of course, we want stories that delight and amaze us, are beautifully written, and explore different worlds and new futures.

About the Special Issue

The special issue will be a double-length issue of Capricious (approx 8 stories, plus author interviews). It will be available in both print and ebook (pdf, ebook, and mobi formats), with publication scheduled for late 2017.

We are aiming to pay authors professional rates of US6c/word, and our goal has been set with that in mind. Should we reach at least the halfway point, but fail to meet our goal, we will go ahead but only be able to offer a lower rate, paying authors a minimum of US3c/word. More happily, should we exceed our goal, additional funds will allow us to lengthen the issue, and to fund Capricious on an ongoing basis, which will always be welcoming to stories like these.

About Capricious

 

Capricious is a magazine of speculative fiction, which has published work by AJ Fitzwater, Bogi Takács, Mari Ness, RJ Edwards, Rebecca Campbell, Octavia Cade, Anya Ow… and more. We recently celebrated our first birthday with the release of the food-and-drink themed Issue 4. Capricious is edited by A.C. Buchanan, whose editing has won two Sir Julius Vogel awards.

About the Perks

A few notes about the perks we're offering:

  • All ebooks will be in .pdf, .mobi, and .epub format.
  • The Fuzzhogs are handknitted, so allow for some minor variation. These are not toys and not suitable for young children. They are based on a pattern by Bee Weir.
  • Subscriptions begin with the first issue of 2017 (unless you have an existing subscription, in which case we will set it to begin when your existing subscription expires). All subscribers, current and new, who back this campaign will have their subscription lengthened by an issue to account for the purchase of the special issue.
  • Critiques are for one short story up to 7500 words. To avoid conflicts of interest, critiqued stories will not be considered for this issue, or for future issues of Capricious.
  • The books included in the "C is for Capricious", "Paperback Plus Poems", "Hedgehog Plus Bird", and "Robot Hedgehogs" perks have been very kindly donated by Rose Lemberg, A. Merc Rustad, and Bogi Takács. Thank you!

Milestone Perks

If we get to $2000, every backer who has contributed $10 or more will receive an ebook of Invisible City, a novelette by Capricious editor A.C. Buchanan.

If we get to $2500, every backer who has contributed $10 or more will receive an ebook of Accessing the Future, a disability-themed anthology of speculative fiction, kindly donated by Djibril al-Ayad at FutureFire.net (thank you Djibril!)

And if we reach our goal of $3000, every backer who has contributed $10 or more will receive an ebook of Regeneration, an anthology of New Zealand Speculative Fiction.

That's potentially 3 bonus ebooks with every perk over $10 - but we need to hit those goals first!

How to Submit

We are open for submissions until 28 February 2017. Please see the full submission guidelines on the Capricious website.

Risks and Challenges

The most obvious risk is failing to meet funding. As mentioned above, if we reach at least the halfway point (US$1500), we are confident the issue can proceed. If we don’t, we’re still going to do all we can to make it happen, but it may be delayed while additional funding is sought.

The other main risk is that we will receive insufficient stories to fill the issue, however given the large number of submissions Capricious receives, and that we have strong networks with authors who write - or want to write - just what we’re looking for, this seems minimal.

Then there are technical or bureaucratic risks - printing issues and such like. While these can never be eliminated, all I can say is that we’ve done plenty of research and have experience, so we’re confident we can work around them.

Lastly, I have a good supply of bottled water, chocolate, and canned chickpeas under the bed so am confident of being able to hide in my bedroom with a laptop and edit through the zombie apocalypse.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone who supports us can do so financially. We’d love it if you can spread the word about this campaign; social media sharing buttons are above. If you’re a writer you can also support us by considering submitting to the issue. Three months after publication, a selection of stories from this special issue will be posted free online - please have a read, and perhaps review them or recommend those you enjoy.
