All subscribers, current and new, who back this campaign will have their subscription lengthened by an issue to account for the purchase of the special issue.
Critiques are for one short story up to 7500 words. To avoid conflicts of interest, critiqued stories will not be considered for this issue, or for future issues of Capricious.
The books included in the "C is for Capricious", "Paperback Plus Poems", "Hedgehog Plus Bird", and "Robot Hedgehogs" perks have been very kindly donated by Rose Lemberg, A. Merc Rustad, and Bogi Takács. Thank you!
Milestone PerksIf we get to $2000, every backer who has contributed $10 or more will receive an ebook of Invisible City, a novelette by Capricious editor A.C. Buchanan.If we get to $2500, every backer who has contributed $10 or more will receive an ebook of Accessing the Future, a disability-themed anthology of speculative fiction, kindly donated by Djibril al-Ayad at FutureFire.net (thank you Djibril!)And if we reach our goal of $3000, every backer who has contributed $10 or more will receive an ebook of Regeneration, an anthology of New Zealand Speculative Fiction.That's potentially 3 bonus ebooks with every perk over $10 - but we need to hit those goals first!How to SubmitWe are open for submissions until 28 February 2017. Please see the full submission guidelines on the Capricious website.Risks and ChallengesThe most obvious risk is failing to meet funding. As mentioned above, if we reach at least the halfway point (US$1500), we are confident the issue can proceed. If we don’t, we’re still going to do all we can to make it happen, but it may be delayed while additional funding is sought.The other main risk is that we will receive insufficient stories to fill the issue, however given the large number of submissions Capricious receives, and that we have strong networks with authors who write - or want to write - just what we’re looking for, this seems minimal.Then there are technical or bureaucratic risks - printing issues and such like. While these can never be eliminated, all I can say is that we’ve done plenty of research and have experience, so we’re confident we can work around them.Lastly, I have a good supply of bottled water, chocolate, and canned chickpeas under the bed so am confident of being able to hide in my bedroom with a laptop and edit through the zombie apocalypse.Other Ways You Can HelpWe understand that not everyone who supports us can do so financially. We’d love it if you can spread the word about this campaign; social media sharing buttons are above. If you’re a writer you can also support us by considering submitting to the issue. Three months after publication, a selection of stories from this special issue will be posted free online - please have a read, and perhaps review them or recommend those you enjoy.

story:
Intro

Hello everyone,

Thank you very much for your time for reading and sharing this (yes, it will be awesome if you can share it even before you're done reading!). To start it off, my name is Joshua Kevin. I have more than a few years of experience being in the tech ecosystem in Asia, generally, and in Indonesia, specifically. With half of that experience being a tech blogger, I spent most of my time writing and reading tech blogs. With that in mind, I thought, why don't I hit two birds with one stone: I can help people while I do what I love to do.

This campaign or project is being made for people who are in the tech ecosystem in Asia, nor interested in the tech ecosystem in Asia, yet they are either unable to keep up with all the posts from tech blogs covering Asia or they are just too busy to do that. In this project, I will help you. How? I will curate the best and most important articles/posts from the tech blogs, and deliver it to your e-mail, daily! Again, this is not a substitute to your RSS reader, but I'd say - a compliment to that. Plus, I will cover some startups that haven't been covered by the tech blog so far in a different way. So, if you are a startup, e-mail me!

Personally, this project is an experiment of trying out a crowdfunding service (my first) and to see how big is the demand of a curated newsletter plus additional voice from an individual. Although it is an experiment, any benefits that I will get from this project will go directly to funding my future startup that I'm building. In a way, you are a micro angel investor in my startup!

What You Back Is What You Get (WYBIWYG)

Our goal is to get $2000 or at least 1,000 subscribers to make this project a feasible one to do for me. Depending on how much you are backing me for, you will get this benefit:

  • $1 - The very basic package, you will get a one month subscription to the newsletter, with an occasional tech-related ads.
  • $2 - Same one month subscription, but free of Ads.
  • $10 - Subscribe for one year (12 months) of the basic, and get $2 off! (with Ads)
  • $20 - 12 months of subscription with no ads.
  • $35 - 24 months of subscription with no ads.
  • $50 - Get two years of subscription and a coffee with me.
  • $100 - Get two years of subscription, a coffee with me, and your name on the newsletter for the first year of the service.

For those of you who wants to donate but don't have either Credit Card or PayPal, e-mail me: hello[at]joshuakev.in and we can talk about alternative solution.

Ultimate Goal

I believe that this project, if successful, will not benefit just me - personally - but also my future employees of the startup, my future customers or clients, or if we are being a bit dramatic, the whole world can get a little(emphasis here) bit better. So, with your help, this young-hopeful entrepreneur can make another step to the better side.

At the same time, I do promise that if, again, this project is running well by the time the deadline has ended. There will be more fun yet useful projects in the future like, maybe, e-books that will cover successful startups in Indonesia, or even larger than that.

But, even after reading this you feel that you can't or won't contribute just yet, that is okay, but it will be very very very appreciated if you can share this on your social media accounts or e-mail this page to someone do you think will be interested or get benefit from.

Just copy this links: http://igg.me/at/jkdaily - and post it :)

Thank you very much for reading, and contributing!

If you have any question or you have donated, do tweet me @jshkvn

Joshua Kevin

story:
Breve reseña

Cuando Elvira escaló por primera vez, subió por el muro del Mall Sport con una facilidad y fluidez que se ve en pocas personas cuando se inician en este deporte. Inspirada por la visita de Raphael Nishimura, vicecampeón de Paraescalada, y quien tiene el mismo tipo de Distonia (condición que ataca al sistema nervioso y muscular del cuerpo) que Elvira, se atrevió a enfrentarse al muro del Mall Sport que, como una gran ola, intimida a más de uno con solo verlo.

El evento motivó a varias personas a probar la escalada sin importar las diferentes capacidades físicas, pero en Elvira motivó algo más. Después de ver que tenía facilidades para la escalada, que se notaban con solo verla mover en el muro, decidió continuar practicando el deporte y entrenarse con la meta de llegar a participar en el mundial de Paraescalada.

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Presenta más detalles:

  • El financiamiento es exclusivamente para pagar los pasajes de mi entrenador y el mío así como también la estadía en Guijón, España. Cada pasaje tiene un valor de 1500 USD y la estadía, debido a utilizo una silla de ruedas para desplazarme el hotel accesible más cercano tiene un valor de 3200 USD. 
  • Para mí es todo un desafío ya que nunca pensé que podría realizar un deporte debido a mi discapacidad. Cuando conocí al vice campeón en para escalada, Raphael Nishimura, quien tenia la misma discapacidad que yo, distonia generalizada, me subí al muro y escale y escale y me sentí libre, hoy en día soy una deportista, si se quiere se puede, yo escalo! y seré la primera deportista de para escalada que representara a chile.
  • Si no logro la meta total, los fondos irán al mundial de todas formas, ya que seguiré buscando auspicios para asistir, ya logre que me financiaran la inscripción ( 120.000CLP) el club andino alemán y el gimnasio el muro quienes me entrenan gratuitamente.
  • Si no logro, por tiempo, lo invertiré en mejorar mi músculos con un kinesiólogo para poder asistir al mundial del año siguiente en mejores condiciones, pero estoy dedicada totalmente en mejorar mi rendimiento.

El impacto

Si contribuyen con mi causa, ayudarán a demostrarle a mi país que las personas con discapacidad si tenemos capacidades y así motivar a otras personas para que por un lado en un futuro cercano no sea yo sola la que pueda asistir sino un equipo conformado por diversas discapacidades y por otro lado, levantar la imagen de "discapacidad" en la sociedad chilena.

  • Anteriormente, practique el deporte de equitación, disciplina adiestramiento pero no pude competir porque no esta reconocido como un deporte paraolímpico. El caso de la para escalada es distinto porque toda una red de apoyo que construí con mi perseverancia y convicción y ya existen copas mundiales, pero sólo en Europa, Aún falta hacerlo a nivel Para sudamericano. 
  • Riesgos y desafíos
  • En general, la discapacidad no encaja mucho en este deporte, pero las personas que me rodean poco a poco si dieron cuenta que discapacidad queda de lado al momento de escalar, mi capacidad de escalar anula mi discapacidad. Esto ayuda a que la gente sea mas inclusiva y que no tenga miedo de interactuar con personas con discapacidad en general.
  • He luchado por mis derechos toda mi vida, especialmente en el ámbito laboral, actualmente mi profesión es ser una deportista de alto rendimiento, no esta directamente relacionado con mis estudios de traducción, pero he descubierto capacidades que desconocía, eso es maravilloso y muy potente y además una inspiración para que otros luchen por sus sueños.
  • En 8 meses, a pesar de mi discapacidad he logrado el mismo avance que cualquier otro deportista, tanto así que la campeona chilena Sara Alwyn me ofreció ser mi entrenadora por que cree en mi perseverancia y habilidades.

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Si no pueden colaborar con mi campaña, les pido que por favor lo difundan, no sólo por mi, sino por todas las personas con o sin discapacidad conozcan este deporte y se motiven, para que la sociedad chilena en general se de cuenta de que centrándose en nuestras capacidades, y que somos nosotros los que conocemos nuestros verdaderos límites. 

Los invito a utilizar la herramientas de Indiegogo, es un modo fácil  de difundir proyectos de toda índole y sin tener que salir de la casa.

story:
GREETINGS AND SALUTATIONS!

  

My Name is John R. White, and I am the Author of The Airship Neverland Series. First, let me thank you for all your kind attention and interest. We at Airship Neverland are humbled by your support and friendship.

The audiobook team consists of; voice actors Christine Peruski, Tony Semanik (who also serves as audio mixer and co-scriptwriter), and myself. Our goal is to produce a quality audiobook of Volume I of Tales of the Airship Neverland  for you our fans, and new and future fans.

By aiding us in our goals, you will be supporting independent writers, actors and  encouraging future artists, without needing to depend on major entertainment corporations. We at Airship Neverland have been continuously awed by the support of the Steampunk community at their dedication to independent artists and authors.

SUPPORT AND REWARDS! (What we need & What You Get)

We realize that while you are very generous, we naturally want to make sure that you feel well compensated for your contribution. I mean, airship piracy is hard work!

  • Our goal is 4,000 dollars (£2666.31) (€3548.62). This money will be used to pay our professional voice actors and staff (Including the author), production fees that include making the audiobook available on quality established arenas such as Itunes, Amazon and other arenas, and to provide quality rewards for you. We believe that crowdfunding rewards should be of high quality reflective of your generosity and sacrifice. Poster rewards will be printed out by a professional on quality art paper.
  • Rewards range from Airship Neverland  stickers, customized crew certificates that will show you’re an official member of Bryton’s finest airship, up to stretched canvas blueprints of both the Neverland and Jolly Roger! There is also an exciting Crowdfund exclusive; a quality physical poster of CGI rendered artwork available nowhere else!
  • If we do not reach our goals, we guarantee your rewards will be met first and foremost! Our next obligations are to cover our production costs, including our actors. Myself as the author will receive no compensation until all obligations are made to you and the actors. That is written into the contract with the actors, Christine and Tony.

Your Impact

Your support of independent artists, such as Christine, Tony and I is by no means a small thing. Quite often we see major entertainment conglomerates attempt to produce Steampunk and other genre entertainment without really understanding what the fan wants to see. The independent artist revolution, which we are fortunate to be a part of, allows the creators to be in control of our own creations.  It is due to your generosity and investment that has allowed us to continue pursuing our dreams and goals. Thank you for that!

Airship Neverland has grown from our first appearance in Detroit at World Steam Expo in 2010, to our follow up con appearance in 2011 with our YouTube audio-drama’s cast, and our first digital release. The year 2015 will include our upcoming release of Volume III: Dust and Ash, and the exciting new role-playing game both by Mad Raven – producers of the Twisted Skies card game!

Our goal has been to constantly produce new and higher quality products such as this audiobook. Our first obligation is to you the consumer, which is why we have enlisted professional actors with track records in the industry.
 

Risks & Challenges

Independent artistry is a dual edged sword. There have been tough times in the past with both print and sound editors, and having learned from those challenges, we thank you for your patience. In the past five years we have invested our own hard earned money to constantly improve our product. Our challenge now is that we have hit the tipping point of our own abilities. To achieve our current goals we need to enlist professionals to produce this audio version.
 With your gracious help, we can now produce a product that a great many people have asked for!

CAN’T DONATE? THAT’S OKAY!

  We have put our fundraiser on as long as we can, and varied our rewards. While of course we value everyone’s financial donations, we know it’s tough out there. However, if you would still be be so kind as to  make a little bit of a racket on Tink’s behalf, we sure would appreciate that too! Be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools as well.

THANK YOU ON BEHALF OF CHRISTINE, TONY, MARY AND I!

story:
The Anna B. Repicky Foundation

PO Box 120, Wells, NY 12190

914-447-5257

www.AnnaBfoundation.org

AnnaBFoundation@gmail.com

If you have ever known someone who was blind or visually impaired you know how important this campaign is. For those of you who haven’t... just imagine what it would be like if you couldn't read a story to a child and share the fun and beauty in the pictures because you or the child were blind. 

Braille doesn't have pictures. And printed books don’t have braille. You need BOTH in order to share the experience between blind and sighted. THAT’S what we’re doing!! And it’s fantastic!

We are on a mission to pair up children’s books in braille and print so everyone can share the joy of reading together. Our goal is simple: No child will miss out on sharing their favorite story because of blindness. By pairing braille and print books the love and joy can continue to be shared by everyone! 

 Let's give all children the opportunity to share the love of reading and re-reading their favorite stories -- even if they are blind.

We are the Anna B. Repicky Foundation currently consisting of a few dedicated volunteers and Konor, our ambitious, bright HS intern. We have done our homework and have set up a network to support our mission.We have done our preliminary work. We have our team set up. Our structure is sound and ready.

We have begun our mission by teaming up with another charity dedicated to serving the visually impaired, Xavier Society for the Blind. We have been helping them expand their children’s library in braille and print children’s books. As we grow we will reach out and pair with other charities that provide materials to the blind AT NO COST. That’s the key with us. Those materials must be given freely to the visually impaired. Children or parents in need must never be deterred from such a joy as sharing a story with a child because of lack of funds.

Please help Anna B.  team with other such groups all over the US and, eventually, all over the globe, because visual impairment does not discriminate. No matter what our race, creed or color, children and adults all over the world have one very important thing in common – the love of reading together.

This campaign will help us finish expanding Xavier’s library and turn our eyes towards others like them. But, we never leave our partners. We will continue to partner with Xavier : they supply the braille copy, we supply the printed version. The children get to keep their books. Supplies must be replenished. And, of course, new books come out every day! Therefore, our partnership with these libraries is a partnership for life.

Please help us share the love of reading!
story_txt:
The Anna B. Repicky
Foundation
PO Box 120, Wells, NY 12190
914-447-5257
www.AnnaBfoundation.org
AnnaBFoundation@gmail.comIf you have ever known someone who was blind or visually impaired you know how important this campaign is. For those of you who haven’t... just imagine what it would be like if you couldn't read a story to a child and share the fun and beauty in the pictures because you or the child were blind. Braille doesn't have pictures. And printed books don’t have braille. You need BOTH in order to share the experience between blind and sighted. THAT’S what we’re doing!! And it’s fantastic!We are on a mission to pair up children’s books in braille and print so everyone can share the joy of reading together. Our goal is simple: No child will miss out on sharing their favorite story because of blindness. By pairing braille and print books the love and joy can continue to be shared by everyone!  Let's give all children the opportunity to share the love of reading and re-reading their favorite stories -- even if they are blind.We are the Anna B. Repicky Foundation currently consisting of a
few dedicated volunteers and Konor, our ambitious, bright HS intern. We have done our
homework and have set up a network to support our mission.We have done our preliminary work. We have our team set up. Our structure is sound and ready.
We have begun our mission by teaming up with another charity
dedicated to serving the visually impaired, Xavier Society for the Blind. We
have been helping them expand their children’s library in braille and print
children’s books. As we grow we will reach out and pair with other charities that
provide materials to the blind AT NO COST. That’s the key with us. Those
materials must be given freely to the visually impaired. Children or parents in
need must never be deterred from such a joy as sharing a story with a child
because of lack of funds.
Please help Anna B.  team with other such groups all over the US and,
eventually, all over the globe, because visual impairment does not discriminate. No matter
what our race, creed or color, children and adults all over the world have one
very important thing in common – the love of reading together. 
This campaign will help us finish expanding Xavier’s library and
turn our eyes towards others like them. But, we never leave our partners. We
will continue to partner with Xavier : they supply the braille copy, we supply
the printed version. The children get to keep their books. Supplies must be
replenished. And, of course, new books come out every day! Therefore, our
partnership with these libraries is a partnership for life.Please help us share the love of reading!

story:
I’m thrilled to have been accepted into Mat Johnson’s Graphic Novel workshop at VONA Voices.  (If you haven’t already heard me go on and on about VONA, and you’re not sure what that means, VONA -- Voices of Our Nations Arts -- is the only multi-genre workshop series for writers of color.)  VONA has saved my life as a writer.  Punto.  I’ve been lucky enough to attend twice, both times for fiction – 2010 with Tananarive Due, 2011 with Junot Diaz.  Beyond those workshops, however, VONA has become family, connecting me to an active and supportive community online and here at home in New York.

Last year I started drawing what I thought would be a one-shot mini comic, just a funny thing I’d do and then move on.  Before I’d finished sketching the story, however, I realized that I had a lot more to say.  A LOT more.  The comic, Adventures in Racism, is on its way to becoming a graphic memoir about my experiences of and reflections on racism.  I am loving this project, and am encouraged and inspired by the responses to the first episodes.  VONA’s graphic novel workshop couldn't come at a better time for me.  No one at VONA will be surprised by the experiences I write about – I have no doubt that everyone who’ll work with me this summer could write their own volume(s) of Adventures.  I need that audience, one that won’t get stuck in the shock and wonder of, “Did someone really say that to you?” and will instead work with me to find the most effective ways I can use this medium to tell my story. 

My ability to take advantage of the fabulousness that is VONA is entirely dependent on raising the money to make the trip.  As an East Coast girl, the trip out to Berkeley isn't cheap.  Adding to that the cost of tuition, room and board, the full cost of VONA is a stretch for me.  This is where you come in!  (And by "you" I mean you ... and all the friends/fam you'll share my link with!)

I’m trying to raise $2,500 by the end of May.  Anything you can donate to help me reach that goal will be hugely appreciated.  Donate now and claim your thank you gift!  All gifts will be made by me, and will be infused with my gratitude and good will toward you.

All funds raised up to $2,500 will be used to support my trip to VONA.  If by some amazing chance this fundraiser brings in more than $2,500, I will use the extra money a) to save for my next writing retreat, or b) to purchase materials for my comics work; first a light board so I can stop using the bootleg one I've got going now that burns my fingers when I work for too long, and second buying some of the comics textbooks I've had on semi-permanent loan from the library for the last year.  Just know that none of your generous gifts will be wasted.

Indiegogo won't let me create a perk that automatically attaches to every donation.  I had substituted with a $1 perk, but that didn't seem right, either.  No matter the amount of your donation, you will receive a thank you card.  I so appreciate how tight money is for most everyone, and the fact that you would share some of what you have with me is humbling and beautiful.  You are all rock stars.

I'll be keeping donors updated on the project during the campaign and as I continue to work after VONA.  I welcome your questions and comments as I move forward -- girlgriot@gmail.com -- drop me a line!

story:
Let me start by telling you who I am. My name is “VC” Angell. I am a 73-year-old disabled vet. Although I served in Vietnam, I am no hero. I fell off a pile of logs on an obstacle course at Fort Sill, Oklahoma which led to a back injury. They tell me it will eventually put me in a wheelchair. The way things are going – I believe them! I know there are scammers out there, so below is a copy of one of my older VA IDs. I erased part of the barcode because I am told it tells too much. You can see under my picture that I have a service-connected disability. Isn't it a wonderful picture? I had just come out of an MRI machine  before it was taken and was not too happy as you can see  – Grin.

The more important thing is I am a writer. I graduated from the MFA program at Western Michigan University in 1992. I was one of three accepted to the fiction program the year I joined them out of hundreds of applicants. Approximately 12 years ago, I published a dystopian science-fiction novel titled The Last Holey Man. The title is a pun. I posted it on Smashwords as a freebie if you would like to see a sample of my writing. I should warn you that I found it on an old hard drive, and although it is the complete novel, it is likely to contain some typos.

Turning to the sales of The Last Holey Man, they were both surprising and disappointing. The sales were in clusters across the country. I suspect that was due to word-of-mouth and not my attempts at marketing. I do not think it was due to the reviews because I was only aware of one slightly negative review. I have come to the conclusion that I have no talent for marketing.

That lack of talent is the reason for using Indiegogo. I need professional help in marketing my newest novel titled Bringer of Justice. It is the first in a series of fantasy novels I am planning. The novel was published at the start of July, and I have spent the last two months researching book marketing firms. The better marketing firms seem to be much like gas stations – they match their competition’s prices! The better programs they offer last approximately a month and go down from there depending on time frame and coverage. The price ranges from $4000 and down. I will choose the best firm – as yet undecided – as the money I raise will support. If by chance the goal is exceeded, the promotion could continue beyond four weeks.

Now onto a bit about the newest novel – Bringer of Justice. It is available on Amazon. The cover of the novel is pictured above. The blurb that was created for it reads, “A one-way portal opens up to the world of Reini, and through it passes Vir, a lost warrior in search of his home world and those with the same gray eyes. Reini welcomes him with immediate danger, as a group of slavers threaten to capture him. The little bit of magic that Vir knows is just enough to help him escape, but his using it starts a deadly chain reaction he never could have predicted.

Reini is fiercely divided between those who can use magic and those who cannot. Its ruler, King Kellum, fosters an irrational hatred of magic users and is on a mission to erase them from existence. Vir’s magic in this world has somehow become powerful beyond comprehension, and it frightens him. Can he escape the king’s deadly directive and find an escape portal out of this world in time? Or will his sense of honor entangle him in a crusade to save the lives of an entire people?” I am not the author of this ad copy.

So far, there has only been a single review provided through Amazon. It is from the Kirkus Indie Review. A snippet of the review reads, and “Sharp dialogue helps characters stand out in a complex world…That’s balanced by thoughtful scenes involving ancient portals that point to Vir’s origin…Angell delivers the noble message of standing tall during tragedy.”

Please give a thought to helping and thank you for your time.

PS: I really have nothing to offer you in terms of perks beyond my writing.

story:
The Project

Disappearing Worlds - The present of future climate refugees

A photo-documentary journey covering the present social reality of low-rising Pacific islands communities facing an insecure future due to climatic phenomena and rising sea level.

From west-eye view propaganda to individual voices of the community, a visual tale of the reality faced by inhabitants of low rising islands of the Mid-Pacific and the resulting social paradigms that influence their community's development and long-term cultural survival.

Disappearing Worlds project aims to build a long-term commitment towards providing imagery along with independent reports from the regions it will cover in order to raise public awareness about climate change adaptation efforts around the globe.


The Campaign focus

                                           - The Nation of Tuvalu - 

First leg of the project and the subject of this crowd-funding campaign covers the Island Nation of Tuvalu, one of the least visited countries in the world.

With a population of just under 11 000 inhabitants and a physical land size of just 26 square kilometers, that makes it the fourth smallest country in the world, Tuvalu comprises three reef islands and six true atolls, neighboring Kiribati, Samoa and Nauru in the Pacific Ocean.

With the highest elevation point average under 4 meters the inhabited islands of Tuvalu are giving their inhabitants a handful, as extreme climatic phenomena continue to scale up and rising sea levels are forcing increasing tidal-related damage to the landscape, the nation of Tuvalu finds itself struggling to manage their development course, balance the need for foreign aid and elaborate coherent strategies to ensure their long-term physical and cultural survival at the forefront of adaptation to climate change.

The campaign goals


Project implementation

Spending a month with the people of Tuvalu during the wet season and High (King) Tides occurrence in February of 2015.

  • Documenting the effects of the highest tides of the year during the wet season on every day life
  • Landscape series - documenting the increasing tidal related damage to the landscape and flora (soil salinization and it's effects on the local plants, beach front erosion, aquifer degradation) and the climate change adaptation efforts of the local population ( fresh water storage solutions and improvements, soil regeneration, ecological restoration of the beach fronts and high tide level storm protection through mangrove plantations among many other sustained efforts )
  • The Faces of Tuvalu - a portrait series of the people of Tuvalu accompanied with interviews, independently funding here > http://igg.me/at/facesoftuvalu

Project Dissemination
The main goal of the project is to produce quality multimedia information on the subject of it's inquiry, with a focus on keeping it's output free of charge and emphasizing on continuos efforts to expand it's reach.
  • Creating and distributing free-of-charge the E-book version of the Disappearing Worlds - Tuvalu Photo Book.
  • Creating and distributing free-of-charge the E-book version of the Faces of Tuvalu - Portrait Series Photo Book > http://igg.me/at/facesoftuvalu
  • Continuous maintenance of the dedicated project websites
  • Social media efforts and strategy
  • Media outlets contact efforts, articles and proposals writing 


The Perks/Rewards

The perk to contribution ratio is between 20% to 30%, dependent one the chosen perk/reward.

All (*except limited edition prints) perks will be produced with Artifact Uprising, a Colorado based printing company dedicated to a sustainable business model, from 100% pages in the photo books they print to reclaimed beetle pine wood boxes, they offer premium quality with a focus on the environment. Check them out at https://www.artifactuprising.com/about/

Limited Edition Prints will be made using Hahnemule's premium fine art printing technology, and will be delivered with a Hahnemule Certificate of Authenticity, numbered through Hahnemule's Hologram System for limited edition series and hand signed by me.

Hahnemule is a paper manufacturing company funded in 1584, and a leader in fine art printing and certification.

http://www.hahnemuehle.com/en/index.html

http://www.hahnemuehle.com/en/digital-fineart/certificate-of-authenticity.html


The Numbers

The total budget for this first leg of the project amounts to 5000 Euros, of which 40 % (2000 Euros) has already been raised through funding efforts outside of Indiegogo, a process that will be continued alongside with these two campaigns with the goal of funding at least 50 % of the budget.

Funding efforts outside of Indiegogo
  • 2000 Euros funded, with 2500 Euros target.      
Disappearing Worlds, Tuvalu campaign 
  • 2500 Euros goal                                                    
Faces of Tuvalu campaign > http://igg.me/at/facesoftuvalu
  • 1000 Euros goal

The budget break-down is as follows


Project implementation (50%)
  • 3000 Euros (includes travel expenses, on-ground logistics in Tuvalu and miscellaneous)
Project dissemination (25%)
  • 1500 Euros ( producing the two e-books and perfecting free-of-charge distribution for them, mobile and desktop formats plus .Pdf, soft-proofing the printed version Photo Books and prints, social media efforts and media outlets proposals )
Indiegogo perks and early donors rewards (25%)
  • 1500 Euros ( Producing and delivering the perks offered here on Indiegogo, and honoring rewards for outside donors and partners)

Excess funds
Will go towards augmenting the project dissemination efforts described above.

Worst case scenario budget
The project can go live if raised funds until mid-December reach 3000 Euros, a goal I am very close of achieving (having already closed 2000 Euros to the date I am releasing these Indiegogo campaigns). If the campaigns don't reach their goals, the contracted perks/rewards delivery will be delayed by one month (towards mid-April 2015) and project dissemination will suffer in the amount of time I can put up towards it.
Long story short, I will make the project happen, but the time and efforts put in it's development will suffer, as generating the remaining need of funding from my own pocket will mean putting less hours in the project and taking more freelance work on top of what's now covering my living and daily expenses.


You guys!

Creating social media buzz around the project is as valuable as contributing, please take a few moments to share the campaign! (buttons under the video)

Remember the linked campaign Faces of Tuvalu.

Indiegogo's algorithm emphasizes as much on the amount of funds having been gathered as on the percentage of engagement with the project's page (visits, shares, tweets), when assessing the place it deserves in the Trending Page.

If you've taken the time to read all the way down here, and like the project, keeping it in a good placed in a good spot for it to find it's way into other people's hearts is the greatest reward you can offer it.

This campaign is as much an attempt to augment, the personal effort and funds put in the early steps of the project as it is an effort to disseminate information and create interest about the project and the Island Nation of Tuvalu.


Thanks!

story:
OUR STORY
As far as fairy tales and “Hollywood endings” go, boy meets girl – boy marries girl – boy and girl have beautiful babies together and live happily ever after behind their white picket fence…..  Well….our story is not that kind of  ”love” story, but  it is a story of love, none-the-less.

Our story does have a lot of the above elements, but not in the way you might expect…and not in that same order.

We are "Co-Parents"..."Elective Co-Parents". We are not against traditional relationships but chose to go a different route than what was expected of us, while staying true to ourselves.

WHY WRITE A BOOK?
We are here to not only share our story, but to possibly bring some future co-parents together while educating others. 

Since our videos, news segments and international articles went "viral" all over the world, we are listening to our inner voice to share a more in-depth, raw and engaging story that describes our entire adventure. 

Many are seeking our advice and this is a way to share with others how, when living outside the box, anything is possible.

FUNDING: WHERE IS IT GOING?
According to "The Real Costs of Publishing a Book" on pbs.org, this is the breakdown of the expenses:

Developmental Editing: 
$45-65/hour based on the experience of the editor
70,000/250 = 280 pages
280 pages /5 pages per hour = 56 hours
Low end is 56 x $45 = $2,520
High end is = $18,200

Copy Editing: 
2-10 manuscript pages/hour
$25-50/hour based on the experience of the editor
Low end: $840
High end: $7,000 (if it needs a lot of work)

Book Cover Art and Internal Art
Low end: $150
High end: $3,500

Formating for Print and Digital Conversion
Low end: Free

story:
Do you want to read more stories about future programming and tech? Do you love Vernor Vinge's novels on computer technology in the future? Contribute to our campaign.

Our Story


This contest is being organized by Susan Elliott Sim, a professor of Informatics at University of California, Irvine. I am co-editing an academic book on recent research on helping programmers find and reuse source code on the web.


It’s common to end academic books with a speculative chapter, and what would be more speculative than a science fiction short story? I invited Vernor Vinge to submit a story, because I think the future might be the programmer archeologists that appeared in his “Fire Upon the Deep” and “Deepness in the Sky.” Rather than writing software from scratch, people are taking pieces from existing systems and combining them. In this style of programming, knowing the archives is as important as the ability to put the pieces together.


Unfortunately, Vinge declined. However, he did give his blessing for a short story contest. So, here we are.


Why a contest?

We could have just commissioned an author or paid for a short story by the word, but a contest would go further to grow the community of authors writing hard science fiction about future computer technology. The contest is open to everyone, both published and unpublished authors. There is no entry fee.


We will have a panel of judges, which further builds the community. We plan to have one published author and one aspiring author.

The Impact

We are raising funds for prizes to ensure that we receive a good number of high quality submissions. Writing fiction is a labor of love and usually doesn't pay the rent. As fans, we have the opportunity to support authors, which leads to the production of stories that we love.


Being a contest winner also helps an author to get noticed by an agent or big publishing company, which improves their chances of securing that important first contract.

What We Need

Fundraising Goals

First Prize: $500
Second Prize: $200
Third Prize: $100
Honorariums for judges: $600

Remainder to cover costs, such as bank fees and postage.

If we exceed our targets and get lots of submissions, we will publish an anthology of the short stories through an indie press, such as lulu.com. If we don't meet our targets, we will divide up the money that we do receive as prizes.

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends. Tweet our URL. Submit a story. Buy the book.

story:
Short Summary

One City

 Las Vegas is thelargest city in Clark County and is home to most of the schools found within the Clark County School District (which is the fifth largest school district in the nation*). CCSD operates 357 schools within it’s borders making it responsible for over 308,000 students and over 37,000 staff members. Doesn’t seem like a big deal, until you realize Nevada is in last place for education in the United States. That’s where we hope to come in. We may not be able to reeducate the students and raise their reading scores but we are hoping to help start a conversation in the improving the situation our state and our city finds itself in.

One Book

We are starting with one book. In January 2013 we will be launching a book on Amazon’s Kindle. We will be opening a store to sell a book geared towards the 18-30 year old demographic. It’s simple. When someone purchases a copy of Letters from London all of the proceeds goes to purchasing a book for the classroom. Whether that book is part of a class set of books for a High School English class or part of a class library for a third grade class to choose from at silent reading time we will use the proceeds of the selling of our book to buy another book to give to a school to help change the life of a child.

One Child

Even if we ever just sell one book, it will help one child get a book they didn’t have before. Our hopes is just that, we want to at least change the life of one child by giving a book to them through their school. We want to give at least one child another chance to live in the shoes of someone else at least one time in their life. We hope to spark a light in one child to help equip them to want to change their world. If we only ever help one child we would call ourselves successful.

What We Need & What You Get

Our funds will be going to:

  • Purchasing business licenses
  • Intitial publishing costs to get books into hands of local store owners
  • Banners for events to promote our cause

The Impact

When you help donate, you help us be able to give children books. You open up doors for over 300,000 children to get the education they deserve.

If You can't donate money...

...donate time. Buy our book in 2013. Contact your local school district, get invloved in a school.

story:
Why this book?

Awareness. A funny thing happens when someone shares a thought, an idea, or anything for that matter. It triggers something within us that tunes us into the thought patterns and vibrations around the subject discussed. Over the past few years, I have shared with some close friends the pictures I’ve taken of hearts I notice everywhere. It tends to come up rather casually, and ends with me showing a few pictures that I have on my phone. After their initial skepticism of whether I photoshopped or alter the pictures in any way – which I do not – they find it rather peculiar. They leave with a sense of wonder. Inevitably I get the email, phone call, or text message telling me that they saw the most amazing heart in some random place shortly after. Perhaps in a water puddle on the way home from work, the rust mark of their gym locker, or a chip mark in the bark of a tree on a morning walk. Wherever it turns up, one thing is for sure; It triggers a sense of awareness. So, if the ideas we share end up igniting the dormant powers of perception, then why not share the idea of abundant love? That is my vision for this book.
 

Why help?

Why not? As Gandhi said: "be the change you wish to see in the world." Well, we don't all have time to save the world as with magical powers like Superman, or batman, but we can make a difference by sharing the little bit of magic we see in our lives. This can be your way of being a part of something positive, fun, and magical.

 

What We Need & What You Get

- We need: funding to make this happen. A dollar from a-thousand-and-one people is better than a thousand dollars from one person. 

- You get: depending of the perks you pick, anything from our love and gratitude, to a book, art work, even your very own customized print run.

The majority of the money will go to place a bulk order so that the price per unit cost is low enough to sell for a reasonable price, in order to make the book available to as many people as possible so we can share the love. The rest will pay for editing, proofing, book cover design, shipping, storage, distribution, *this video*, etc. 

 

The Impact

The vision in my fantasy world is that this book will trigger the necessary awareness to tune people in to the amazing beauty our world has to offer, slowly allowing them to embody more and more of the magic we all have access to, but seldom harness. Then the movement has begun. A sort of butterfly effect. Hey, you can't sail across the ocean if the butterfly doesn't flap his little wings! Be my butterfly so we can sail this message of love across the seven seas :)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If finances are tight and you really can't spare a few dollars, I understand. However, you can still help by forwarding this to people you know. Or if you have any connections that you think may help get this book out there, anywhere, please let me know. Much love and gratitude!

story:
Our Story

Sexy Synonyms: arousing, cuddly, flirtatious, inviting, provocative, provoking, racy, risquÃ©, seductive, sensual, spicy

What if we started thinking of peace in all these ways? Rather than seeing peace as idealistic, unattainable and stale, Peace Is Sexy aims to show the inviting, seductive and spicy side of peace. Peace Is Sexy profiles people and organizations that are creating peace in the world. We also highlight stories that show the peace that already exists in our world as well as the songs, movies and shows that are already making peace fun and entertaining.

The first phase of Peace Is Sexy is to create a website as a platform for a public conversation about making peace sexy.


The Impact

Peace Is Sexy is part of a larger paradigm shift we hope to create in the mainstream media, to move it from a media of conflict, competition and consumerism to one of creativity, collaboration and community. The more money we raise, the greater the impact we can have, the more media we can generate and the more people we can reach. 

What We Need & What You Get

Your contributions will go first and foremost to pay our web developer (http://grassrootsconsult.com/). After that, our funding priorities include training interns, creating merch and a Google AdWords campaign. 


To thank you for your contribution, we've got these rewards. -->


Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate any contribution, small or large. We also very much appreciate your help in getting the word out about this campaign. Can you tweet this campaign, post it on your Facebook wall, share it with your LinkedIn network, email your contacts about it or even just plain talk about it? Anything you can do to generate some buzz would be tremendously helpful. Use the Facebook and Twitter tools below to do this in just a few clicks.

story:
After the Mass Gentrification of New York City, now renamed Novus City, a rash of unexplained paranormal events threaten its already unstable populace. 

What happens when a Social Worker’s last day before vacation, becomes entangled in eye-witnessed murder and the unraveling of a deep dark secret about the organization he works for?

Is Directive Living, the nation's leading sexual and reproductive health care  facilitator and advocate, all they say they are?

Is PCD a truth? 

And who exactly is Peter Sekham?

Rise in Excellence, my name is DjaDja N Medjay and what you have just read is a brief description of Rising Depth, the next chapter in my Renpet Phenomenon Afro-Futuristic series (Click to learn more about The Renpet Phenomenon).

 

Rising Depth will be the third Novel I have written as a Self-Published Author, which I lovingly refer to as an Afro-Futurism work (Click to learn more about Afro-Futurism)

To be honest, it has been a very challenging journey being the sole operator of my own publications. This is the first time that I am openly asking for outside help. I am very excited about this project because I am taking a different approach to my writing as Rising Depth will be a series of short Novellas offered at a reasonable price to help promote readership.   

Rising Depth will be a crucial element in linking the previous stories within my series as well as helping to widen the field of African-American Sci-Fi/Afro-Futuristic Authors. Ever since I was a child, I have been enthralled with the Sci-Fi genre and when I discovered that many of the principles mirror African or Nubian cultural ideologies and practices, I knew that I had to create those worlds.

Beyond being an interesting and intriguing piece of literary work, this project also represents the blossoming field of Afro-Futurism and Black Sci-Fi writers. A necessary field that will eventually serve the purpose to breathe new life into the already existing Sci-Fi genre as well as strengthening cultural identity for African-Americans and other descendants from Afrika abroad. Being that the world has rapidly become a global community, it is important for every culture to have an equal representation in it. 

I recognize that not everyone may have the monetary means to support this project however there are many other ways to participate:

1) Word of mouth - Spread the word on Twitter, Facebook and other social media networks. Use #rdresearch on Twitter and Instagram.

2) Join my newsletter email list for bi-weekly Afro-Futuristic News --->>> http://visitor.r20.constantcontact.com/manage/optin/ea?v=001lJbhmb9NrcYbZLUJC-WeB_uhjYTN7fE9RNwVeYeHYEIpRT4JUgzrMhTh2MxuFfRHxAITty99mUsnEfgI3pX0WjtMjwDugFCzE7t75qiJe63D9JPbHqGr4V3DxypO-WnKyiPQgDVVNdjraCvq6vZlmf_ChnD0sM-QSXN9fxAeEVgp7-MCEs6xdSUrstQDJPEY6tSmWVLx1rTsKDJ9x_-mJmudbLQeWTzZ6anuSbVZwq1FxGKqK6S3gQ%3D%3D

3) Like my Fanpage on Facebook and Tag/RePost my Posts --->>>https://www.facebook.com/AuthorDjaDjaNMedjay?fref=ts

4) If you read my earlier works then leave a review --->>> http://www.amazon.com/Jaja-N-Medjay/e/B007JVXDJ8/ref=ntt_athr_dp_pel_pop_1

 

Thank you for your time and attention!!!

May you rise in excellence!!!!

 

DjaDja N Medjay

story:
Vision

A Nursing Love Poem tells the universal story of love between a mother and child through their nursing relationship. The charming, durable book is meant to be read aloud to children, to honor and celebrate the incredible gift of breastfeeding.
 

A Book about Nursing:

One thing I’ve never been quite sure about is whether the word “nursing” is reflexive. It sure feels like it is. Am I nursing my child, or is he nursing me? Who is comforting whom? Who is helping the other calm down, relax, and rest?

Nursing with my son has always gone both ways.  When he first latched on after his birth with me propped up in the hospital bed. While we spent long sun-lit afternoons resting side by side during his infancy. When together, we sought comforting breaks from the emotional highs and lows of toddlerhood,  

The word nursing is derived from the Latin word nutrire, which means "to nourish, feed, foster, support, and preserve.” I learned along the way that the “preservation” is literal: through breastfeeding, my body can detect viruses that my baby has been exposed to so I can buffer his immune system with the perfect blend of antibodies in my milk. And that the longer he nurses, the lower my risk of breast cancer.

I had no idea before I became a mother how profoundly life-affirming, empowering, and nourishing the breastfeeding relationship could be, for both mother and child.  It inspired me to write A Nursing Love Poem, a rhyming children's book.  This sweet and colorful story is a celebration of the nursing relationship. It arose from poems I wrote and sentiments I felt over the first two years of my son's life.

 

About Me:

I'm Michelle, Virginia native and mother of 2-year-old Liam. Thanks for taking a moment to check out my project. I am lucky to have tried many interesting things in my life so far. I've worked as a communicator for the federal government, gotten certified as a yoga teacher and wellness coach, become a mom, and gotten way too excited about Myers-Briggs types.

But one thing I've always wanted, for as long as I can remember, is to publish a book. From my preschool days, I would dictate imaginative stories to my mom, which she would dutifully copy down on scrap paper and help me staple together and illustrate. Each one, conveniently, was called "Michelle's Book." So you can imagine my excitement when many years later, inspiration has struck. And the first review is in: Liam can barely finish reading the test copy I printed before asking to nurse! 

 

The Impact

I am thrilled to contribute to the small yet growing collection of children's books honoring and celebrating the gift of nursing. And, from what I've seen, board books on nursing are even harder to find. The set up and creation of a board book is expensive, which is why most children’s books about nursing are in picture book format.  Through this campaign, I plan to print A Nursing Love Poem as a fully-illustrated board book that is durable and easy to share with little ones.

I would love to share it with you and your family, too. This book would be a wonderful gift for you, a loved one, or other soon-to-be or new mothers in your life.

 

Costs of Campaign and Plan for Funding

Self-published board books must be printed in bulk to make them the most economical. With the funding I raise from this campaign, I will prepare and place a bulk order of 500 books, as well as other goodies I’ll be giving away through this campaign. Here is the general cost breakdown:

  • Illustrations ($200)
  • Designs (~$100)
  • Order of 500 books (~$2500)
  • Publishing Costs / ISBNs / Barcode (~$350)

Other, to-be-determined costs include the production of the giveaway greeting cards, shipping, Indiegogo listing fee, and marketing of the book. Speaking of giveaways, in addition to the board book itself, I'm excited to give away unique items for different levels of sponsorship:

  • $15.00 Printable Bookmark Set, featuring illustrations from the book
  • $20.00 A Nursing Love Poem digital E-book (+$15 Level)
  • $30.00 A Nursing Love Poem board book (physical copy)  (+$20 & $15 Levels)
  • $50.00 A Nursing Love Poem board book (physical copy), signed and with a dedication to the recipient (+$20 & $15 Levels)
  • $100.00 A Nursing Love Poem set of 8 Greeting Cards, featuring illustrations from the book (+$50, $20 & $15 Levels)
  • $250.00 1-Hour "Find Your Balance" Coaching Session (+$100, $50, $20 & $15 Levels)
  • $500.00 Three 1-Hour "Find Your Balance" Coaching Sessions + name in A Nursing Love Poem  board book (+$250, $100, $50, $20 & $15 Levels)

If you decide to join and fund my campaign I hope you’ll find, like I did, that the book is ultimately an expression of love, and a way to honor and celebrate the gift of nursing for each of us on this journey.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to financial pledges, I would love if you could forward this link to even just one mother (or father, or auntie, or nana...) with whom you think this campaign would resonate. 

Thanks so much to my family and friends for supporting this creative dream, and to the talented Megan Soule (http://mesoule.com) for her design and layout of the book!

Vision

A Nursing Love Poem tells the universal story of love between a mother and child through their nursing relationship. The charming, durable book is meant to be read aloud to children, to honor and celebrate the incredible gift of breastfeeding.
 

A Book about Nursing:
One thing I’ve never been quite sure about is whether the word “nursing” is reflexive. It sure feels like it is. Am I nursing my child, or is he nursing me? Who is comforting whom? Who is helping the other calm down, relax, and rest?

Nursing with my son has always gone both ways.  When he first latched on after his birth with me propped up in the hospital bed. While we spent long sun-lit afternoons resting side by side during his infancy. When together, we sought comforting breaks from the emotional highs and lows of toddlerhood,  
The word nursing is derived from the Latin word nutrire, which means "to nourish, feed, foster, support, and preserve.” I learned along the way that the “preservation” is literal: through breastfeeding, my body can detect viruses that my baby has been exposed to so I can buffer his immune system with the perfect blend of antibodies in my milk. And that the longer he nurses, the lower my risk of breast cancer.
I had no idea before I became a mother how profoundly life-affirming, empowering, and nourishing the breastfeeding relationship could be, for both mother and child.  It inspired me to write A Nursing Love Poem, a rhyming children's book.  This sweet and colorful story is a celebration of the nursing relationship. It arose from poems I wrote and sentiments I felt over the first two years of my son's life.

story:
Through The Wilderness

Hello and welcome to my campaign. Here's a bit about me and my story! 

  •  My name is Libier Reynolds and I am a Mexican-American woman.  I am a wife to Doug and a mother to Haylee and Madelyn.  I have overcome a few years of healing from being sexually and emotionally abused and have found the freedom to be myself again. I found hope for my future and it has transformed my life. I have had the pleasure of writing a lifestyle blog for a couple of years sharing my heart, beauty and style tips with my readers. 
  • I had the miraculous push to write a book last year in September and in three short months, I had written over 50,000 words all filled with the experience of coming out of self-hatred. An epidemic I find rampant in the lives of the many of the gorgeous and talented women I meet. God gave me favor to meet and have my manuscript read by the McDowells and it was confirmation that God wanted me to share my story with others. They suggested their old-time editor, Dave Bellis for the job to edit my book to be read in the clearest of ways. 
  • I believe so much in my story because it's not just mine. It's God's story about redemption and love and mercy. It's about so many other gals too that are suffering silently just as I was. And I believe that God will be able to use my story to help sort out theirs! 

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • We need $10,000 to  Dave and Tom for the extensive editing and reworking of my story to give it linear structure. I believe that Dave and Tom have something to add to God's story within me! I know that they will take what I wrote and give it more value than I myself could've ever given on my own. I love that we all need each other and we are all important puzzle pieces fitting together beautifully to encourage each other in faith. 
  • With your contribution, you will receive a copy of the manuscript before it actually publishes to the public!  Your name could be inside the manuscript with a gift of $200 or more! 
  • If we happen to not reach the entire goal we will still move forward in the publishing of, Through The Wilderness, your gift will remain true to its first intention which is to get this book published and in the hands of people needing hope! 

The Impact

Your contribution is going to impact the lives of many who are in bondage to self-harm, abuse, mental illness:

  • My book is my story and I don't hold back in talking about very difficult issues of addiction. I've overcome an addiction to pornography in specific and I believe that our world is hurting due to many men and women being addicted to this sad buffer to difficult emotions. And now it's infiltrating the lives of very young boys and girls. 
  • I have taken heed from the bible and gotten help from many advisers, family, mentors like Joanne Cole from Capital Christian, Josh and Dottie McDowell, Rachelle Ditmore from, City of Refuge and I believe that God's confirmation through my husband about my book has been a huge blessing. We are believing God for a miracle. 
  • In the past, I've taken advice from business genius, Daniel Episcope and was able to successfully pull off a pop-up shop that raised money for The Glass Slipper. It was an idea at first but Daniels advise of concrete and even-at-times intimidating framework of goals and intentionality, helped me with executing the idea into action. 

Risks & Challenges

In the past, I've been known to take something and not finish. I've been known to have a lot of self-doubts. I am a new author so publishers wouldn't risk their name on mine. I've struggled with depression and anxiety.

  • But you know who would take a risk on me or you? God! Because he has called us by our name. This book is a miracle just in the way of it having a solid identity, so I believe that while in my natural state I am not qualified, God qualifies me in his infinite love and strength. I believe that God can multiply the little I have and that he will get the glory in the end for this book or anything else I can do to add value to this world in my future! 
  • I have many people in my life who are now keeping me accountable. I have a therapist that I see once a month. I go to different mentors and have accountability through my closest family and friends. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Sometimes you just can't contribute, I totally understand that!  That doesn't mean you can't help:

  • You can pray. That's ALWAYS one of my favorite things to ask for and to do for people. Prayer works! 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word about this campaign if you know anyone that would be excited to hear about it! 

In love and respect, 

Libier

story:
The Lonely Dad's Stories Book

About project. About me.

I'm stepmother and divorcee. I work in advertising.

Past work was the most important issue. Now, I believe family is the really important thing.

I want to create an amazing book for divorced dads and their little children. I have learned valuable lessons of them.

This book is a present for my couple and their little stepdaughters. They have created the stories. I want to produce the book properly to share with them and with other Lonely Dads and their families.

What We Need & What You Get

I need 2.500€ to produce the “Lonely Dads Stories” Book. I will send you all a free digital copy of the book as soon as I have it (September 2013). I want to produce it properly with nice illustrations and a good story telling.

If I don't reach my entire goal, I will try to produce a lite version. I really believe in this project. I think there's not nice literature for divorced dads and their little children.

The Impact

My project contributes to valorize the figure of the divorce dad who works each day to maintain their children without the everyday love and company of their little children.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, don’t worry. You can help me making noice about my campaign. Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
February 27, 2014

To Whom It May Concern 

I am reaching out to share a dream that I have. The time is ripe to speak up, reclaim my power and share something deeply personal. I have been through the dark night of the soul and I want to continue my healing through writing. If you are interested, I have a project I would like for you to be a part of. Your contribution and support matters to me. 

Some of you know that I was my yoga teacher’s assistant. Not everyone knows that I was sexually assaulted at the teacher training in Los Angeles. When I came forward there were mixed reactions to what happened.  It has been one of the hardest experiences that I have ever had to face and it has been very difficult to navigate. I have experienced every emotion under the sun, moon and stars— from complete suffering and a desire to end my life to the most immense gratitude that I am free, alive, and loved.

I don’t believe anger creates change. However, I know that it can be channeled into social awareness, growth and finally the faith that each of our lives has a greater purpose. Einstein said that one of the biggest decision we have to make is whether or not we believe that this is a kind universe. In all honesty it has taken a lot of digging to finally feel that we do live in a kind universe and that I can transform adversity into a conscious gift to the world. 

In February of 2013 I stepped down from teaching the series that I dedicated 6 years of my life to. I walked away from the organization completely. As you would imagine this put me at a disadvantage economically. I moved back in with my mom and retreated from the world. I have spent my time getting training as a life coach, collaborating with other women, healing my body, and writing. Writing has been my medicine. It was very exciting when elephant journal recognized my work and published a few articles on their site. 

In order to find my self again I came back to my zazen practice, and replaced my normal yoga routine with a dance-centered practice. With that being said I miss teaching. I had dreams to open my own studio. I have been asking myself very deep questions about what it means to be a teacher. I want to bring light to the shadow of sexual violence, sexual harassment, and misuse of power that has been plaguing our yoga community and our world. My tool is the written word. 

With your help I want to self-publish a book. I am not interested in going to a publishing company, or telling my story in a magazine. I want my voice to come through as a very sacred offering. I do not wish to create an exposé on the perpetrator, recount litigious details or somehow revenge my honor. 

All I want, is to create a beautiful offering from what has taken a lot of strength to endure. I want to know that I did my part to make the world a safer and more loving place for the children I intend to have. I want every generation after me to know that I did not let it crush my spirit or belief in yoga. 

Any donations are welcome. It could be as small as the price of a cup of coffee or as big as you feel compelled to offer. In participating you would be supporting me to focus while I think, heal, love and write my journey—the lessons I have learned,  the healing I have experienced, and the awareness I wish to bring to others. In gratitude for your support you will receive a published ebook with a bonus chapter on energy healing practices, and a personalized note from me as a blessing for harmony and joy in your life.  

In all of this, I hope to inspire courage. Cour-age is made up of the latin root, “cour” which means, of the heart. We, humans, are powerful beyond measure when we remember our innate capacity for love. Love is our strength to create change in our communities and world. 

Thank you! 

Maggie Marie Genthner

story:
Flak Magazine

Flak is an arts publication founded by Michael McFadden, Paul Middendorf, and Elizabeth Rhodes. The three of us began to discuss Flak Magazine and the many forms it could take because we felt there was a space in Houston that wasn't being occupied. We wanted to create something representative of the city not only in its current, local form but in its impact on artists and creatives around the world. There's a vast network of people who are from this city, visited for fellowships/residencies, and/or generally been impacted by the Houston arts community. 

Through Flak, we want to tap into that network and serve as a sort of repository or directory for those experiences. 

Issue 0

The inaugural issue of Flak Magazine, Issue 0, is reflective of our own connections to Houston. We looked at some of the artists we first worked with when we connected with the arts here or who have been integral in our development and sought to showcase their growth, representing the current state of their work as well as where they've come from and where they're going. 

The artists of Issue 0 are Ryan Hawk, Cody Ledvina, S Rodriguez, and Bret Shirley. While these artists don't paint a picture of Houston's arts community in its entirety, they represent a variety of aspects intermingling within: study, personal growth, departure, and return. Each artist presents a new work that illustrates the current state of their artistic practice.  

What We Need & What You Get

Consider this an expanded presale of Issue 0. You can purchase the issue at our base level and receive a copy of it either at our launch event or by mail (perhaps even delivery if you're in Houston). We certainly appreciate anyone willing to throw down money to support our creative efforts!  

Please consider contributing at higher levels as a means to establish a more sustainable future for the publication. When you contribute at these levels, you'll receive the issue plus some excellent Flak merch. You can even be listed in the Issue as a supporter!

Truly, though, you'll be helping us in our efforts to keep Flak both affordable and equitable, ensuring that we pay participating artists and writers what they deserve! 

The Impact

As previously stated, your contribution helps us to expand what we are able to do with Flak. You keep Flak affordable, allowing for a lower threshold for access, but you also help us establish future endeavors, such as a Digital Artist Residency - a paid residency open to any artist with a digital practice (essentially anything that can be put on the Internet) and a real connection to the city of Houston. 

 

Video created by The Forrester Project.

story:
Story of My Book

 

My name is Darren Huang and I am the author of The Impermanent Light.


My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover what it’s like to be an international student studying in a foreign country. In this book, I hope to impress upon you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for music. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help dissolve judgements toward others, and for my fellow international students – believe in your pursuit, as the reward awaits ashore.

In this book, you'll learn about the concept of impermanence and the emotional impact of music. Some of the events include:

  • Leaving Home
  • Attending Film Concert
  • Father Visits

You will love this book if you love music. You will love this book if you enjoy hearing about self-transformative experiences.

The Impermanent Light is a novel that may speak to international students and musicians who are studying abroad and pursuing a passion in music.

 

The Book - The Impermanent Light

 

The book is written in 3 Parts....

Part 1 contains the introduction. You will meet the main character Espe who leaves home to pursue his studies abroad:

“The plane engine rumbled, and Espe's heart fluttered along. He listened carefully as the flight attendant announced the safety instructions.”

Part 2 contains Chapters 2–11. His journey begins at orientation where he meets Amelie – the international student mentor. A heartfelt story of music and friendship ensues:

“Amelie suddenly turned toward Espe. Their eyes locked. Their complexions flowered. She looked back. Espe gulped for air as Mr. Russo's voice brought him back to class.”

Part 3 contains Chapters 12-13. Espe returns home:

“There. She stood abidingly, a bouquet of yellow roses held in her hand, densely abloom. His heart skipped a beat as he walked toward her...”

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

 

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2019
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter

 

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

 

Darren Huang is a composer currently pursuing a Master of Music in Contemporary Media and Film Composition at the Eastman School of Music. Born in Toronto, raised in Beijing, and having moved to the U.S. at the age of 15, his experiences studying abroad had prompted him to share his story through music and writing.

Aside from composing, Darren had been a part of the YellowJackets (University of Rochester premier a cappella group) for the past four years as he completed his studies in Business (B.A.) and Music (B.A.). He also created his own band (The Sircle) and co-founded UR Beatbox Collective during his time at University of Rochester.

For more information you can connect with Darren at his composer's website, email: dhuang13@u.rochester.edu,  Facebook, and Instagram.

 

Risks & Challenges

 

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #ImpermanentLight and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

 

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!


With gratitude,

Darren Huang

story:
We'll be launching PlateIt Magazine very soon and are looking for your support! Plated will be available digitally each month, and we will be producing an expanded print version 4 times each year.

If you simply want to receive the FREE digital monthly version you can sign up here.

PlateIt is a digital and print publication that takes you behind the burner, making kitchen conversation more accessible for gourmandizers everywhere. Covering everything from our favorite restaurants and bars, to the cooking gadgets home chefs covet, you'll also find new product reviews, in-depth interviews and tempting recipes, lovingly plated up just for you.

What are we eating? Where does it come from? The next generation of epicureans are entrenched in the culture of food and progressively explore these questions; jumping on the newest culinary world trends as they happen.

This is your official invitation to embrace every gluttonous instinct within a community of gastronomic pleasure seekers, wrapped up in pretty packaging that visually focuses on what's most important to all of us...the food!

The PlateIt founding team includes a published food writer and editor, a culinary industry insider and digital media executives.

story:
The California Writers Club Tri-Valley Branch has been a part of the writing community since 2005. We want to encourage young writers in the Livermore-Amador and San Ramon Valleys by giving them a chance to be recognized for their talent and win cash prizes. The students get a chance to tell their stories, and keep all rights to their work. The club invites students to become members, but does not require membership to enter the contest. By contributing to this campaign, you will be showing young writers that their community cares about the arts.

We need $1000 to provide 1st, 2nd and 3rd place prizes to students in local high schools. Whatever is raised will go directly to the prizes. Any funds over and above the $1000 goal will go toward funding prizes for next year's contest.

Contributors at the $5 level will receive a "Thank You" email acknowledging support. Donors at the $15 level will receive a "Thank You" email and be listed in the program for the awards ceremony and on the Tri Valley Writers website. Contributors at the $50 level will receive the email, acknowledgement in the program, and a copy of Voices of the Valley: First Press. This anthology includes stories, essays and poems by members of Tri Valley Writers.

This is the second High School Writing contest for the club. Our first contest drew a wonderful response from the community. We would like to establish an annual contest for young writers by establishing a dedicated fund for prizes.

Even if you can't contribute now, you can let people know about this campaign with Indiegogo's share options. Let your community know that you value good stories and the people who write them!
