story:
Salut. Mă numesc Marius Băraş, locuiesc în Constanţa şi sunt scriitor şi compozitor.

  În cadrul acestei campanii vă prezint “CÂNTECUL TÂNĂRULUI LUP”, primul volum din saga fantasy “CEL-CE-ADUCE-FANTOMELE”. Povestea se va întinde pe cel puţin 4 volume, intriga cărţii cerând o amplă descriere a evenimentelor şi a lumii astfel create. 

   Deşi până acum am scris 3 volume de poezie şi povestiri science-fiction, acesta este romanul meu de debut. Cred însă cu tărie în ideea acestei cărţi şi sunt convins că va fi o saga bine primită de public dacă voi avea sprijinul vostru în această campanie. 


Despre ce este vorba?

   “ În Nordul Europei, cu multe mii de ani în urmă, un misterios bătrân războinic umblă din sat în sat în căutare de viitori ucenici. Sosirea lui într-o aşezare este însoţită de cele mai ciudate zvonuri.

    Un personaj neînţeles despre care oamenii vorbesc lucruri stranii, contradictorii. Şi asta deoarece criteriul lui de selecţie a viitorilor ucenici nu e forţa, sau abilitatea de a mânui arme, ci arta, pornirea de a fi artist, puterea de a vedea dincolo de aparenţe.

        

   Tinerii pe care-i alege sunt ba muzicanţi, ba pictori, dansatori sau poeţi. Fiindcă bătrânul ştie că lumea nu e doar ceea ce ochii arată şi cel care o priveşte doar cu ochii e pierdut pe vecie. Căci artistul are de-a face cu o întreagă lume invizibilă, având pregătite instincte care în ceilalţi oameni sunt adormite de-a binelea.

   O lupta surdă se dă între forţe misterioase, încă nerevelate, iar bătrânul războinic pregăteşte următoarea generaţie de războinici pentru a putea proteja oamenii. Căci fire invizibile leagă existenţele şi destinele acestora cu viziuni ucigătoare, coşmaruri tenebroase şi frici adânci, frici care ameninţă raţiunea însăşi şi echilibrul întregii lumi.” 

Aici pot fi citite primele 3 capitole ale cărţii:

http://www.scribd.com/doc/181974830/CANTECUL-TAN%C4%82RULUI-LUP-Marius-B%C4%83ra%C5%9F-fragment-pdf

 

Scopul acestei campanii

   În cadrul acestei campanii cei interesaţi pot comanda CARTEA TIPĂRITĂ şi alte cadouri din partea autorului.

    Scopul acestei campanii este de a strânge banii necesari tipăririi acestui prim volum într-un tiraj de 1.000 de exemplare (la 1.000 de exemplare tipărite se recuperează costurile matriţei tipografice, şi costurile de tipărire devin rezonabile; la un tiraj mai mic costurile cresc şi se lucrează pe tipografie digitală, nu offset).

     Singura diferenţă pentru cititor este că el nu o va cumpăra din raft, ci va dona banii pentru un exemplar (ca un fel de pre-comandă), aşteptând apoi pînă la data anunţată ca acesta să îi fie livrat. Plătind însă cartea în avans, el îl ajuta pe autor să tipărească exemplarul şi, după ce campania se va fi terminat, cartea va fi tipărită şi trimisă solicitantului. 

    Neputând şti însă câţi oameni vor fi interesaţi să-mi comande cartea, preţul cărţii tipărite va fi socotit în aşa fel încât, la nevoie, să se poată tipări şi câteva zeci de exemplare, dacă este cazul. Dar chiar şi-aşa, apelând la serviciile unei tipografii digitale, pentru solicitant preţul cărţii va ajunge la fel ca într-o librărie, în momentul unei lansări de carte. Diferenţa este aceea că se sare peste intermediar, iar banii care îmi rămân după ce scad costurile de tipărire şi livrare pot fi folosiţi pentru tipărirea altor exemplare.

    

TOATE ACESTE LUCRURI POT DEVENI POSIBILE CU AJUTORUL VOSTRU. 

    Această campania se va termina pe ................. iar în aproximativ 2 săptămâni din acel moment voi primi banii care s-au adunat prin alte modalităţi de plată decît PayPal (cei achitaţi prin PayPal îi voi primi de cum au fost transferaţi). Astfel, îmi iau o lună ca să pot rezolva toate aspectele legate de tipărirea şi livrarea cărţii. Ca să fiu sigur că nu intervine ceva (întârzieri la tipografie, la livrare, etc.) data până la care o să primiţi cartea (sau orice altceva pentru care aţi optat) este ..................... Bineînţeles că dacă voi putea să fac livrarea mai devreme o voi face, dar îmi doresc să nu dezamăgesc pe nimeni şi prefer să îmi iau o marjă de siguranţă.

 

Lucrul la campania cărţii

    Am muncit din greu la această campanie. Am făcut desenele eu însumi, am compus muzica spotului, am asistat editarea audio şi pe cea video. Am înregistrat până şi voice-over-ul spotului campaniei pentru că am vrut să îl personalizez, am vrut să fiu eu însumi povestitorul care vă atrage în misterul CELUI-CE-ADUCE-FANTOMELE, să mă port aidoma unui personaj invizibil din propria mea carte. Şi mi-a plăcut la nebunie. 

    Am vrut să-mi împărtăşesc convingerile şi să vă arăt pasiunea mea ca artist. Şi, credeţi-mă, lucrul la această campanie a fost cu adevărat o experienţă extraordinară. În plus, mă bucur că am creat premii interesante pentru cei care vor ajuta acest proiect.  

     De asemenea, le sunt recunoscător tuturor prietenilor care m-au ajutat să creez această campanie: Elvis Ciurariu, Răzvan Malciu, Andrei Ududec, Paul Năsăudeanu, Costin Beizadea, Patricia David şi Adrian Stavian.

 

Campanie flexibilă  

    

  Aceasta înseamnă că, indiferent că nu îmi voi atinge scopul financiar propus, voi putea păstra suma strânsă şi, în loc de 1.000 de exemplare voi tipări doar câteva sute. Bineînţeles, tipografia va cere un preţ ceva mai mare pentru fiecare exemplar, dar cartea va ajunge la voi fără probleme, în condiţiile prestabilite. A nu se uita că în suma pretinsă în campanie sunt incluse şi comisioanele platformei Indiegogo, şi costurile tipăririi afişelor, posterelor şi felicitărilor, inclusiv taxelor poştale pentru livrarea cărţilor sau a celorlalte premii.

   Dacă îmi voi atinge scopul propus în această campanie voi putea beneficia de propriul meu produs, restul depinzând de felul în care vor merge încasările propriu-zise şi de felul în care voi elabora strategia de marketing. Bineînţeles, şi de acel dram de noroc necesar oricărei acţiuni de genul acesta. Însă eu am încredere că o să fie bine.

    Aşa că, ajutaţi această campanie cum puteţi. COMANDAŢI CARTEA sau premiile pe care le voi oferi, şi daţi mai departe în lista voastră de prieteni. Vorbiţi cu oamenii pe care îi cunoaşteţi despre acest proiect. Avem 3

0 de zile la dispoziţie pentru a promova această campanie.

  SPRIJINIŢI ARTIŞTII INDEPENDENŢI ŞI PROIECTELE LOR ATÂT PRIN FINANŢARE CÂT ŞI PRIN PROMOVARE ! 

     Vă mulţumesc anticipat pentru orice formă de ajutor. Toate cele bune!


ACULTAŢI CÂNTECUL ACESTUI TÂNĂR LUP MISTERIOS.

VĂ MULŢUMESC TUTUROR PENTRU SUSŢINERE.

    Am muncit din greu la această campanie. Am făcut desenele eu însumi, am compus muzica spotului, am asistat editarea audio şi pe cea video. Am înregistrat până şi voice-over-ul spotului campaniei pentru că am vrut să îl personalizez, am vrut să fiu eu însumi povestitorul care vă atrage în misterul CELUI-CE-ADUCE-FANTOMELE, să mă port aidoma unui personaj invizibil din propria mea carte. Şi mi-a plăcut la nebunie. 
    Am vrut să-mi împărtăşesc convingerile şi să vă arăt pasiunea mea ca artist. Şi, credeţi-mă, lucrul la această campanie a fost cu adevărat o experienţă extraordinară. În plus, mă bucur că am creat premii interesante pentru cei care vor ajuta acest proiect.  
     De asemenea, le sunt recunoscător tuturor prietenilor care m-au ajutat să creez această campanie: Elvis Ciurariu, Răzvan Malciu, Andrei Ududec, Paul Năsăudeanu, Costin Beizadea, Patricia David şi Adrian Stavian.
 

Campanie flexibilă  

    
  Aceasta înseamnă că, indiferent că nu îmi voi atinge scopul financiar propus, voi putea păstra suma strânsă şi, în loc de 1.000 de exemplare voi tipări doar câteva sute. Bineînţeles, tipografia va cere un preţ ceva mai mare pentru fiecare exemplar, dar cartea va ajunge la voi fără probleme, în condiţiile prestabilite. A nu se uita că în suma pretinsă în campanie sunt incluse şi comisioanele platformei Indiegogo, şi costurile tipăririi afişelor, posterelor şi felicitărilor, inclusiv taxelor poştale pentru livrarea cărţilor sau a celorlalte premii.
   Dacă îmi voi atinge scopul propus în această campanie voi putea beneficia de propriul meu produs, restul depinzând de felul în care vor merge încasările propriu-zise şi de felul în care voi elabora strategia de marketing. Bineînţeles, şi de acel dram de noroc necesar oricărei acţiuni de genul acesta. Însă eu am încredere că o să fie bine.
    Aşa că, ajutaţi această campanie cum puteţi. COMANDAŢI CARTEA sau premiile pe care le voi oferi, şi daţi mai departe în lista voastră de prieteni. Vorbiţi cu oamenii pe care îi cunoaşteţi despre acest proiect. Avem 30 de zile la dispoziţie pentru a promova această campanie.
  SPRIJINIŢI ARTIŞTII INDEPENDENŢI ŞI PROIECTELE LOR ATÂT PRIN FINANŢARE CÂT ŞI PRIN PROMOVARE ! 
     Vă mulţumesc anticipat pentru orice formă de ajutor. Toate cele bune!
ACULTAŢI CÂNTECUL ACESTUI TÂNĂR LUP MISTERIOS.
VĂ MULŢUMESC TUTUROR PENTRU SUSŢINERE.

story:
Pixie Dust Like Non-Pareille ©2012

...is the title of Ronja's proposal as well as her poetry manuscript for whose publication this campaign is intended.

Ronja Vieth got a Ph.D. in American Gothic Literature, but is also a passionate poet and has been writing poetry since she can remember. However, academic settings still discriminate; while majors in Creative Writing now get academic positions in literature and publishing opportunities for their writing, literary scholars who also write have much fewer chances to publish their books. Being a scholar, finding a publisher for poetry is very hard.

Nevertheless, Ronja rejoices in making her poetry accessible to the public; she not only organized poetry readings for local poets at the Lubbock First Friday Art Trails' galleries or Lubbock's coffee shops, but has read her work at national and international conferences and local charity events (you may find some of those on Facebook englobe.me). There are even some YouTube videos, when you look for EnglobeMe or the Lubbock Speakeasy. Some of her poems already got published online and in journals, such as Bohemia, The Lindenwood Review, Linden Avenue, the Southwest Review and others (see a sample in the gallery tab and browse on Facebook), but in order to allow more anglophone poetry fans across the world access to her poetry, she would like it to be available as a printed book and e-book.

Therefore, Ronja's campaign seeks to raise funds to allow her to 1) finish editing her poetry manuscript and 2) enter it in book competitions, because this is the best way to get your manuscript printed when you do not personally know a publisher - it is POETRY, after all! ;)

At this point she is editing her manuscript of 75 pages of completed poetry, looking for venues, and sending individual poems  to journals in order to gain future name recognition. The goal is to send her manuscript to as many poetry book competitions as possible before their deadlines end, hopefully to between 10 and 25 publishers within the next three months. In order to do that, she needs funds to support herself in the process and enter those competitions, all of which require a substantial reading fee of around $25. 

Ronja's manuscript is unique, however. As a South-African born German writing in English, her background makes her as interesting as the story she tells with her poems. The poems, all in chronological sequence, delineate her turbulent encounter with her first same-sex partner, the ups and downs, and final throes in a city that unashamedly and proudly assumes the title "Buckle of the Bible Belt." 

Famous poet Naomi Shihab Nye (in picture below), who met Ronja at the 2012 Western Literature Association conference in Lubbock, says of her writing: "Thanks for sharing your poems with me! Your poems are most succulent and original!" 

As you can see, there are already lots of people excited about Ronja's endeavor trusting that she will use even the smallest amount donated for the reading fees it takes to enter her manuscript. Be part of art, support Ronja in her contribution to poetry! Donate and / or spread the word! Tell people, Facebook, twitter, doodle it, and shout it from the rooftops! Oh, and use the Indiegogo tools...

October 2012 First Friday Art Trail, Lubbock, TX. Anna Lovering reading. Organized by englobe.me

story: Whack The Wax breakable heads provide stress relief. Anyone stressed out there? Want to use a little of what's left of your fiat money to get some satisfaction? Whack The Wax breakable heads are made from a thin shell of wax and designed to smash dramatically. Wax is non-toxic and won't get any sharp edges. Whack The Wax breakable heads has over 20 years of history. While particularly frustrated by my employer one day (that's another story) it seemed to me, designing an object to safely release that frustration would be handy. Several materials and designs were tried before wax and head shaped were selected. The original Whack The Wax beakable head was designed to be androgynous. Potentially made up by the user to resemble who/what they want. Later, investors approached me to produce a Saddam Hussein version. I have a lot of stories to tell from this version. Meeting David Letterman is one story. Meeting the owner of Slinky and other big time marketers like Dr. Fad. The Saddam Hussein version was available in at least one US Nationwide chain. Our biggest customer at the time Hills Department Stores, which went bankrupt (and that's another story) The Tonite Show with Johnny Carson featured the Saddam version on one of his Christmas toy bits. (He also included it in another bit, but as a prop.) Barely surviving Hill's Bankruptcy we continued to produce various versions like Boss, Bully, Salesman, Ex-Husband/Wife but did not get new funding and national media again until doing the Brian Mulroney (past Prime Minister of Canada) This version made front page of the national paper and Mulroney quit not long after. We enjoyed all types of radio and television interest for the duration. The media blitz did not translate into dollars. Whack The Wax became a memory for many years. About 18 months ago, a new investor approached me to produce the Osama version. After producing the new version, the plan was to produce several YouTube videos then start the press releases. Several videos were produced, showing a steady improvement in video skills (in my opinion.) Just about the time we were preparing to do our first press releases, we heard the news about Osama. That put an end to that. Having such a long history means that I am getting old. At this point, I'm not thinking of riches but just of promoting my idea and having fun. This campaign is for flexible funding towards a Barack Obama version of Whack The Wax breakable heads. It is an urgent campaign since it is related to current events. I'm asking for your help raising $12,523. The first $5,500 goes to the artist to produce an original high quality sculpture of the subject. The next $1,500 will provide 3 hyrdrostone master copies to be used for mold making and one master mold made from rubber with fibreglass backing. $1,200 will go towards the high quality, high temperature wax we use for the first run of heads. $1,000 will provide the first run of plastic display boxes. $800 will go towards shipping containers. The last $2523 will be reserved for costs to run the campaign (Indiegogo fees), paypal fees, shipping costs and any other costs. If the money is pledged to this campaign, I promise to produce the new version (Barack Obama) Whack The Wax breakable heads as quickly as possible. Immediately upon receiving the mold, a first run of 100 heads will be produced. All heads from this run will be used for videos and other promotions. Heads used for videos will be remelted into new heads. Providing an inexhaustible supply for videos. Videos will continue to be released on a regular basis until the version becomes obsolete. All videos will attempt to demonstrate using the Barack Obama version Whack The Wax breakable head to relieve stress. In most cases, I will attempt to use comedy. To get an idea of the type of ideas I have used in the past, you can review any of the Osama videos posted on the WhackTheWax YouTube channel. I admit my early videos really suck but I think I got better. Some of the early videos on the channel did not include make-up (color) added to the head. I had forgotten that all those years ago, we decided it was necessary to color the heads. Custom color will be added to the Barack version as appropriate while of course starting with a flesh tone wax base. Heads would be available for purchase at some time but only as they become available and only by request. This is not an attempt to make money. The more money invested in the version when it becomes obsolete, the more that is lost (speaking from experience.) Estimated cost for a Barack Obama version Whack The Wax breakable head complete with display box, insert and custom shipping packaging will be between $10 - $15 plus shipping. If no heads are sold but we have lots of fun (and maybe some more media for my idea) sobeit. Let's do it! If you can't contribute financially, you can by sharing this campaign. Thank you.

story:
The What

Athena Leonidas lives a simple life in the countryside, far from the crowds and decadence of the city of Achillea. The daughter of a retired general, she has the status and freedom to pursue her passion for inventions and devices, and she doesn’t care if people think she is strange.

But then comes a day when the sky goes dark. Black warships descend like the night, capturing the city in the name of the legendary Tyrant, and when Athena’s father returns to Achillea to help defend it, he vanishes.

Athena travels to the city for news of her father, only to find him imprisoned and sentenced to die with the leaders of the resistance. Seeking his release, she confronts the terrible Beast – the monstrous minion of the Tyrant who led the attack and now controls the kingdom. He offers her a bargain: if she will be his slave, her father will be spared. Desperate, she agrees.

Fitted with a strange collar to make her obedient, she is subjected to the animalistic lusts of the conqueror. Yet, save for the collar, she is not restrained, and while she debases herself at his command, she manages to slip away to save those targeted for arrest and death. She masks her face and names herself the Rose as she fights the occupation with sword, pistol, and all her formidable intellect.

But time is running out. The Tyrant himself will soon arrive to inspect his new conquest, and when that day comes the streets will run with blood. Athena must find a way to free her country from the yoke of tyranny. She must find a way to kill the Beast.

But Athena has discovered something she never expected: within the monster is the heart of a man. She alone sees the humanity hidden beneath horns and claws. What does she feel for him? What does he feel for her? What will happen when the Tyrant arrives, and all must be laid bare and fought for—won or lost?

 

So what makes this story so great?  Why should you support it?
 

  • This is a steampunk/dieselpunk retelling of the Beauty and the Beast story with mad science, adventure, swashbuckling, and intrigue.
  • Strong female lead!  Athena is the main character, a brave, intelligent girl who has to face danger and evil on her own.
  • Action!  You know I like some violence, and I guarantee Beauty and the Blade will feature plenty of battles, escapes, and swordplay.
  • Perks!  Ebooks, print books, and more!  Perks include jewelry, cameos, and bonus scenes.
  • And as always, there will be hot, steamy sex.  In Adventurotica you don't just have to imagine your favorite characters hooking up.

I am hyped about this book.  Beauty and the Beast is one of my favorite stories and I think this will be a fun, exciting, BDSM take on it.  Please support me so I can keep writing the kind of plot-driven genre erotica no one else is doing!

What We Need & What You Get

  • Funds go to pay my rent, bills, etc.  This is it, this is my livelihood.  I don't have a day job, so this is what I do.
  • All perks are fulfilled by me, by hand.  You will get to see the book written almost in real time, as it posts on www.adventurotica.com chapter by chapter.  Once it is done, the ebook will follow almost immediately, and then the print book.
  • Even if I don't reach goal, everyone gets what they paid for, no matter what.

The Impact

Here's where I'm supposed to talk about how this project is important to the world.  Which probably seems silly, only I think this project - and others like it - are very important.  This is the cutting edge of the publishing business, and here I am trying to prove by example that a writer can make a living at what they want to do.  And I don't mean be one of the one-in-a-million longshots we all read about.  I mean being able to be good at what I do and with that carve out a career that can support my modest life.

  • Here I am dismantling the gatekeepers and the idea of the arts as a lottery.
  • I have run 14 campaigns to success before this one.
  • You help keep me alive, and I entertain you.  That's what I do here.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, the most important thing you can do is share.  The hardest thing about these campaigns is making my voice heard above the tumult of the internet and standing out.  Signal boost!  Reblogs, Facebook posts, Tweets - everything helps!

story:
"Her novella reaches way down deep. Amazing, uniquely powerful, a heart's deepest cry and a heart in battle. Blew me away." 

- John Zerzan, author of Against Civilization, and Running on Emptiness


Short Summary

liminal is the first ground breaking work of fiction by anti-civilization activist, Natasha Alvarez. Natasha is a co-founder and primary author of the Year of Black Clothing blog, an exploration of mourning, solidarity and rebellion living on a planet in collapse.

     liminal is a story about an environmental activist turned mother and lover. Having seen what civilization has done to our world, she has committed to drastic action. Told through letters, journal entries and photos, liminal is a walk through one year of her life. The joys, the sorrows, and the ultimate, and heart breaking decision that will change everything. 

     This is the story of life catastrophically aligned with the death throws of a globalized, technologically driven civilization. This is learning to love the earth, developing relationships, understanding loss, feeling lust, and touching the void of community against the backdrop of a disaster. 

     liminal takes you to that brink, that moment where you can almost feel what life could and should be like. It plunges you deep into that moment and asks with heart and soul, love and fury, "what would you do?"

In Natasha's words,

"As a mother and anti-civ, environmental activist, I am constantly confronted by the fact that the world I have to give my child is beautiful, but also undeniably damaged. 

The water is poisoned, the air is toxic, the food is filled with chemicals. I'd do anything to change things so he could have a chance to grow up on an intact planet. 
Liminal has allowed me to explore the question "how far would I go?" as a mother, activist, and lover of the natural world. 
What would you do, to save yourself, your family, the planet? These are the questions we all must ask ourselves, and we must not be afraid to push ourselves, and each other for answers. 
Liminal is that push."

Illustrated with the photography of Michelle Johnsen, Yank, and Wilson Alvarez, with a forward by Kevin Tucker, liminal is story you won't soon forget.

Black and Green Press is an anarcho-primitivist publisher and resource dedicated to targeting civilization in all of its forms and engaging readers to turn against the domestication of their own lives and embracing wildness.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to fund the book completely. Black and Green Press is motivated by spreading the word. We feel strongly about this story and want to get it into as many hands as possible. 

     Our goal is $2,500 which will cover the expected print run. Anything beyond that will help us expand the run, expand the reach, and greatly reduce the cost of the book for anyone who is interested. Any additional money made will help fund future Black and Green Press projects. 

     The nature of the fundraising is to act as a pre-order for the book, but the perks offered can help us achieve much more if one is inclined or willing to help. Any and all help is appreciated. 

The Impact

Your contribution will mean the difference of helping this story and other anti-civilization titles see the light of day or not. In our technologically soaked and social network obsessed society, print is a fading form, yet it remains the means by which we can connect without an internet connection and this book is available at those times when someone needs it the most: around a campfire, when the lights are off, walking in the forest, sitting at your sit spot, or just seeking solace in a corner of the world away from machines. 

     It is important to keep this book and others like it as something physical. Something worth discussing. Something worth soaking in and letting yourself go into it. Something worth feeling.

Other Ways You Can Help

Of course we understand that money isn't the most accessible of skills or assets out there. But please help us spread the word. Help us get this campaign out there. Share it, like it, spread it. 

     If you are interested in reaching out, feel free to email blackandgreenpress [at] gmail (dot) com. 

Please note that the image is a mock up of the cover.


An excerpt from liminal: (please note this is still in draft form)


liminal

a novella

by Natasha Alvarez

**********************************************

Prologue

The winter before everything changed I was lost.

I'd descend the 25 wooden steps to the basement only to stand vaguely, hands empty, gazing, eyes blurred, at the boxes of forgotten belongings. Outdated sweaters, old magazines, baby toys too precious and memory soaked to part with. Pieces of my life, folded and stacked, put away, smelling vaguely of sage and lavender. Scents to keep the moths away, with their soft and papery wings.

Or I'd walk to the mailbox and open the small door, just to look inside, needing to see something empty. Cobwebs in the back, silvery threads, tiny eyes. A look at the lives of those accustomed to living in darkness.

I think my heart already knew what my brain refused to accept

And maybe it was better that way, really.

Less painful.

Hazy.


September


We celebrated Magda's 1st birthday today. It's impossible for me to believe that she is the same creature I felt stirring under my heart just a year ago.

She blew out her candles. It was cold, and the smoke from the small extinguished flame mixed with our breath at her small outdoor party. She wiped frosting in her hair, pink and blue mixing with her own baby yellow, the color of straw. Soft, like feathers.

The leaves are turning red and yellow. We scoop up great bunches of them and throw them into the air, watch them rain down, twirling. Magda is just beginning to walk. She holds both of my hands tight, arms up, like she's balanced on a tightrope. Sometimes she lets go. She is brave.

She likes to ride on Ronin's shoulders, tiny hands wrapped in his hair. She laughs and points, notices the birds in the trees and the geese overhead. Sings to the Owls at dusk. Hoo-hoo. Hoo-hoo. Her first words are bird calls. It seems fitting somehow. Small winged things able to brush the sky.

We take her walking by  the creek near our house, under the big Sycamores with their camouflage bark, limbs stretched high into blue, blue sky. We take off our shoes and socks and dip our feet in, making the most of these last sunny days while it's still a little bit warm.

The water is cold and Magda squeals. She bends down and wants to drink it, and we have to tell her again and again, it's yuck, poison, will surely make her sick. We stick out our tongues and she laughs, thinking it's a game. She is obviously expecting to drink the water here in this beautiful world, our spinning blue-green planet.  I don't know what to tell her. I also, cannot understand.

How people could have broken something

that was never theirs to break?

Magda is 12 months old.

******************************************************************

Magda was born in the fall.

On the autumnal equinox. On the day when dark is equal to light. During the in-between, when the dazzle of summer is just giving way to decay.

I dreamed of horses while pregnant. And the great redwood forests along the Pacific coast. Stallions and mares, Wild and free, running in herds through the open plains, clouds of dust filling the sky. And the giant limbs of the Sequoias, soft, mossy ground, the huge trees towering high above me.

That morning the sky rose pink over the blazing blooms of Jerusalem Artichokes that filled the yard, making  a golden forest that you could not see around, or walk through. We were safe there, hidden from view, tucked away with the Goldfinches and the Warblers, singing their sweet songs.

She was born like a prayer, with me on my knees at the foot of our small bed, clutching Ronin like a wild thing caged as our baby struggled to break free.

Our cries came together, my last and her first, an ancient howling that shook the walls and spoke of shifting bones and watery worlds. My last labor wail a final gift of life.

For her.

Pink lipped and rosy cheeked,

They laid her on my belly and wrapped us together in blankets, a warm reception for weary travelers. We rested, heads on Ronin's chest, and she ate, the first sucks soft, like the tickle of small and colorful wings.

Fluttering.

************************************************************

Dear Ronin,

Before I knew you, I already loved you.

And when I heard your name, I recognized it,

Like an ancient memory written in my bones.

*************************************************



October



The bees are dead.

We opened the hive to check on them one last time before the killing frost and they were already gone, curled and still on the bottom of the hive, and the ground around our feet, their small home eerie without the constant crawling movement of many. Complete collapse.

Ronin gently helped me gather up handfuls of them while Magda played by her swingset, making noise with some toys on a blue blanket on the ground. We buried the bodies in the garden, next to the small pear tree, already bare and waiting for spring.

The squirrels are building their nests. They're quick, and they work hard, carrying mouth full after mouth full of red and yellow leaves up the trunk to the highest branches of the Old Spruce tree at the edge of the yard. The day we buried the bees, we forgot Magda's fuzzy, blue blanket in the yard. Yesterday I picked it up to bring it back inside and noticed little holes where they must have chewed with sharp teeth, stealing downy strands for the center of their cozy nests. I smiled, thinking of the small, furry body nestled in soft cotton and dreamy sky blue, scented sweet, like Magda. I left the blanket where it was.

Magda and I watch them, through the big picture windows, in the morning over breakfast, eating bacon and eggs, or oatmeal and bananas. Last year, they devoured most of the corn out of the garden and drove Ronin crazy. This year, the stray neighborhood cat kept them at bay, a large orange Tom with long whiskers and green eyes. Sometimes we leave him treats, tuna fish and sardines, chicken and beef, our leftovers from dinner and lunch. Gourmet table scraps for a visitor acquainted with the streets. A small offering of thanks. For protection.

Magda is cutting teeth. For many months now she's had just the two little chiclet ones on the bottom. Chompers we call them. But now the others are coming in all at once and it bothers her some days. We give her chamomile, and oat straw, lemon balm tea sweetened with golden honey, precious drops we collected from the bees last year, when they still buzzed with life. She nurses more.

I bought cow's milk, raw, from the farm down the road. She was with me, and we marveled at the large animals, watched them eating, one slow mouthful after the other. I showed her where the milk came from and she laughed. Smooth, pink udders, nearly brushing the floor. But she won't drink it, not from a bottle, and not even warm with cinnamon.

We still have time. We still have time together.  And, I tell myself,  she'll be much older by then, won't really need milk to survive. And it will be hard to get I'd think, afterwards. But still I worry. So hard and so often that I think my heart will break.

Magda is 13 months old

******************************************************

Ronin's dark curls and crinkly eyes were still years off when I agreed to The Plan. He didn't exist for me yet, that cold night I pressed my warm hands palm to palm with the others in a show of truth, honesty and commitment. A small and simple gesture to seal our fate.

The night I wiped my salty tears from my cheeks and felt my heart pounding it's support.

That was the only time I've cried.

Things felt very clear to me then, before my edges were softened by love.

Blurred.

***********************************************************************

Dear Ronin,

I should have been more careful.

Should not have let your rough hands knead the kinks out of my neck, or caress my face with the gentlest touch. Should not have let you point to the stars and talk about space, the endless size of the universe, the intricate process of birthing planets.

I should not have let you kiss me with soft lips, or hold me close and whisper in my ear, or unbutton my pants with careful hands.

I should not have let you say I love you.

I could have stopped you. Could have run the other way, acted cool, aloof.

And that's why you'll hate me. When it's all said and done. Because this could have been avoided, all the pain, all the heartache, the broken promises, the lies.

So many secrets, parts of my life you've never known. Letters, written in code, slipped into the hands of black-clad couriers, in the shadows near the edge of the street lamps.

Phone calls. From seedy payphones and throw away cells.

Briefcases, duffel bags. The workshop in the basement of the empty house. I saw the questions in your eyes, the confusion. I tried to kiss it away, to joke, and shower you with love. But still you must have wondered. The guilt so heavy I covered all our mirrors in our house to avoid the look in my own eyes.

But that all stopped years ago, when The Plan moved from planning stage to waiting. Long before Magda was born. Even before I peed on the stick, 2 little lines the only sign of new life within.

Did I make a mistake? In the heat of the moment, wrapped in your embrace, did I miss my own body's small signals, signs of fertility? Or did I choose not to notice, chose to ignore the possibility of conception that night and instead buried my face in your neck?

Because I wanted a baby. The thing we never talked about. my longing. Oh we discussed it many times, how an earth in collapse was no place to raise a child. How the air, and , water, and soil were poisoned, in no shape to support new life. But I ached to be a mom, To watch my flat belly swell, to feel my breasts grow heavy with milk. To make a family with you.

Was that a mistake? Magda is a gift, to both of us. She lights up the world. Was it wrong to want that? To bring her here?

Knowing what I've known all along?

I've been careful, your safety has always been my number one concern. I never led them here, and you will have help in the days that follow. I have made sure of all that.

I shouldn't have let you in.

But I did.

****************************

Thank you for reading, and thank you for your support!!

"Her novella reaches way down deep. Amazing, uniquely powerful, a heart's deepest cry and a heart in battle. Blew me away." 
- John Zerzan, author of Against Civilization, and Running on Emptiness

Short Summary
liminal is the first ground breaking work of fiction by anti-civilization activist, Natasha Alvarez. Natasha is a co-founder and primary author of the Year of Black Clothing blog, an exploration of mourning, solidarity and rebellion living on a planet in collapse.     liminal is a story about an environmental activist turned mother and lover. Having seen what civilization has done to our world, she has committed to drastic action. Told through letters, journal entries and photos, liminal is a walk through one year of her life. The joys, the sorrows, and the ultimate, and heart breaking decision that will change everything.      This is the story of life catastrophically aligned with the death throws of a globalized, technologically driven civilization. This is learning to love the earth, developing relationships, understanding loss, feeling lust, and touching the void of community against the backdrop of a disaster.      liminal takes you to that brink, that moment where you can almost feel what life could and should be like. It plunges you deep into that moment and asks with heart and soul, love and fury, "what would you do?"In Natasha's words,"As a mother and anti-civ, environmental activist, I am constantly confronted by the fact that the world I have to give my child is beautiful, but also undeniably damaged. 
The water is poisoned, the air is toxic, the food is filled with chemicals. I'd do anything to change things so he could have a chance to grow up on an intact planet. Liminal has allowed me to explore the question "how far would I go?" as a mother, activist, and lover of the natural world. What would you do, to save yourself, your family, the planet? These are the questions we all must ask ourselves, and we must not be afraid to push ourselves, and each other for answers. Liminal is that push."Illustrated with the photography of Michelle Johnsen, Yank, and Wilson Alvarez, with a forward by Kevin Tucker, liminal is story you won't soon forget.Black and Green Press is an anarcho-primitivist publisher and resource dedicated to targeting civilization in all of its forms and engaging readers to turn against the domestication of their own lives and embracing wildness.What We Need & What You GetOur goal is to fund the book completely. Black and Green Press is motivated by spreading the word. We feel strongly about this story and want to get it into as many hands as possible.      Our goal is $2,500 which will cover the expected print run. Anything beyond that will help us expand the run, expand the reach, and greatly reduce the cost of the book for anyone who is interested. Any additional money made will help fund future Black and Green Press projects.      The nature of the fundraising is to act as a pre-order for the book, but the perks offered can help us achieve much more if one is inclined or willing to help. Any and all help is appreciated. The ImpactYour contribution will mean the difference of helping this story and other anti-civilization titles see the light of day or not. In our technologically soaked and social network obsessed society, print is a fading form, yet it remains the means by which we can connect without an internet connection and this book is available at those times when someone needs it the most: around a campfire, when the lights are off, walking in the forest, sitting at your sit spot, or just seeking solace in a corner of the world away from machines.      It is important to keep this book and others like it as something physical. Something worth discussing. Something worth soaking in and letting yourself go into it. Something worth feeling.Other Ways You Can HelpOf course we understand that money isn't the most accessible of skills or assets out there. But please help us spread the word. Help us get this campaign out there. Share it, like it, spread it.      If you are interested in reaching out, feel free to email blackandgreenpress [at] gmail (dot) com. Please note that the image is a mock up of the cover.

Teen Voices at Women’s eNews wants to give more young women the opportunity to be actively involved in creating and influencing international news coverage. We need your help!

Teen Voices at Women’s eNews is a fresh stage in the evolution of Teen Voices, a print publication and mentoring program that began in Boston in 1988. In 2013, the organization entrusted Women’s eNews to retain the brand and expand the Teen Voices mission on a global scale through adult-written articles that put girls’ voices in the mainstream media.

Teen Voices at Women’s eNews will be the premiere source for news on girls’ opinions, innovations and barriers to success, cultivating the next generation of social activist journalists.

The first step in our mission is to create a new virtual newsroom connecting girls across the country digitally and providing a platform for girls to access mentoring opportunities and to get their first bylines on the new Teen Voices website. Your donation today will be a building block for change - you will give girls in towns, cities and schoolrooms opportunities to have their voice heard.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $4,000 to support the virtual newsroom for its first year of operation. In the real world this means:

  • 52 assigned and published articles by teen girls from around the country with each girl paid for her published contribution!
  • 52 teen girls connected with mentors and given personal feedback to improve their journalism with each girl getting firsthand experience with an international newsroom!

In a larger framework of social change this means increasing the presence of young women’s voices and perspectives in content traditionally provided by and found in adult-focused conventional news.

Our Gift to You

These are some of the ways we’ll be saying thank you for helping us to launch the Teen Voices at Women’s eNews Virtual Newsroom!

  • Shout outs and personalized thank you messages on our social media accounts
  • Teen Voices limited edition pin
  • Permanent listing as founding supporter on the Teen Voices website AND a Women's eNews tote bag
  • 1-hour mentoring session with Teen Voices managing editor Katina Paron 
  • 1-hour group mentoring session with Paron on creating social change media by, for and about girls 

The Impact

Teen Voices at Women’s eNews works to achieve two primary objectives:

●  Increase the presence of young women’s voices and perspectives in content traditionally provided by and found in adult-focused conventional news;

●  Increase teen girls’ access to education with mentoring and opportunities to amplify their work and writing with international, content-producing partnerships.

The Virtual Newsroom is a key component of this work. It will give teen girls a platform to reach and work with Women’s eNews and the Teen Voices at Women’s eNews staff. It will also provide teen girls access to an international publishing platform and the ability to shape media coverage of teen issues. It will increase work experience for teen girls who wish to pursue journalism or writing careers.

Your support today is the first step into making this impact a reality!

Women’s eNews, along with its sister site Arabic Women’s eNews, is an impact-driven nonprofit organization that creates social change by disseminating information and focusing attention on the rights of women and girls around the world through investigative reporting.

With more 800,000 unique readers last year alone, including activists, educators, policy makers and world leaders, the site helps sets the news agenda for conventional media. Along with their peers, teen girls in the Virtual Newsroom initiative will be able to tap and influence a powerful audience.

If we don’t reach our goal to fulfil a year’s worth of programming for the Virtual Newsroom all funds raised will go toward moving this program forward. Your gift will help us show future supporters how successful this model of working with teen girls is, and the benefits and importance of teaching girls social justice journalism in today’s world.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can’t donate today? Don’t worry - there are more ways that you can help us make the Teen Voices Virtual Newsroom a success!

  • Make some noise! Share this page: tell your friends - tell the world - to join in and support our cause.

  • Make some connections! If you’re a teen girl or you work with a teen girl program and want to partner on this initiative, let us know. We’d love to work with you through the Virtual Newsroom! Email teenvoices@womensenews.org today.

Are you ready? We are. So let's go!

EXPERTS SAY THIS CAMPAIGN WILL FAIL BECAUSE IT DIDN'T BEGIN PARTIALLY FUNDED - I FEEL I MUST EXPLAIN THAT ...




She'll Awaken - A Memoir of Love and Loss

James can't forget about the war - he carries every vision like a wound that won't heal.  Kathe cannot understand his devotion to it. She is committed come what may. A chronicle of love, honor, and anguish.

My Story:

I am not a prolific story teller, but I have a very interesting story to tell.  I began writing my book six months ago and have done a fair amount of research in self-publishing.  I don’t care to become rich or famous by writing this book or any book thereafter.  My purpose is to get a message out through the story I tell.  This is the true value of memoir.

I WANT to tell this story.

I am finally READY to tell this story.

But …

I also NEED to be published.  This is why I am seeking your help.

My family and I have a cause that we need to raise money for, and this book is our last resort.  I speak more about this in the video. YOU ARE BUYING A BOOK  in advance of publishing (expected completion is December 2014), and YOU MAKE IT POSSIBLE FOR US TO RANSOM AN INNOCENT MAN who has been illegally detained for over 15 months.  What we can tell you is that his name is Mike and that over the past 15 months we have tried everything and sacrificed everything we had to raise the money being demanded for his release - $150,000.

ALL CONTRIBUTORS WILL GET AN E-BOOK

THE KEY IS ... WE NEED TO FUND 40,000 OF THEM TO FREE MIKE

What We Need & What You Get

The most important thing is DISCRETION. 

Many we approached for help did little more than try to discredit us and, in the process, endanger Mike. We have endured all forms of ridicule, and have been asked every question – some we can answer and others we won’t because Mike’s safety supersedes all other considerations.

While we believe in the kindness of the worldwide community, we cannot expect our cause to be yours.  So all we ask is that you buy your advanced copy of

She’ll Awaken – A Memoir of Love and Loss , which is about 30% complete.  I must do this story justice and give it the best chance it can get through self-publishing.  I can’t compromise its quality and my integrity by rushing to get it done or skimping on editing and publishing necessities. However, the time still needed to accomplish all that is months.  We can't leave Mike in captivity for much longer as his physical and mental state are worsening.  It would be a dream to have him home for Christmas if not sooner. 

It takes a lot of blood, sweat and tears to get a book written under the BEST of circumstances … but MY circumstances I would not wish on anyone, never mind trying to write under them.

What’s in this for you?

  • You are buying a book in advance of its completion, plain and simple! 

  • My gratitude because you support me and encourage me as I keep writing

  • Your name is added to a dedication or acknowledgements page in the book if you choose

  • You help accomplish something amazing by joining a community of backers


    The Impact

    Without a doubt, crowd funding is a social strategy and I need every backer who believes in me to spread the word.  If you can afford $1 and you tell three friends, your effort is at least quadrupled. My family and I couldn’t be more grateful for your help in our ambitious goal and we want to feature your efforts in helping us free Mike.  Regular ‘community’ emails will share the efforts within the “Free Mike” community as well as my progress in writing the book.

    Please follow me on Twitter - @NidaPeabadly

    Future Hype and Perks:

    Future collaborative projects are an option for generous backers.  When Mike is freed, he returns with documentation that is the backdrop leading up to his capture.  He is the voice of the other half of his and my story through this ordeal.  We will be able to expose all those who turned their backs and wouldn’t help.  That will make an extremely compelling second book in which we reveal exactly what happened to him and the corruption behind it, contemporary to what was happening here among those of us living without him on the other side of the world.  That is a book I can’t wait to write!!

story:
WHY CAMPAIGN:

Self-publishing is no joke. I’ve already spent nearly three grand out-of-pocket on artwork and editorial work for this book thus far. The truth is that I simply cannot afford this entire process on my own. So here I am, I’m coming to you for the little extra push that I need to make my dream a reality!


ABOUT THE BOOK:

I began writing Throne of Lies in 2007. Back then I wasn’t sure what was to come of the story—it started off small, just simple ideas, and a desire to write. Over the years those miniature ideas began to morph into a colossal world of its own. One filled with vivid, lovable characters, and a story waiting to be told.

Throne of Lies is a fictional fantasy novel. I chose to write this genre because that is where my passion lies. As a hardcore fan of all things fantasy and nerd culture, I wanted to write something that I would enjoy reading. Throne of Lies, is the first installment of the Amethysta trilogy series, and is meant to introduce the characters, the world, and the situation at hand.

I believe Throne of Lies will be suitable for a broad audience. It's designed to be enjoyed by young adults as well as adults, and both men and women. I’ve written it in modern English so that is will be easier to read, while still holding the focus on a fictional version of the medieval times. Early on I made the creative decision to set the book into a first-person perspective. The reason for this is because that is how I’ve always envision this story being told. You being in the shoes of the main character, Amethysta. While first-person does limit me in some ways, I find the personal journey to be worth much more.

As of now there is not a set release date, but I estimate that the book will be ready for print in 3-6 months from now. The editorial process alone can take up to a month, and another for layout design. I'm in the process of my final round of editing on my end, then once this is funded (I hope) I can send it off to the company for a line/copy edit. I am hoping this process goes smoothly and quickly, but when it comes to matters such as this, you have to be willing to take things as they come. I will keep everyone updated as things progress.


Featured on the back of the book:

Amethysta, the princess of the human faction, the only heir to Northwind's throne, finds herself forever torn between duty and desire—desperately craving freedom and a life where she can choose for herself, yet bound by the chains of her bloodline. Unbeknownst to the world, she holds a dark secret. Her search for the truth will lead to tears and bloodshed. With each unexpected turn, she encounters devastating losses, uncovers terrifying secrets, and comes face-to-face with the heartache that awaits her. A mysterious blue glow that could change everything, ready to unfold a world of chaos.


MEET THE AUTHOR:

Hello, my name is Sara Secora. I am a first-time author from Detroit, Michigan. Some of you may be familiar with my YouTube channel AviGaming or perhaps some of my voice over work in various things! I am a wearer of many hats.

Learn more about me at: www.SaraSecora.com


THE GOAL:

To be able to afford the final steps required so that my book can be created in both physical and eBook formats! Even if the goal is not completely met, I will pay out-of-pocket again to make up the difference. Any help is greatly appreciated!


FINAL THOUGHTS:

To those of you who’ve been supporting me either since the beginning or are newly joining the ranks, I wholeheartedly thank you. This book means everything to me, I’ve poured my heart out onto these pages, and I’ve done it all just so that maybe one day these words could be enjoyed by others.


WHAT THE MONEY WILL BE SPENT ON:

  • Final Round of Editing
  • Interior Design for Book Layout
  • Kindle Conversion
  • Marketing
  • Paperback Prints for Signed Copies
  • eBook copies 
  • Shipping costs
  • and more.

story:
IN  PRAISE  of  MEN
A By-Women-for-Men Book  
by  Brooke R. Calder

Overview
This book is a short-but-sweet (nine action-packed chapters, under 100 pages!) love note to all of the decent, hard working men of the world who have rolled with our punches over the past hundred years.  It is also a tour-de-force trip through the 20th - 21st Century events that have shaped our gender politics; an unapologetic study of popular culture's type-casting of men; a frank discussion about #metoo, and of lost values we may want to consider re-imagining.  Finally, it's a meditation on moving forward into a more equal future!


Disclaimer: IPoM is peppered with personal anecdotes and lots of good-old-fashioned quill pen fencing.   ;-)
 

_______________

 

It's Just A Book! Why IndieGoGo?

Hello,  
Thanks for reading this section!  

I've spent over a decade researching as well as writing this book and have been able to cover most costs (logo, site, site design, copyright and ISBN fees), but need help with the following:


1. The cost of creating cover art, layout and design.  We have an amazing concept dreamed up by one of the best in the biz and the right graphic artist to execute his vision, but need additional funding to make it happen.  More detailed info lives here: inpraiseofmendotcom.wordpress.com/2016/07/29/the-results-are-in-more


2. Paying the organizations that compiled and created the graphs/infographics featured In Praise of Men.  For more about what sort of data these graph(ic)s deliver, please peek at the $150 Sponsor-A-Graph(ic) Perk. 


3. We've created a series of t-shirts to return the faces of some of the most impactful men in history to the streets!  While working with public domain images where we can, some gents (like Mr. Rogers and Nelson Mandela) have legacy estates, so we need to clear/cover additional licensing.  We'll also need to pay for printing, but we'll use TFP Design to give back to our community here in Minneapolis! 
 

4. By helping to publish this book, you're not only spreading a male-positive message but enabling future funding for men's programs!

-Upon release, $1 from every eCopy sold will go to funding scholarships for Mankind Project retreats, Big Brothers Big Sisters and similar programs for men TBA (we'll rotate causes each year).  

-Anyone who donates $50 or more also gets a vote on what our first 'Give Back' will be! 

-If we surpass our crowdfunding goal, additional proceeds will go towards printing a short run (500 copies) in paperback; 10% of the copies printed will be donated to local men's shelters.  
 

Finally, everyone who donates (whether $1 or $1,000!) gets a big THANK YOU in the ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS section!

With Gratitude,
Brooke

 

PS: Here's two other crowdfunding projects I successfully delivered on:

glean: www.indiegogo.com/projects/glean-ep-2-shadows-sand/x/144809#/
POP INC: www.kickstarter.com/projects/popinc/pop-inc-boulevard-of-broken-dreams-hollywood-proje

story:
Theo and the Six Seals Series


I love reading.

I think that a book can travel you more effectively that any travel agency.

A book has the power to take you to other world and dimensions. Can give you a taste of the future or help you experience events that took place hundreds, even thousands of years ago.

A book can be a source of knowledge and the most intimate of friends. It's not hard to believe it; just think how many times you smiled or cried reading a book.

Sometimes the story is so powerful that it draws you in, and you live the adventures of the character, or feel their pain and joy.

This is why I love to write. I want to make stories that as a reader I would love to read. And I want to share these stories with you, and with the rest of the world.

Theo and the Six Seals is a book series for teens and young adults. It's a story about bravery, friendship and sacrifice. It stresses the importance of team work in a fun and adventurous way. The reader will also find a beautifully built world, influenced by ancient Greek mythology, magical creatures, gods and goddesses.

I have self-published some books - which received good reviews.

Unfortunately I was not able to to promote them at all, because promoting is very costly and I did not have the proper budget. So without the required exposure readers are hesitant to buy a self-published book.


In order to self-publish my manuscripts, I put in hours and hours of work; from creating and designing the cover art work to reading and re-reading the manuscripts over and over in order to proof them, changing grammatical mistakes and typographical errors and editing the text format to the best of my abilities.

The cover art is not exactly what one would call professional, I did put all my love and taste to make them look great with a minimum budget.

However this was not enough, because all the hours of work were not enough to promote my work and make it known to the world.


My dream is to make Theo and the Six Seals series my first Professionally published book series.

Starting with book #1 "Theo and Morpheus' Medallion"

That means 1) top professional editing, 2) careful formatting for the physical edition and special formatting for the digital editions (like PDF, epub, mobi etc), for every kind of devices such as PC's, tablets, phones and e-book readers. 3) Professional cover design, and if the goals exceed expectations book illustrations to make the book more appealing. 4) Promotion. A professionally made book, no matter how much work and love has been put into it, needs the right promotion in order to be known, purchased and reviewed by the readers. The more the readers know, read and review the book the higher the chances for a successful publication.

Unfortunately a professionally published book is costly.

And this is why I need your help.

Every one of you, from the smallest contributor to the highest sponsor, can make a difference.

With your precious and much appreciated contributions we can make this project come to life.

Thank you so much for being a part of the dream.



Risks and Difficulties

Theo and Morpheus' Medallion is ready and the only thing missing to be sent for it's professional editing is the funding.

Book #2, "Theo and The Thread of Fates" will be the next book to be written. So far I have gone through the main plot of the second book, pointing out the elements I want to stress as vital for the plot of the six book series. In the second book I would like to give more information about the seven main characters and their journey.


There is no particular problem that should delay the project in any way. The budget for the first book has been calculated carefully so the manuscript will be sent to the editor as soon as the campaign is successful. I will posting updates at all times.

The moment the first editing is done I will contact a Layout and Design professional to format the interior before sending the file to be printed. Also, at the same time I will send the edited file to an e-book converter professional. Estimation of the whole process: 3 to 8 weeks. Once more I will be posting updates regularly, I want everyone of you to be part of this project.

If we manage to exceed the needed budget, I would like to make the book more appealing by adding 5-10 illustrations (depending on the extra amount collected), of the characters and of the fascinating places they visit during their journey.

In August 2016, I would like to start a good marketing campaign, making the book as knows as possible. The book will be professionally published in November with all the improvement you made happen, being an excellent gifting choice for teens and young adults during the Christmas season.


We need to collect at least 18% ($500)of the funding, in order to edit and proof-read the interior of the book. If we don't reach that first goal, the book copy of "Theo and Morpheus' Medallion" you'll be receiving, is going to be the basic self-edited version of the manuscript.



Other Ways You Can Help

For those of you who can't help funding the project, there are other ways to be part of the team.

The most important thing you can do is share this campaign and make as much noise as possible. The more people get to see this project the more likely they are to chip in and make this campaign a success.

Another extremely important thing you can do once the project is successful, is to share the book links that I will be posting in the updates and the book art, in your social media accounts. That can actually make a huge difference and help tremendously the promotion of the book.

Once more I would like to thank everyone for being part of this amazing team.

There is no particular problem that should delay the project in any way. The budget for the first book has been calculated carefully so the manuscript will be sent to the editor as soon as the campaign is successful. I will posting updates at all times.
The moment the first editing is done I will contact a Layout and Design professional to format the interior before sending the file to be printed. Also, at the same time I will send the edited file to an e-book converter professional. Estimation of the whole process: 3 to 8 weeks. Once more I will be posting updates regularly, I want everyone of you to be part of this project.
If we manage to exceed the needed budget, I would like to make the book more appealing by adding 5-10 illustrations (depending on the extra amount collected), of the characters and of the fascinating places they visit during their journey.
In August 2016, I would like to start a good marketing campaign, making the book as knows as possible. The book will be professionally published in November with all the improvement you made happen, being an excellent gifting choice for teens and young adults during the Christmas season.

We need to collect at least 18% ($500)of the funding, in order to edit and proof-read the interior of the book. If we don't reach that first goal, the book copy of "Theo and Morpheus' Medallion" you'll be receiving, is going to be the basic self-edited version of the manuscript.


    
Other Ways You Can Help For those of you who can't help funding the project, there are other ways to be part of the team.
The most important thing you can do is share this campaign and make as much noise as possible. The more people get to see this project the more likely they are to chip in and make this campaign a success.
Another extremely important thing you can do once the project is successful, is to share the book links that I will be posting in the updates and the book art, in your social media accounts. That can actually make a huge difference and help tremendously the promotion of the book.
Once more I would like to thank everyone for being part of this amazing team.

story:
Short Summary

I am seeking funding to conduct research for a second book. My first book, Aberration In The Heartland Of The Real: The Secret Lives of Timothy McVeigh will appear from TrineDay in the Spring of 2015. My second book, scheduled for TrineDay’s Fall 2015 catalog, is tentatively titled, Coup: The 1995 Oklahoma City Bombing Plot. Coup draws from my previous and ongoing research as well as seminal research conducted by investigative journalist Cheri Seymour, author of Committee Of The States: Inside The Radical Right (Camden Place Communications Inc., 1991) and The Last Circle: Danny Casolaro’s Investigation into the Octopus and the Promis Software Scandal (TrineDay, 2010).


Even a contribution of $10 will go along way. Your contribution will facilitate critical research and the writing of my second book  (see information about both books below). Contribute directly  or help by sharing the link to this campaign.


About The Book Projects

In Spring 2015, TrineDay will release my first book Aberration In The Heartland Of The Real: The Secret Lives of Timothy McVeigh. Aberration draws from a wealth of never-before-seen archives and new material from human sources, and offers a unique reexamination of convicted bomber Timothy McVeigh, executed in 2001.

Forget everything you thought you knew about America’s “Face of Domestic Terrorism.” The book asks: Who Was Timothy McVeigh, Really? I offer startling new biographical details about McVeigh and exposes stark contradictions and errors contained in previous depictions of the All-American Terrorist. Aberration traces McVeigh’s life from childhood to the Army, throughout the plot to bomb the Alfred P. Murrah Federal Building and the period after his 1995 arrest until his 2001 execution. The archival  and oral sources introduced in my books will contribute a wealth of contextual detail and new information relevant to several sociocultural and political arenas and will aggressively intercede in debates about the factual details of McVeigh’s life and the bombing.

McVeigh’s life, as I describe it, offers a backdrop for her discussion of not only several intimate and previously unknown details about him, but a number of episodes and circumstances in American History as well, including: Cold War popular culture, all-American apocalyptic fervor, organized racism, contentious politics, militarism, warfare, conspiracy theories and cultures of conspiracy theorists, bioethical controversies, mind control, the media’s construction of villains and demons and institutional secrecy and cover-ups. 

Painting’s next book, tentatively titled, Coup: The 1995 Oklahoma City Bombing Plot  draws from her previous and ongoing research as well as significant archival material generously donated by investigative journalist, Cheri Seymour.(For more on Seymour’s archives, see her bio below.)

While Aberration focuses on Timothy McVeigh specifically, Coup will bring to light critical but never-before-exposed information about the 1995 Oklahoma City bombing plot, trace the labyrinthine forces at work around it, and detail the lives of several characters embedded (through choice or fate) within it, telling the story of the brave efforts of private citizens and journalists who attempted to investigate and expose critical details of the plot.

With your help, I will significantly expand upon these and other aspects of the bombing plot, expose to the public some of her most explosive findings to date, and flesh out an in-depth account of the conspiracy to bomb the Alfred P. Murrah Federal Building. Coup asks the question: Exactly who fooled whom when the Ryder truck exploded outside of the federal building in Oklahoma City?

Use of Funds Generated & Project Timeline 

Even a contribution of $10 will go along way. Your contribution will facilitate critical research and the writing of my  second book, 'Coup'. Contribute directly  or help me find support by sharing the link to this campaign.

In early September 2014, I will travel to California to meet with Cheri Seymour in California to pick up and review her archival research material. At this time I will begin locating and interviewing long silent individuals, and will continue to do so throughout June 2015. This will require travel funds to speak with people in Utah, California, Arizona, Nevada and other locations.

Aberration In The Heartland Of The Real: The Secret Lives of Timothy McVeigh is complete and the manuscript is currently in the editing process. Minor changes may be required to the manuscript based upon Cheri Seymour’s archives and investigative material. Research and writing for Coup: The 1995 Oklahoma City Bombing Plot will occur from August 2014 to August 2015, but requires initial and follow-up research, the ability to take time off of work to do the research and writing and editorial assistance.

I will maintain a publicly accessible blog throughout the research and writing process so that contributors and interested parties can keep track of my  progress.

About Wendy S. Painting, PhD

Wendy Painting holds a PhD in American Studies from the University of Buffalo. Painting's extensive and seminal investigatory research into the 1995 Oklahoma City bombing and Timothy McVeigh distinguishes her as a leading national expert on both subjects. Her research has been credited in other books including Roger Charles’ 2012 publication Oklahoma City: What The Investigation Missed and Why It Matters. Dr. Painting co-authored and co-produced the 2011 documentary film, A Noble Lie: Oklahoma City 1995.

Her research has  included unparalleled access to publicly and privately held archives as well as countless interviews and correspondence with individuals throughout the United States, including bombing victims’ family members, survivors, witnesses, attorneys, private investigators, journalists, McVeigh’s coworkers, friends, neighbors and underworld associates: bank robbers, neo-Nazis, militia leaders and many others.

Painting has presented her analysis about McVeigh and the bombing throughout the country at a number of academic conferences, including annual meetings of the Oral History Association, Popular Culture / American Culture Association and the American Folklore Society, as well as at popular venues such as Brave New Books in Austin, Texas. Dr. Painting has designed and taught a variety of English, History and American Studies courses in the Rochester area. Courses taught include (but are not limited to): Surveillance in Society, Introduction to U.S. History, The Cold War, Crime and Criminals in History, Folklore and Legend, U.S. Prison Systems, Cultural History, Ethnographies and Oral Histories in World Civilizations and College Composition. She has also lectured at other area colleges on McVeigh and other topics, including "The Institutional Repression of AIM: The American Indian Movement."

Painting currently works as an investigative researcher in Western Upstate New York.

About Cheri Seymour

Cheri Seymour has worked as an investigative reporter, newspaper editor, and private detective for two decades while pursuing a career as a non-fiction writer. Her real-life exploration through the criminal labyrinth of the “Octopus,” the endemic corruption in our government and society, and the theft of the PROMIS software is reflected in various writings for newspapers and magazines. Beyond her book on the subject, these include “The Ghost of Danny Casolaro” in High Times magazine in August 2001. Most of these writings expose organized criminal elements and their symbiotic relationship with members of the U.S. government.

A native Californian born in Los Angeles, Seymour was introduced to writing by her father, Professor Raynolds Johnson, B.A., Los Angeles State University; M.A. in English Literature at Stanford University, member of the Greater Los Angeles Press Club, Sigma Delta Chi, Phi Delta Kappa.

Immediately after the 1995 bombing in Oklahoma City, Seymour was hired as a private investigator to conduct her own investigation of the bombing. The scope of her investigation was wide and, during it, Seymour came into contact with and interviewed some of the most notorious actors among the right wing at that time, including many who would later become implicated in the bombing plot.In the course of her fearless investigation, Seymour generated a wealth of explosive and never-before-published materials, which she has donated to Painting for the purposes of writing Coup: The 1995 Oklahoma City Bombing Plot.

Seymour’s investigative archives total approximately 10 boxes of materials consisting of (but not limited to): internal correspondence with and between nationally known investigative journalists concerning their early investigations into the bombing plot and their attendance at McVeigh’s 1998 trial; correspondence with investigators from McVeigh’s legal team; correspondence with other private investigators working on the case; correspondence with federal agents who investigated the bombing; internal paperwork originating from various well known militia groups and white supremacist organizations; and audio and video interviews with key characters connected to (and some implicated in) the plot; and never-before-published photographs of the aforementioned characters.

About TrineDay Publishing 

TrineDay was formed in 2002, when Kris Millegan’s friend Antony Sutton informed Kris that his book, America’s Secret Establishment was going out of print. Kris then borrowed $5,000 and founded TrineDay. Antony was very excited about the new book, and was scheduling interviews for the book’s release in two months, when he suddenly died at home, collapsed in his kitchen. TrineDay was left with a book, and no author to promote it. TrineDay then submitted the book in a cover design contest and won a national distribution contract with the Independent Publishing Group in Chicago.

  TrineDay’s second book Expendable Elite by retired Lt. Col. Dan Marvin was targeted by the Special Forces Association. Kris was told directly that Americans were not supposed to know how their wars were fought, and that Special Forces personnel were not supposed to talk about their experiences. A lawsuit for libel was brought against Lt. Col. Marvin and TrineDay. They were offered a settlement requiring that TrineDay and Marvin declare the book fiction. They then defended themselves in Federal District Court in Charleston, SC, and won a unanimous verdict from the jury.

  Authors soon began sending very well-researched and well-written manuscripts that were being actively suppressed. Nobody was publishing these works. TrineDay has made a mission of bringing these important books to the reading public.

  Kris Millegan’s own research began after his father, a repentant former CIA/OSS officer, had told Kris, in 1969, of his almost twenty-year intelligence career and about clandestine government-sponsored narcotics trafficking, and also psychological warfare against our body politic. Kris didn’t understand, but it started him following the spoor of secrets, trying to comprehend how the world actually works.

  One day in the early ’70s, Kris told some friends some of the things his Dad had told him, and one of them looked at him and told him that he was a “conspiracy theorist.” Kris scratched his head, and said, “What’s that?” And he soon took on conspiracy theory as an intellectual discipline, beginning a journey, the journey that begins once you have been confronted with a different but plausible “world-view.” A person can simply dismiss it all as the ravings of lunatics and mentally-challenged individuals, or you can look at the body of works and make up your own mind.

  Kris, a voracious reader, began visiting every bookstore he could find, and asked to see their “conspiracy section.” All of them had at least one book. He soon discovered that some of these appeared to be formula books. Books designed to get folks to hate each other, and to blame particular groups for everything. There are books that blame it all on the Mormons, the Jesuits, the Jews, the Catholics, the hippies, the secular humanists, the homosexuals, secret societies, aliens, etc. Most of these books are mis/disinformation, but if you look at them, check their bibliographies, get those books and follow their bibliographies, you soon find yourself reading dusty volumes on banking, the drug trade, intelligence matters, history, etc.

  Kris soon discovered that “conspiracy theory” is used by many different groups in varying ways, basically as psychological warfare, which is better described by the German term Weltanschauungskrieg, meaning “world-view warfare.” But most important was that he did find verification of what his father had spoken to him about. The implications of that made him realize that the state of our Republic was dire, and that action needed to be taken for our children’s futures.

  There is a reason that dictators and repressive governments burn books. Books are acts of creation. A good and relevant book takes on a life of its own. We need to educate and inform ourselves of our situation, because only then can we extricate ourselves and revive our Republic.

  TrineDay wishes it could finance all of Dr. Painting’s research but they can’t. They have tried getting loans from banks. Banks have said no, they will not loan money for book projects, especially on controversial subjects. Selling suppressed works is a long hard slog, and it simply doesn’t generate enough income. TrineDay’s books, and their author’s research and findings get ignored by the mainstream media, no matter the discussion. Dr. Paintings and Cheri Seymour’s work deserve a wider audience and discussion, this can happen with your help.

Kris gets calls all the time from people wanting to know what they can do. Here is something. Please help with this important project. These two books will immensely broaden our understanding of what really happened in Oklahoma, its very deep roots and implications. They will give us a deeper understanding, so that we may take educated action towards a beneficial solution for the dysfunctional systemic corruption that so troubles our world. The money raised goes directly to Dr. Painting for her research.

story:
So, since my book is in print, and kindle, the next logical step would be to make an audio book! 

As you can see, in order to make an audio book, I am in need of some funding. I'm not seeking that much, only enough to cover expenses. About 80% will go to pay the audio engineer, and 20% will go toward equipment. 

Getting a professional audio engineer is very important, as the quality control standards for audio books are very strict, and without recording and producing in the proper format, your audio book goes nowhere. 

Over the years I've had a few requests from fans to make this into an audio book. Unfortunately, I've either not had the time or the resources. I thought making an audio book would require skills and equipment I did not have or would not be able to get. After some research though, I was able to finally put the pieces together and with your help, I can make this project happen. 

Right now, about 40% of the book has been recorded (by yours truly). ACX, the company that distributes audio books to the likes of Audible and iBooks has given our project the green light. In other words, the audio we (my sound engineer and I) fit their quality control parameters, and we are well on our way to finishing the book. Mid-June is the goal for completion.

Please share this with other WNBA fans & thanks for all your support.
