story:
Salut à toi qui me lit!

Je suis un motard.

Oui, mais un motard sourd, équipé de vraies oreilles bioniques implantées dans mon crâne (http://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Implant_cochl%C3%A9aire), et ça c'est quand même la classe!

Retrouver l'audition m'a permis de retrouver ma vie, et c'est ça que je veux faire passer au sein des récits de mes aventures de motard bionique! Montrer que la surdité n'est plus une fatalité, et qu'être un cyborg auditif (r)ouvre les portes d'une vie normale...et bien plus encore! 

De mes premières expériences de voyages à moto, un Tour de France et un Tour des Alpes jusqu'en Autriche, j'ai donc tiré un blog plein de photos zolies, d'humour vaseux, d'autodérision mais aussi de quelques réflexions (je réfléchis rarement mais ça m'arrive...) sur le handicap et l'apprentissage de la vie par le voyage.

Et c'est là que toi qui me lit, tu voudras peut-être en savoir plus sur le "pourquoi"...oui, "pourquoi" ce projet participatif, ce  blog, ces voyages, et ça se lit là (attention faut sortir les mouchoirs et les violons!):

http://les-aventures-dun-motard-bionique.blogspot.fr/2015/03/mesdames-messieurs-un-peu-de-serieux.html

Tu es encore là cher(e) lecteur/trice? Alors tu seras peut-être intéressé(e) par la vidéo en photos qui bougent avec de la guimauve et du bruit dedans résumant mon parcours...celui d'un gars devenu sourd, qui est ensuite devenu un cyborg, pour ré-entendre et vivre ses rêves:

http://les-aventures-dun-motard-bionique.blogspot.fr/2014/12/le-resume-du-blog-en-images-qui-bougent.html

Et tu voudras même peut-être aller faire un tour sur  ma page Facebook pour voir les dernières versions de mes photos, et savoir comment je prépare ce Tour d'Islande:

https://www.facebook.com/MotardBionique.fr?ref=hl


C'est toute la petite communauté qui s'est formée autour de moi, grâce au succès de mon blog (40 000 pages vues en 1 an), ainsi que les membres du Journal des Motards (qui va bientôt publier un papier sur mes aventures),  qui me poussent aujourd'hui à présenter mon nouveau projet bionique ici-même...

Et ce projet, c'est le Tour de l'Islande en moto cet été! Un voyage de 10 000 km et de 30 jours environ sur les chemins de cette fabuleuse contrée! 

Cependant, il ne faut pas croire que cette petite communauté me pousse à faire ça par pur soutien désintéressé de ma personne...

En plus du fait que ces gens sont sensibles à ma démarche de montrer qu'il est possible de surmonter le handicap auditif, ils veulent voir encore plus de belles photos bucoliques, lire d'autres aventures rocambolesques, rire gras quand je balance des blagues que la bienséance m'empêche de faire ici, se foutre de nouveau de ma gueule quand je ferai le récit de mes lamentables chutes dans des flaques de boue au fin fond de chemins improbables et se marrer sadiquement quand je serai empêtré dans des situations plus absurdes les unes que les autres! 

Si, toi qui me lit, ce programme te plait, alors voilà le plan:

Pour partir sereinement, en sécurité, avec de quoi ne pas mourir de froid ni de faim, ainsi que tout le nécessaire pour ne pas finir dévoré par un clan de pingouins belliqueux ou un ours polaire, le budget global s'établit autour de 5500 à 6000 euros...et oui...tout de même.

Là-dedans on comptera notamment le ferry à 900 euros (parce que la traversée à la nage, ça risque d’être un peu tendu), les 1 ou 2 trains de pneus (300 à 600 euros), le matos de camping pouvant résister au conditions climatiques de l’Islande (500 euros), la révision de la moto (200 euros) et son équipement pour affronter le hors-piste (300 euros facile)…et puis toutes les « petites » choses comme l’essence (1000 euros), la bouffe (4 à 500 euros), les hébergements en camping et parfois hôtel/auberges (600 euros mini), les éventuelles caméras, tout le petit matériel mécanique (lampes, bougies, kits mèches, pièces de rechanges, outils…), les fringues adéquates, le budget d’entretien de la moto sur place, et j’en passe.

Ça fait mal.

Me concernant, ne mangeant que des pâtes, des pois chiche en boite ainsi que des œufs bourrés d'hormones et de pesticides depuis plusieurs mois, et n'ayant pas foutu les pieds dans un magasin de fringues depuis 1500 ans,  je pense pouvoir mettre de côté 3500 euros. Bon ok, pour ça, il faudra que la pourriture capitaliste qui me sert de banquier soit sympa, mais c'est faisable…

D'un autre côté, j'ai commencé à trouver des partenaires qui à l'heure où j'écris ces lignes se sont engagés à me fournir un ensemble veste/pantalon qui me fera économiser 500 euros. Et un autre partenaire m'a fourni une somme permettant de changer mon kit chaîne...C'est pas la fête ça?!

J'ai de plus encore quelques contacts qui pourraient m'aider à équiper la moto, et à partir avec une ou deux caméras, le tout pour un tarif sympa...

Bref...Si ces potentiels partenariats ne se concrétisent pas, la somme cible de 1300 euros me permettra de partir, mais à l'arrache, avec une marge de manœuvre quasi-inexistante. Ça se tente, mais ce n'est pas forcément rassurant. Ceci dit, je peux toujours piquer un ou deux sacs à des petites vieilles, et kidnapper un ou deux bébés mignons pour compléter le budget. 

Si ces potentiels partenariats se concrétisent, alors là, la somme cible de 1300 euros me permettra de partir plus sereinement.  Cela me permettra d’être moins stressé par une casse mécanique, et d’être peut-être mieux équipé au niveau du matériel pour sécuriser la moto et son pilote...

Et si votre générosité est encore plus grande, alors les conditions seront optimales et cela m'évitera peut-être de me traîner un découvert complètement déraisonnable pendant 6 mois! Mais bon...ça...c'est pas vraiment votre problème!

Bien sûr, pour les contributeurs les plus généreux, je ferais en sorte d'envoyer de beaux tirages de photos de leur choix (et ayant fait beaucoup de progrès en photo, celles-ci risquent de bien claquer!). Et pour les plus fous...non seulement il y aura des tirages photos mais aussi peut-être une ou deux caméras sport de type Go-Pro!

Mais tout ceci te permettra aussi, à toi lecteur, qui doit être sacrément intéressé puisque tu me lis toujours, de combler tes petits moments d’ennuis avec un feuilleton digne des Feux de l’Amour, l’amour en moins, la moto, les paysages et les blagues à base de coup de pelles et d'autres trucs de mauvais goût en plus !

Et puis surtout, diffuser mes aventures permet déjà, et je l’espère, continuera à permettre de faire connaitre les implants cochléaires, et à montrer que la surdité n'est plus une fatalité! 

Adrian, le motard bionique

Note:

Si tu as une société, une page facebook, un site internet, ou autre...je te ferai avec plaisir de la publicité sur mon blog et ma page FB! (voir les Contreparties)

Tu ne peux pas contribuer financièrement, mais tu penses pouvoir m'aider d'une autre manière? Tu as des conseils sur l'Islande, du matos moto, photo ou vidéo...tu veux juste discuter un peu ou je ne sais quoi encore? N'hésites pas à me contacter via le blog ou mon facebook!

story:
Short Summary

Creative Children for Charity, or 3C, is a program for inspiring children and teens to volunteer their time and talent to raise money for social causes through art. 3C's mission is to inspire 1 million children and teens across the globe to volunteer their time and talent to help others through their art. Over 1000 kids have participated in 3C events and programs and raised over 10,000 dollars in the last 3 years.

3C's latest endeavor to inspire youth is 40 Story's! This project was inspired by The Search Institute, who architected 40 Development Assets of Leadership as building blocks of healthy development. Studies show that the average youth has no more than 20 leadership assets. 40 Story’s will enable our youth community to become aware of the leadership assets they need, and help them develop them in their lives.  

The 40 Story’s experience will culminate in a leadership book written by 60+ youth from their perspective, to help youth around the world explore their core leadership skills and strive to be healthy, caring, and responsible citizens.


This project will showcase forty assets of leadership created by the youth community. All forty assets will be displayed in multiple  locations throughout the year, followed by a mega event to acknowledge their contributions. There are 3 main goals that 3C wants to accomplish with this project:

    • Launch the 40 Story's Leadership Book written from their perspective, to help youth around the world explore their core leadership skills and strive to be healthy, caring, and responsible citizens.
    • Fundraise for Food Banks 
    • Host 40 Story's Mega Event - To showcase and recognize the talent of the youth community and how they are making a difference.

We believe that anyone who supports 3C and its mission will help the leaders of the future to develop their core leadership skills and strive to be healthy, caring, and responsible citizens.

How did the 40 Assets come to be?

The 40 Assets were founded in 1990 by the Search Institute, which released a framework that identified a set of skills, behaviors, and relationships that enable youths to develop into mature adults and leaders. Over the following two decades, the development assets helped kids through school programs and were widely utilized in the world. William Damon from Stanford University described these assets as a "sea of change" in adolescent development.


What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise 5K to achieve the following goals:
  • Launch 40 Story's Leadership Book
  • Host a Mega Event for 40 Story's to inspire the community and celebrate their contributions
  • Fundraise for Food Bank

Perks for the contributors Include:
  • Inclusion of your name in the 40 Story's Leadership Book 
  • 40 Story's Digital Poster - Limited Edition
  • Exclusive 40 Story's Leadership Book
  • Exclusive 40 Story's Greeting card set

The Impact

The impact of this project is tremendous. It will inspire and build confidence in youth to help change the world for the better:

  • Give youth the opportunity to become authors of the 40 Story's Leadership Book
  • Fundraise for food banks
  • Host the mega event to inspire the community and celebrate their contributions

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this project within your community via facebook, email, twitter and other communication channels
  • Pledge $25 towards this project to make the mission happen

We truly feel that this project and 40 Story's leadership book need a little push from the indiegogo community and from anyone who believes youth has the potential to make a difference. We need everyone's help to give us a chance to change the world!

story:
Basic Funding Goal of $1,750 REACHED!


NEW!  Stretch Goal #1

For an additional $850, bringing our total raise to $2,600, we will add approximately 18 to 24 additional photographs to the book.  After her accident, black and white photography and darkroom work helped Sarah regain some emotional balance.   The photographs, many of which are of street people in San Francisco, will be included in all versions of the book, but we will also offer a special high-quality edition done on the Hewlett Packard Indigo Press, the press of choice for fine art books.  This will significantly enhance the enjoyment of the photographs.
We will offer the special edition as an additional reward.

Stretch Goal #2

For an additional $1,250, bringing our total raise to $3,850, we will add a children's book on understanding the lives of people in chairs.  Sarah has some great stories about spontaneous and extremely frank questions she has gotten from children.  $1,250 will cover the cost of a book for kids of all ages, with a limited number of graphics.  It will be offered as an additional reward at the point we reach Stretch Goal #1.

Sarah's Story

My name is Sarah.  After an accident put me in a wheelchair at 16, and after a near-death experience from a hospital infection, I had a spiritual breakthrough that enabled me to see possibilities, not barriers.  I married and had two children.  My little one is 4 months old.  I am starting  my second year of medical school at the Southwest College of Naturopathic Medicine.  

I have been peer mentoring other paraplegics through organizations like Paralyzed Veterans of America.  My book will allow me to reach far more people than I can with one-on-one mentoring. 

My writing partner is my friend Betsy, who will be working from interviews with me.  She is a professional writer, editor, and book designer.

We have a good start on the book, but we need funds to finish and promote it.  By contributing, you can me help empower thousands of others to surmount limitations, whether physical or spiritual.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $1,750 to finish the book.  The money will be used to cover the writing, editing, proofreading, adjustment of images for printing, layout and design, purchase of the ISBN numbers, uploading to the printing company, the initial printing cost, and the promotion of the book so that the intended audience will be able to find it. The money will also be used to cover mileage expenses within Arizona, so that Betsy can interview others who are part of my story.

If we don't reach our stated goal, the book will still be produced.  It just won't have as many images or in-depth interviews with other family and friends.

Depending on your level of contribution, you will receive one of the first copies of the paperback, a signed copy, a gift pack of two books, or a signed hardcover copy.  If we reach our stretch goals, other perks will be added, including a book for children that helps them understand life in a chair.

The Impact

Books change lives.  A good book can inspire, comfort and empower and show the way to open doors.  A book can increase understanding of people different from ourselves.  Your contribution to my project has the potential of helping thousands of people who have experienced major setbacks in life.

I have a track record of successfully tackling a job. Before going back to school for my degree in microbiology, I had my own film company.  Betsy has a track record of writing and producing films and books for clients like Goebel Porcelain, the creators of the famous Hummel figurines.

Risks & Challenges

There are always risks in life.  However, my experience and my writing partner's experience significantly reduce the risk.  We have added an extra month to our schedule in case there are unforeseen technical glitches, such as printing errors.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, you can still help me by spreading the word by email, by social media like Facebook and Twitter, and by word of mouth to your friends and neighbors.   

Indiegogo has some good share tools that will help you out.  They are located next to the video.  

We are now live we and accessible at: http://www.indiegogo.com/project/preview/945f1dba

story:
Life Force Marketing...

A book and a practice... WHY did I write this book?

Since my early 20's, which were spent largely in the San Francisco Bay Area, I've been fascinated with diverse approaches to personal and spiritual growth. Some of those influences:

  • Shambhala Buddhist and Native American meditations
  • Profoundly transformative immersion experiences such as the "est Training," Sunray's Peacekeeper Trainings, Quantum Life Changes retreats, the 4-year Feldenkrais Training, the Bones for Life Training, and Mary Morrissey's DreamBuilder live events
  • Studies with some of the most profound teachers in the world, too numerous to mention.

In this way I've slowly gathered an understanding of how people grow and change and how they suffer until they figure out a technology for developing new habits of thinking and behaving.  

I wanted to write a book where I could begin to share some of what I've learned, applying it to practical everyday life experiences. I chose to write THIS book, "Life Force Marketing," to apply the principles of personal transformation and combine them with solid marketing principles that holistic practitioners can use to build more sustainable businesses by reaching and helping more clients. 

Why? Because I'm on a mission... Don't we all want to change the world for the better? 

My way is to support the people who heal and inspire everyone else.  By focusing on the welfare of massage therapists, acupuncturists, coaches and therapists, art teachers, energy workers, holistic health advisors and their peers, I believe I can also indirectly benefit the hundreds of thousands of clients they serve every day.  If I can help them build stronger more sustainable businesses, they will be able to use their considerable talents and skills to do more good in the world.  People who read this book may be inspired to see their practices through fresh eyes, reclaim the power of what they offer the world. 

Writing and sharing this book as broadly as possible seems like a simple and smart way to spread the word about teachings our world desperately needs today, such as: How to Generate a Powerful Vision, How to Change the Stories You Tell Yourself About Yourself, How to Assess Personal Resources in a New Way that Elevates Self-Confidence, and How and Why You Should Celebrate Every Victory.

These "inner work" teachings constitute about half of my book (4 of the 10 steps in Life Force Marketing). The remainder of the book is an introduction to a client-centered holistic marketing approach that works especially well for people who provide services for others in one-person enterprises -- but don't like marketing or selling.

 

HOW I learned about Marketing

The vision-based holistic approach to marketing I’m suggesting in Life Force Marketing is a distillation of what I’ve learned from my own journey with myriad teachers (including university courses and coaching relationships with some of the best marketing experts in the world) and from thousands of life experiences in which I’ve practiced and applied what I’ve learned. This has included my participation in a leadership and marketing role in a number of enterprises, both for-profit and non-profit, over a 35+ year period:  26 years in private practice as a holistic practitioner, 18 years as a dance and movement educator and collaborating artist, 5 years as owner/operator of a women's adventure travel company and 2 years as founder/designer of a boutique greeting card company. EXCERPT #1,  from Step 1: 

ENVISION the Life You Would Love to Live

We start with a Vision because without it you’re a ship without a destination.

If your understanding of what you want to accomplish is vague, if for some reason you haven’t expended the time and energy needed to clearly define your Vision in living color, you’re operating at a grave disadvantage.

We begin, at Step One, with fleshing out your Vision for what you want to accomplish, the type of practice or business you want to have, the kinds of people you want to serve, what you want to offer them, the kinds of results you want to facilitate for them, the environment in which you will do this, and more. 

It’s a fairly well-kept secret that having a splendid, technicolor, ‘felt’ Vision for yourself that thrills you to the very marrow of your bones is what provides the Life Force required for building and growing any enterprise.

We refer back to your Vision many times throughout your process of choosing, planning and implementing your choices of marketing avenues. As will be made clear as you read along, your Vision for the Life you want to live and the larger mission you have for your work will inform every marketing decision you make. 

Moving forward without a vivid, heart-felt Vision is essentially a form of planning to fail. Without it, you lack the fuel needed to keep the warrior spirit alive as you craft your Life-altering business from the ethers.

And that’s why holistic marketing must begin with the development of a Vision that will guide and motivate you every step along the way to building your ideal practice or business. 

Let me tell you a story.

In my 20’s I encountered my first network marketing presentation. I had been invited to a friend’s house to learn about a new business idea. I was, even then, sprouting entrepreneurial wings (although I didn’t know it yet). By far the most memorable moment of that evening was when someone flipped to a piece of the large white paper he had suspended on an easel and asked a very provocative question, “If money was no object, what would you do, where would you go, and what would you have?” 

This was an Earth-shaking event for me at the time for the simple reason that no-one had ever suggested that I think so freely, imagine so boundlessly. Undoubtedly that’s why I remember it so clearly.

I’ve since heard many variations on this kind of question, each designed to stimulate thinking beyond our current personal paradigm. 

One of my favorites is the oft-quoted, “What would you do if you knew you couldn’t fail?”  This question stirs me deeply; I use it often to talk to myself if I notice that I’m dragging my feet or getting lost in uncertainty about what to do next.  This brilliant question goes to the core of what stops many of us from reaching toward the stars — our fear that we will fail.

More recently I’ve learned a paradigm-busting question that I consider fool-proof in stimulating a grand Life Vision. From the creator of Dreambuilder Coaching, Mary Morrissey, this stellar query is, “What is the Life you would love to live?”  I suggest you begin there.

Why is Envisioning Something We Postpone Doing?

In the past 10 years I’ve attended dozens of online courses, seminars, live events and symposia on topics related to growing a small business or private practice. In almost every one of those events there’s been some mention of Envisioning. Predictably, most people in the field of business coaching and mentoring agree that having a Vision is important.

Despite this almost universal agreement, I have noticed something ironic. Although each of these very fine teachers, leaders and speakers has a highly developed, well thought out, methodical and detailed curriculum -- only a few give any serious attention to the Envisioning segments of their programs!  It’s almost as if there’s an assumption at work, something like, “This Vision-Building stuff is something anyone can do, so let’s just get it over with and get to the hard stuff!”

This is an erroneous assumption because, sadly, for many people, Envisioning is difficult. As the influential author, Wallace Wattles, wrote, “There is no labor from which most people shrink as they do from that of sustained and consecutive thought; it is the hardest work in the world.”

I would add that when we’re trying to create a Vision of our possible future and sustain that Vision over time while the new circumstances unfold, it’s all the more difficult. I’ve witnessed first hand as talented aspirational people comment about how challenging it is to imagine a boundless future, and I’ve experienced it myself.

Some say they feel stuck in an old view of themselves that prevents them from seeing something more grand or satisfying in the future. Others say that Envisioning reinforces a long-held belief that they’re not creative, that they don’t have much imagination. Still others say that Envisioning something far outside of their current circumstances just seems like wishful thinking and so they don’t enjoy doing it. Some feel vaguely uncomfortable imagining their future but don’t really know why.

Because I understand that Envisioning is both profoundly necessary and, yet, often difficult and frustrating, I emphasize it in my one-to-one coaching and we’re going to go into it more deeply here as well. If you feel tempted to skip over this chapter, I advise you to re-consider!

First, I’d like you to know that it’s entirely possible to train yourself to become a more agile imaginer. I know you can do this because the imagination is much like a muscle -- it benefits from frequent use. If you do two dozen biceps curls with weights, three times a week, your biceps will get stronger. That’s something you can count on.

The same goes with training your imaginative functions. It gets easier with practice.

So let’s do this together!  I’ve put together 6 Key Elements to Envisioning that can help you create your very own techni-color inspiring vision of the practice/business you want to build. 

Let’s get started!  Introducing...

The 6 Key Elements for Igniting Your Powerful Vision

1st Key Element:  ASK Provocative Questions

2nd Key Element:  EXERCISE your Imagination by Thinking Bigger

3rd Key Element:  DOCUMENT Your Vision

4th Key Element:  SHARE Your Vision with Someone Else

5th Key Element:   IMAGINE Your Success and Feel the Excitement

6th Key Element:   TREAT Your Vision as a Living Breathing Thing

end of excerpt

 

EXCERPT #2,  from Step 5: 

COMPOSE Your Compelling Stories

In his best-selling book Tribes: We Need You to Lead Us, the prolific and celebrated author Seth Godin says that marketing is “telling stories that spread.”

The phrase “going viral” entered our collective lexicon in the past decade, demonstrating graphically what it looks like when a story spreads.

Stories that go viral are those that inspire massive levels of interest. They come in many forms. Some are stories told in a largely visual form – a super-cute photo of a baby dancing or a hilarious cat video. They may be brief accounts, in words, of events we find intrinsically irresistible: a Facebook post about a good deed performed, a life saved or the unlikely athletic victory of an underdog.

We may not all have a story to tell that will go viral, but we do certainly all have stories to tell that can reach out to our communities and prospective clients. Telling these stories with imagination and an intention to engage others is a key to building prosperous holistic practices.

In this step, “Compose Your Compelling Stories,” you decide what you want to say to your prospective clients and broadcast to your community (whether online or off). You’ll learn about telling stories to help your ideal clients realize you are the professional they’ve been searching for, and doing so in a way that feels authentic and honest.

This is where your current understanding about what marketing is may be challenged in a substantive and comforting way. You will begin to see that learning to accurately speak and write about what you can do to help others is not only a marketing function, but also a part of the service you provide.

What kinds of stories will you need to support your marketing efforts?

Marketing copy is all the words and images you use in your web pages, brochures, social media profiles, etc. Those words and images have to come from somewhere, right? They will come from your efforts to communicate effectively with your Ideal Client. We will focus our efforts here on the words and leave a discussion of imagery to another day, another book.

"This is the first hoop you will forever need to jump through -

 “Is what you’re offering relevant to my life? Does it matter to me? Should I be paying attention?”

Tad Hargrave, Marketing for Hippies

 

You’ll need more than one version of your story – in basic terms: an elevator speech, a one-minute conversation, and a series of leading questions. You’ll also want a business name and a story about yourself. 

You will need to tweak these stories from time to time for different occasions depending on whether you’re being introduced to a group, attending a networking event, putting together copy for a brochure or web page, or any of the myriad other ways in which your stories will be used. However, for the most part, once you have an elevator speech, a one-minute conversation, a business name, leading questions, and a story about yourself -- you’re off and running.

end of excerpt

for your support of this project. 

Your attention and encouragement is greatly appreciated.

 

Meriah Kruse

Holistic Marketing Coach, Life Force Marketing

Designer and CEO, Good Tidings Greeting Cards

Feldenkrais Practitioner with Be Free to Move

The vision-based holistic approach to marketing I’m suggesting in Life Force Marketing is a distillation of what I’ve learned from my own journey with myriad teachers (including university courses and coaching relationships with some of the best marketing experts in the world) and from thousands of life experiences in which I’ve practiced and applied what I’ve learned. This has included my participation in a leadership and marketing role in a number of enterprises, both for-profit and non-profit, over a 35+ year period:  26 years in private practice as a holistic practitioner, 18 years as a dance and movement educator and collaborating artist, 5 years as owner/operator of a women's adventure travel company and 2 years as founder/designer of a boutique greeting card company. If you'd like the details... visit: http://lifeforcemarketing.com/about-us/

EXCERPT #1,  from Step 1:  
ENVISION the Life You Would Love to Live
We start with a Vision because without it you’re a ship without a destination.
If your understanding of what you want to accomplish is vague, if for some reason you haven’t expended the time and energy needed to clearly define your Vision in living color, you’re operating at a grave disadvantage.
We begin, at Step One, with fleshing out your Vision for what you want to accomplish, the type of practice or business you want to have, the kinds of people you want to serve, what you want to offer them, the kinds of results you want to facilitate for them, the environment in which you will do this, and more. 
It’s a fairly well-kept secret that having a splendid, technicolor, ‘felt’ Vision for yourself that thrills you to the very marrow of your bones is what provides the Life Force required for building and growing any enterprise.
We refer back to your Vision many times throughout your process of choosing, planning and implementing your choices of marketing avenues. As will be made clear as you read along, your Vision for the Life you want to live and the larger mission you have for your work will inform every marketing decision you make. 
Moving forward without a vivid, heart-felt Vision is essentially a form of planning to fail. Without it, you lack the fuel needed to keep the warrior spirit alive as you craft your Life-altering business from the ethers.
And that’s why holistic marketing must begin with the development of a Vision that will guide and motivate you every step along the way to building your ideal practice or business. 
Let me tell you a story.
In my 20’s I encountered my first network marketing presentation. I had been invited to a friend’s house to learn about a new business idea. I was, even then, sprouting entrepreneurial wings (although I didn’t know it yet). By far the most memorable moment of that evening was when someone flipped to a piece of the large white paper he had suspended on an easel and asked a very provocative question, “If money was no object, what would you do, where would you go, and what would you have?” 
This was an Earth-shaking event for me at the time for the simple reason that no-one had ever suggested that I think so freely, imagine so boundlessly. Undoubtedly that’s why I remember it so clearly.
I’ve since heard many variations on this kind of question, each designed to stimulate thinking beyond our current personal paradigm. 
One of my favorites is the oft-quoted, “What would you do if you knew you couldn’t fail?”  This question stirs me deeply; I use it often to talk to myself if I notice that I’m dragging my feet or getting lost in uncertainty about what to do next.  This brilliant question goes to the core of what stops many of us from reaching toward the stars — our fear that we will fail.
More recently I’ve learned a paradigm-busting question that I consider fool-proof in stimulating a grand Life Vision. From the creator of Dreambuilder Coaching, Mary Morrissey, this stellar query is, “What is the Life you would love to live?”  I suggest you begin there.
Why is Envisioning Something We Postpone Doing?
In the past 10 years I’ve attended dozens of online courses, seminars, live events and symposia on topics related to growing a small business or private practice. In almost every one of those events there’s been some mention of Envisioning. Predictably, most people in the field of business coaching and mentoring agree that having a Vision is important.
Despite this almost universal agreement, I have noticed something ironic. Although each of these very fine teachers, leaders and speakers has a highly developed, well thought out, methodical and detailed curriculum -- only a few give any serious attention to the Envisioning segments of their programs!  It’s almost as if there’s an assumption at work, something like, “This Vision-Building stuff is something anyone can do, so let’s just get it over with and get to the hard stuff!”
This is an erroneous assumption because, sadly, for many people, Envisioning is difficult. As the influential author, Wallace Wattles, wrote, “There is no labor from which most people shrink as they do from that of sustained and consecutive thought; it is the hardest work in the world.”
I would add that when we’re trying to create a Vision of our possible future and sustain that Vision over time while the new circumstances unfold, it’s all the more difficult. I’ve witnessed first hand as talented aspirational people comment about how challenging it is to imagine a boundless future, and I’ve experienced it myself.
Some say they feel stuck in an old view of themselves that prevents them from seeing something more grand or satisfying in the future. Others say that Envisioning reinforces a long-held belief that they’re not creative, that they don’t have much imagination. Still others say that Envisioning something far outside of their current circumstances just seems like wishful thinking and so they don’t enjoy doing it. Some feel vaguely uncomfortable imagining their future but don’t really know why.
Because I understand that Envisioning is both profoundly necessary and, yet, often difficult and frustrating, I emphasize it in my one-to-one coaching and we’re going to go into it more deeply here as well. If you feel tempted to skip over this chapter, I advise you to re-consider!
First, I’d like you to know that it’s entirely possible to train yourself to become a more agile imaginer. I know you can do this because the imagination is much like a muscle -- it benefits from frequent use. If you do two dozen biceps curls with weights, three times a week, your biceps will get stronger. That’s something you can count on.
The same goes with training your imaginative functions. It gets easier with practice.
So let’s do this together!  I’ve put together 6 Key Elements to Envisioning that can help you create your very own techni-color inspiring vision of the practice/business you want to build. 
Let’s get started!  Introducing...
The 6 Key Elements for Igniting Your Powerful Vision
1st Key Element:  ASK Provocative Questions
2nd Key Element:  EXERCISE your Imagination by Thinking Bigger
3rd Key Element:  DOCUMENT Your Vision
4th Key Element:  SHARE Your Vision with Someone Else
5th Key Element:   IMAGINE Your Success and Feel the Excitement
6th Key Element:   TREAT Your Vision as a Living Breathing Thing
end of excerpt
 
EXCERPT #2,  from Step 5: 
COMPOSE Your Compelling Stories
In his best-selling book Tribes: We Need You to Lead Us, the prolific and celebrated author Seth Godin says that marketing is “telling stories that spread.”
The phrase “going viral” entered our collective lexicon in the past decade, demonstrating graphically what it looks like when a story spreads.
Stories that go viral are those that inspire massive levels of interest. They come in many forms. Some are stories told in a largely visual form – a super-cute photo of a baby dancing or a hilarious cat video. They may be brief accounts, in words, of events we find intrinsically irresistible: a Facebook post about a good deed performed, a life saved or the unlikely athletic victory of an underdog.
We may not all have a story to tell that will go viral, but we do certainly all have stories to tell that can reach out to our communities and prospective clients. Telling these stories with imagination and an intention to engage others is a key to building prosperous holistic practices.
In this step, “Compose Your Compelling Stories,” you decide what you want to say to your prospective clients and broadcast to your community (whether online or off). You’ll learn about telling stories to help your ideal clients realize you are the professional they’ve been searching for, and doing so in a way that feels authentic and honest.
This is where your current understanding about what marketing is may be challenged in a substantive and comforting way. You will begin to see that learning to accurately speak and write about what you can do to help others is not only a marketing function, but also a part of the service you provide.
What kinds of stories will you need to support your marketing efforts?
Marketing copy is all the words and images you use in your web pages, brochures, social media profiles, etc. Those words and images have to come from somewhere, right? They will come from your efforts to communicate effectively with your Ideal Client. We will focus our efforts here on the words and leave a discussion of imagery to another day, another book.

"This is the first hoop you will forever need to jump through -
 “Is what you’re offering relevant to my life? Does it matter to me? Should I be paying attention?”
Tad Hargrave, Marketing for Hippies
 

You’ll need more than one version of your story – in basic terms: an elevator speech, a one-minute conversation, and a series of leading questions. You’ll also want a business name and a story about yourself. 
You will need to tweak these stories from time to time for different occasions depending on whether you’re being introduced to a group, attending a networking event, putting together copy for a brochure or web page, or any of the myriad other ways in which your stories will be used. However, for the most part, once you have an elevator speech, a one-minute conversation, a business name, leading questions, and a story about yourself -- you’re off and running.
end of excerpt
 
 
 

OTHER WAYS You Can Help
Perhaps you can't contribute financially but you'd like to help in some way. Here's an idea!


Help me to get the word out. Post something on your social media. If you know someone who could benefit from my book, let them know. That's a huge help!
Indiegogo has share tools that make this very simple!

  T H A N K    Y O Ufor your support of this project. Your attention and encouragement is greatly appreciated. Meriah KruseHolistic Marketing Coach, Life Force MarketingDesigner and CEO, Good Tidings Greeting CardsFeldenkrais Practitioner with Be Free to MoveLifeForceMarketing.comGoodTidingsCards.com

story:
Story of My Book

Warrior Entrepreneur is a book about the warrior spirit. The book looks at the science of adversity and highlights stories from the modern-day military, historical warriors, entrepreneurs and all warriors who have used their adversity as opportunities for growth. This book highlights the intangible traits that all warriors share, such as grit, overcoming challenges, teamwork, tenacity, purpose, confidence, adaptability, sacrifice and mental health.

My name is Zachary L Green, and I am the author of Warrior Entrepreneur. I wrote this book because, as a US Marine and an entrepreneur, I found that the same intangible traits I learned from my time in the US Marine Corps and as a firefighter were the same traits that made me successful as an entrepreneur. I wanted to not only share my story of overcoming challenges and fighting through my personal crucibles but also share stories of others who have grown from their adversity and used those lessons to accomplish their life’s missions.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that adversity can be tremendous teaching opportunities. The adversity could be anything from a challenging upbringing to military service to business and life hardships. Anybody can be a warrior when you look at adversity as opportunities for growth and training, for fighting through any crucible that may happen in your life. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have learned from my time in the US Marine Corps, being a firefighter and an award winning entrepreneur. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you conquer your crucibles and achieve your life’s mission.

In this book, you'll learn about grit and tenacity. You'll hear stories such as...
  • A Presidential diplomatic mission to Sudan as a civil war was starting to erupt.
  • A US Marine Corps aviator short on fuel whose wingman crashed as they were trying to land an aircraft carrier in rough seas.
  • The first female graduate of US Marine Corps Infantry School
  • You will love this book if you are an entrepreneur, a leader or anyone who wants to accomplish their life’s mission.

Warrior Entrepreneur is a nonfiction book that speaks to the warrior in all of us and those who want to look at adversity and hardship in a new way.
 

The Book - Warrior Entrepreneur


The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapter 1. In the first pages of the book, I share my story of battling through almost dying from COVID in late 2020. It then transitions to background on my childhood, time in the US Marine Corps and fire department and how I grew my business from the trunk of my car to a $10-million-a-year business.

Part 2 contains chapters 2-4. In these chapters, we explore the science of adversity and the concept of crucibles.

Part 3 contains chapters 5-13. These chapters highlight stories from ancient warriors, to the modern-day military, to entrepreneurs from all types of companies.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the publishing costs.

 

Money raised will go toward the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

 

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!
 

About the Author


Zachary Green is a graduate of Roger Bacon High School in Cincinnati, Ohio and a graduate of Bowling Green State University (Ohio). A U.S. Marine Corps veteran and former lieutenant with his local fire department, Zachary is the founder and CEO of MN8 LumAware/Foxfire. MN8 is a global leader in photoluminescent safety solutions used by over 80,000 firefighters in more than 25 countries. In addition, Zachary has developed a line of safety items ranging from products that help people find their way out of dark stairwells to code-approved EXIT signs that never need batteries, lightbulbs, electricity or testing. These products save over 7 million pounds of carbon dioxide emissions, 30,000 batteries and 60,000 lightbulbs per year.

Zachary received the President of the United States “E” award for exporting and has been honored as Exporter of the Year by the Ohio Small Business Administration. He was featured in Entrepreneur magazine, the front page of Yahoo.com, MSN.com and in USA Today, along with numerous other local and national media outlets. Zachary testified in front of the US House of Representatives Small Business committee and was named Entrepreneur of the Year by Governor John Kasich. He was also selected by the Obama Administration as one of ten entrepreneurs to represent the United States at the Global Entrepreneur Summit. He was also elected as a City Councilman in Wyoming (Cincinnati), Ohio.

Zachary wrote this book when he realized that the same life-saving traits he learned in the military and fire service were the same traits that made him successful as an entrepreneur. Giving up when times get tough is easy, but battling through adversity and challenge is what makes a warrior victorious.

Zachary loves to travel with his family. His hobbies are wine collecting, USMC WWI military memorabilia, hunting and outdoor activities. His top passion is mentoring entrepreneurs, especially military veterans and first responders. He lives in Hilton Head Island, SC with his wife Jennifer and son Bryce.

For more information, you can connect with Zach at zacharylgreen@gmail.com and on LinkedIn  .
 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #WARRIORENTREPRENEURBOOK and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Zachary L Green/www.newdegreepress.com/

story:
My Story & Campaign Summary

Hi ya'll! My name is Karlie Belle. I am a southern West Virginia girl who has a profound love for children and animals. I am an aspiring children's book author. My children's books are written in rhyme and teach important life lessons such as love, compassion and acceptance.

As a dog mom to nine, my furry family will rate my books during Karlie Belle's "Woof Woof Reviews" (coming soon).

I have four sisters and was raised by my parents, Charles "Charlie" and Sally Price. My dad, Charlie, was an avid farmer, carpenter and construction worker who sadly passed away in 2003 from lung cancer. My mom, Sally, was a stay-at-home wife and mother who shares in my love for writing and story telling. My book, "Sally the Shoe, Helpful Soles," is dedicated to her. Unfortunately, she has been diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease and is currently in a nursing home. Thankfully she still knows me, my sisters and family and she's very excited to receive the very first copy of my book!

I graduated from the University of Charleston in West Virginia with a Bachelor's Degree in Communications and a Master's Degree in Human Resource Management. I am currently a Marketing and Public Relations Director at a hospital in my hometown in rural West Virginia.

I have a mild addiction to cheese fries and coca cola. My life-long dream is to become a well-known children's book author and talk-show hostess.

By supporting this campaign you are supporting my life-long dream and helping me engage and guide children in a creative way through visual learning and rhyming.

"Sally the Shoe, Helpful Soles” is the first in a wonderfully fun, unique series of books designed to teach children important life lessons. Each story features a memorable shoe character who embarks on thrilling adventures and impossible journeys while overcoming challenges and obstacles. “Helpful Soles” is the story of Sally the Shoe and friends coming together to give a friend in need the gift of a lifetime. 

What We Need & What You Get

Accomplishments to date and how funds will be utilized:

Goals completed to date:

- Written Sally the Shoe 

- Selected an illustrator via Fiverr

- Created business name and logo

- Created and launched website (www.karliebellebooks.com)

- Completed front and back cover and two, two-page spreads

How funding will be used:

- Complete remaining illustrations for Sally the Shoe

- Print and ship orders obtained via Indiegogo 

- Marketing 

Additional funds raised will assist with the production of additional Karlie Belle Books. 

Based on your contribution level, you will receive a unique perk.

Get a high-quality first edition E-Book.

My Story & Campaign Summary
Hi ya'll! My name is Karlie Belle. I am a southern West Virginia girl who has a profound love for children and animals. I am an aspiring children's book author. My children's books are written in rhyme and teach important life lessons such as love, compassion and acceptance.
As a dog mom to nine, my furry family will rate my books during Karlie Belle's "Woof Woof Reviews" (coming soon).
I have four sisters and was raised by my parents, Charles "Charlie" and Sally Price. My dad, Charlie, was an avid farmer, carpenter and construction worker who sadly passed away in 2003 from lung cancer. My mom, Sally, was a stay-at-home wife and mother who shares in my love for writing and story telling. My book, "Sally the Shoe, Helpful Soles," is dedicated to her. Unfortunately, she has been diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease and is currently in a nursing home. Thankfully she still knows me, my sisters and family and she's very excited to receive the very first copy of my book!
I graduated from the University of Charleston in West Virginia with a Bachelor's Degree in Communications and a Master's Degree in Human Resource Management. I am currently a Marketing and Public Relations Director at a hospital in my hometown in rural West Virginia.
I have a mild addiction to cheese fries and coca cola. My life-long dream is to become a well-known children's book author and talk-show hostess.
By supporting this campaign you are supporting my life-long dream and helping me engage and guide children in a creative way through visual learning and rhyming.
"Sally the Shoe, Helpful Soles” is the first in a wonderfully fun, unique series of books designed to teach children important life lessons. Each story features a memorable shoe character who embarks on thrilling adventures and impossible journeys while overcoming challenges and obstacles. “Helpful Soles” is the story of Sally the Shoe and friends coming together to give a friend in need the gift of a lifetime.

story:
The Story of Yellow Flowers

There is a species of yellow flowers that grows in the mountains of the Greater Caucasus, and there are children who in 13 years haven’t been able to smile at their blossoming in the spring. This book is the story of these children, these mountains, and the yellow flowers that grow on them, but also an attempt at offering these flowers back to their children, now grown up and away from home.

My name is Elena Vedovello and I am the author of Yellow Flowers.

I wrote this book because five years ago, when I moved from my country, Italy, to Armenia, I met Anano, a friend of mine who was born in Akhalgori, Georgia, but had been forced to move away in 2008, when a war with Russia led to a now thirteen-year-long occupation. Anano’s story is the story of many other children, families, and communities, that suffered the consequences of crushing politics and armies, in Akhalgori and many other towns in Georgia. Yellow Flowers is a way to let this story reach you through the fictional depiction of a very real tragedy. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover, in all its human components, one of the realities that thousands of Georgians had to face in the aftermath of the 2008 war. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to engage with the themes of displacement, oppression, growth, endurance, and a deeply-rooted ancient culture.

On a sunny August afternoon, 8-year-old Ana is playing with her doll on the street just outside her home. She is surrounded by the neighborhood children, a few hens, and the mountains everyone in Akhalgori considered loyal old friends. In a second, everything changes as a near-by explosion brings confusion and whispers to the town. A few hours later, many residents of Akhalgori are beginning their exodus towards the south, leaving behind their homes, their lush gardens, their elderly, and life as they knew it.

For Ana and her family, the future is uncertain. They temporarily move to the capital, Tbilisi, but the only certainty is the uncertainty in the answers they get. Families reunite, protests happen, the government gives and withdraws information, and the world is watching. For little Ana, everything seems confusing. It is the building of an IDP settlement in the winter of 2008 that oxymoronically offers some familiarity to Ana’s family: neighbors are found and the idea of continuity is possible. 

Just like that, Ana and the other children from Akhalgori learn to inhabit the newly built streets of their settlement, amid the whispering of adults, the hidden pain of elderly neighbors, and the unknown dynamics of displacement, families separated by borders, and occupation. 

Yellow Flowers is a story of growth away from home, the endurance of roots on infertile ground, loss, and the eternal beauty of being young and learning about oneself.

You will love this book if you find beauty in the stories of those near and far, if you’ve ever travelled to Georgia or if you never have; if you grew up in the mountains or used to absentmindedly draw green hills in school; if you yearn to learn more about the world, and if you’ve seen enough in the eyes of those around you. Yellow Flowers will be an interesting read if you know about the 2008 war, but also if you’ve never heard of it. It will intrigue you if you like fiction based on real-life events. If you’ve ever lost a home, whether physically, metaphorically, mentally, emotionally, or spiritually, this book was written for you.

Yellow Flowers speaks to former children everywhere whose hearts are open to a new, yet ageless story, which will teleport them far away, only to then return within. 

Ultimately, I hope that Yellow Flowers inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like: how is a home built, and what does it mean that it can be lost? How do communities survive amid loss and displacement? How does oppression, big and small, transform our lives? 

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers!

 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in May 2022.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this coming spring.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

Campaign Goals

Tier 1: Hit $7,000 and the ebook/softcover editions get published (this is the minimum needed)
Tier 2: Hit $8,000 and the book will get a hardcover edition
Tier 3: Hit $10,000 and we’ll get an audiobook edition.

 

The Author

Elena Vedovello is a third-year-student at Pomona College, hailing from Bergamo, Italy. She completed high school at the United World College of Dilijan in Armenia, and then has spent her college years in California, where she is currently majoring in Environmental Biology and English. 

It is on this journey that she crossed the path of Anano, the girl whose story Yellow Flowers is based on. The desire to share her friend’s story is what brought her to write this book. 

Other than being constantly inspired by her friends to write books about their lives, Elena also spends countless hours on trains and buses to reach new and old destinations. She joins lacrosse teams everywhere she goes, and avidly reads everything that she can get her hands on.
 

For more information, you can connect with Elena Vedovello at elena.vedovello@pomona.edu, and on Instagram (@vedovelena), Facebook (@elevedovello), LinkedIn (@elenavedovello), or YouTube (@ElenaVedovello).

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please do the following:

  • Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks
  • Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)
  • Use this form to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:

  • At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit)
  • Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.
  • When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry! 

Please use #YellowFlowers and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!
Tag: 
Instagram - @vedovelena / @newdegreepress
Facebook - @elevedovello / @NewDegreePress 
LinkedIn - @elenavedovello / @New-Degree-Press

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Elena Vedovello

Click on each perk to view a full description of what it includes and to place your preorder!

 

The Story of You Are Where You Go


My name is Caitlyn Lubas and I am the author of You Are Where You Go: A Traveler’s Coming of Age Journey Through 70 Countries and 7 Continents During College. I wrote this book because I wish I had been able to read a book like this from the perspective of a young, 22-year old traveler who was just a normal student, not a travel writer or influencer, when I was starting my journey as a young traveler. 

My book is on track to be published on November 23, and this presale helps me fund the cost of creating the book – from editors to cover designers to marketing and PR teams, I've already made a lot of personal investments into this passion project and need YOUR HELP to bring it across the finish line!

See below for a description of my book, where the money raised will be spent, more about me, and other ways to support if you can’t donate.

You Are Where You Go is a traveler’s take on the classic saying “you are what you eat.”

By writing and publishing the book, I seek to inspire others with my personal stories of how travel has changed my perspectives and shaped me into the person I am today. My goal is to prompt readers to see travel as a tool for personal development and to spark readers’ desires to learn and grow outside of their comfort zones, because everywhere you go becomes a part of you!

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that travel can be the best way to explore the world while also exploring yourself. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to vicariously visit different corners of the world, to escape from your everyday life for a few hours, and learn alongside me in this collection of stories that captures how different places around the world have taught me essential life lessons that shaped my personality, worldview, and life philosophy.

 

Readers can discover unique travel stories like:

  • Learning to protect and preserve nature after visiting the penguins, whales, and seals of Antarctica
  • Realizing the things in life we often take for granted after camping on an overland safari in Eastern Africa for 6 weeks straight
  • Learning about empathy after a motorbike accident in rural Vietnam
  • Discovering how to maximize life by trekking through Argentinian Patagonia
  • Exploring solo travel vs partner travel in Australia
  • Spending every weekend in a different country for 10 months while studying abroad in Europe and Southeast Asia
  • Living the digital nomad, remote work life throughout dozens of different cities in the US after quitting my corporate job and deciding to travel full time

Each chapter shares a perspective-shifting moment that shows how exploring the world can be one of the best ways to explore yourself by learning and growing outside of your comfort zone.

You will love this book if you are an aspiring traveler, an avid young traveler, digital nomad, or if you're just passionate about travel and exploring different cultures. If you like reading memoirs from a unique perspective about once-in-a-lifetime experiences that no one except the author could possibly write, this book is for you.

 

What We Need & What You'll Get

Your support in pre-ordering this book means the world to me, as I’ve paid upfront money to many of the partners that have helped me create and publish my book. This pre-order campaign will help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • Editors – I’ve worked with a Developmental Editor, who helped enhance the overall style of my writing from the very beginning, chapter-by-chapter; an Acquiring Editor, who read my entire first draft manuscript and made suggestions for overall flow and chapter tie-in to the main theme and message; a Marketing and Revisions Editor, who will again revise my book chapter by chapter; a Copyeditor who will read the book line-by-line to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication; and a Proofreader who will take one final pass before sending the manuscript off to the printing press!
  • The Cover Design – I’ll be working with a cover designer to create my dream book cover and go through three iterations until it is as perfect as it can be! As a Kickstarter backer, you’ll be invited to give your feedback and help me choose the final book cover. (The mockups you see of “You Are Where You Go” on the blue book cover currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design – For the interior of my book to fit the correct dimensions of a hardcover, paperback, and ebook, I’ll be hiring a specialist to design the interior formatting along with slots for a photo from my travels that represents each of the chapters!
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts – even if I write the greatest book in the world, if no one knows about it, the book will not be a success! I’m working with an incredible social media marketing agency, a PR agency, a digital creator for Instagram AR effects, and more to help get the word out about my book leading up to my publication date this fall.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will be printed in my book in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback in the months of August and September.
  • You will have the opportunity to vote on my final cover design.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process (through my Close Friends story on @you.are.where.you.go on Instagram and/or through my You Are Where You Go Facebook group!
  • And much more!

 

Campaign Goals

Standard Tiers:
Tier 1: Hit $5,000 and the softcover and ebook get published
Tier 2: Hit $7,000 and the hardcover will be published
Tier 3: Hit $8,500 and I'll get to create an audiobook edition, available on Audible!
 

 

About the Author

Caitlyn Lubas is a graduate of NYU Stern School of Business and a former Product Specialist at Instagram who recently quit her full time job to pursue her dream of being a travel author, content creator, and entrepreneur full time.

Caitlyn has always been an avid reader and writer – she created a travel blog called “This Wanderful World” during her first study abroad experiences in college, and read 120+ books last year during the COVID-19 pandemic quarantine period. All of this has helped Caitlyn hone in on what makes good travel writing, and she knows firsthand what types of writing and memoir-style stories are most interesting to readers.

As a traveler, Caitlyn’s life mission is to build a community of intentional, sustainably-minded travelers seeking authentic experiences and making the world a better place through increased cultural exchange.

Alongside launching You Are Where You Go as a travel memoir, Caitlyn hopes to create future iterations of her book in the form of a children’s book, a music album featuring international artists, a documentary, and more!

Caitlyn is also currently working on a travel startup called womo, which will be a platform for travelers to connect with travel experts for authentic, personalized (wo)rd of (mo)uth recommendations and customized itineraries for trips, verified by locals. 

To follow Caitlyn’s journey as a 23-year-old digital nomad and travel entrepreneur exploring the world, follow her on social media!

Personal Instagram: @caitlynlubas
Author/Book Instagram: @you.are.where.you.go

Personal TikTok: @caitlynlubas
Author/Book TikTok: @you.are.where.you.go

Personal Twitter: @caitlynlubas
Book Twitter: @YAWYG_book

Subscribe for email updates at www.youarewhereyougo.com 
Sign up for text alerts at bit.ly/YouAreWhereYouGo-texts

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with my publisher to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship – the projected release date is Tuesday, November 23, 2021.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:

  1. At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit ?)

  3. When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry! 

Please use #YouAreWhereYouGo and tag me so I can help amplify your efforts!

Tag me on social media when you share this campaign!

My name is Caitlyn Lubas and I am the author of You Are Where You Go: A Traveler’s Coming of Age Journey Through 70 Countries and 7 Continents During College. I wrote this book because I wish I had been able to read a book like this from the perspective of a young, 22-year old traveler who was just a normal student, not a travel writer or influencer, when I was starting my journey as a young traveler. 
My book is on track to be published on November 23, and this presale helps me fund the cost of creating the book – from editors to cover designers to marketing and PR teams, I've already made a lot of personal investments into this passion project and need YOUR HELP to bring it across the finish line!
See below for a description of my book, where the money raised will be spent, more about me, and other ways to support if you can’t donate.You Are Where You Go is a traveler’s take on the classic saying “you are what you eat.”By writing and publishing the book, I seek to inspire others with my personal stories of how travel has changed my perspectives and shaped me into the person I am today. My goal is to prompt readers to see travel as a tool for personal development and to spark readers’ desires to learn and grow outside of their comfort zones, because everywhere you go becomes a part of you!My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that travel can be the best way to explore the world while also exploring yourself. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to vicariously visit different corners of the world, to escape from your everyday life for a few hours, and learn alongside me in this collection of stories that captures how different places around the world have taught me essential life lessons that shaped my personality, worldview, and life philosophy.
 
Readers can discover unique travel stories like:

Learning to protect and preserve nature after visiting the penguins, whales, and seals of Antarctica
Realizing the things in life we often take for granted after camping on an overland safari in Eastern Africa for 6 weeks straight
Learning about empathy after a motorbike accident in rural Vietnam
Discovering how to maximize life by trekking through Argentinian Patagonia
Exploring solo travel vs partner travel in Australia
Spending every weekend in a different country for 10 months while studying abroad in Europe and Southeast Asia
Living the digital nomad, remote work life throughout dozens of different cities in the US after quitting my corporate job and deciding to travel full time

Each chapter shares a perspective-shifting moment that shows how exploring the world can be one of the best ways to explore yourself by learning and growing outside of your comfort zone.You will love this book if you are an aspiring traveler, an avid young traveler, digital nomad, or if you're just passionate about travel and exploring different cultures. 'Der er noget der lyser' - er efterfølgeren til 'Alle himle regner'

I 2018 udkom digtsamlingen 'Alle himle regner' af Louise Breyen. Den blev udsolgt på første år og 2. oplag er nu er butikkerne. Mange kender bogen fra forestillingen 'I et forhold - med Sort Samvittighed' på Betty Nansen, som havde premiere i marts 2019.

I mellemtiden har Louise Breyen skrevet på 2'eren: 'Der er noget der lyser'

Kærlighed

Bogen beskriver igen kærligheden og overgivelsen til den - eller mangel på samme - og også den vi kan have til os selv. Digtsamlingen udkommer i samme stil, sprog og udformning, som den første – blot med lidt mere kant i sit indhold.

Forudbestil eller donér

Forudbestil dit eksemplar her og støt forfatteren og produktion af bogen. Køb én, tre, fem eller ti bøger og modtag dem med posten – eller klik på den røde BACK IT / Make a contribution knap, hvis du vil donere et valgfrit beløb.

Alle bøger er nummereret og signeret.

Tak!

story:
Story of My Book

Finding Lavender is a story about a sixteen-year-old girl discovering her forever home amongst new people which she never believed she would get along with. It is a story about family and togetherness.

My name is Lauren Morrone and I am the author of Finding Lavender. I wrote this book because I understand how hard feeling like an outcast is. I understand how difficult it is to go through your teen years feeling like you don’t belong, and I want to gather people who also understand this in order to form a sense of togetherness and community.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that being different and having unique lives is okay—not only okay, but exceptional. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to become familiar with the intersections of finding your forever home, knowing that it is okay to ask for help, and the true meaning of family and community.

You will love this book if you’re a fan of YA contemporary books, looking for a relatable, representative high school story, or struggle with a sense of belonging.

Finding Lavender speaks to teenagers and young adults who want to grapple with belonging and community in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that Finding Lavender inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

What defines a family?

How can I be more inclusive and understanding?

What is the importance of community and togetherness?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing the importance of family will change us all for the better.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

 

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.
 
  • I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Lauren Morrone is a student at Arcadia University in Glenside, Pennsylvania. She is currently a sophomore, studying English with a concentration in creative writing. She hopes to pursue her dreams of becoming a bestselling author beginning with Finding Lavender and extending to future books.

She decided to write Finding Lavender because of her struggles while growing up with social anxiety and depression, which caused her to feel like an outsider. Because of these experiences, she felt that it was important to tell the story of someone with a unique perspective on the world instead of writing from the perspective of someone the world has already heard from.

Lauren enjoys reading fantasy novels, watching Netflix shows, photography, and spending time with her family. She has a shih-tzu named Gizmo and a cat named Primrose, both of which Lauren is constantly posting about on social media.

For more information, you can connect with Lauren Morrone at morronelaurens@gmail.com and at @lauren.samantha on Instagram.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #FindingLavender and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Lauren Morrone
