story:
The Book's Story

"Why didn't she report?" We've all heard the question. As the #MeToo movement pulls our country towards sexual violence realities, that question is the undercurrent that allows us to pull back.

"But, why didn't she report?" We ask, and we remain doubtful. We remain safe. 

Sometimes it sounds different, sandwiched between words that make it softer. Less critical. "I totally believe her, what I just don't get is, if it actually happened, why didn't she report back then?"

Sometimes it sounds like a valid point. As Dr. Christine Blasey-Ford testified against her assailant in 2018, the question echoed across America. We were all forced to consider, "Well, why didn't she report?"

Our president tweeted it: "I have no doubt that, if the attack on Dr. Ford was as bad as she says, charges would have been immediately filed with local Law Enforcement Authorities by either her or her loving parents. I ask that she bring those filings forward so that we can learn date, time, and place!" (@realDonaldTrump, September 21, 2018)

Unreported explains why those filings don't exist. This book answers the question once and for all, by asking different women: "Why didn't you report?" Unreported is a compilation of conversations with those women, a renowned detective, and authors and advocates in the sexual assault spheres. The author analyzes famous case studies of people who did report, and draws on her own story. She, too, has been asked: "Why didn't you report?"

To read Unreported is to sit with your doubt, and risk feeling a little unsafe.

 

Note: People of color (Black women, in particular), are at disproportionate risk of sexual violence. With that truth in mind, and considering the purpose of this book, a percentage of the profits will be donated to The Loveland Foundation, which brings opportunity and healing to communities of color, and especially to Black women and girls.

 

The Book - Unreported

The book is written in 3 Parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + a few chapters on how to read the book — a manual to get you going.

Part 2 contains Chapters 4-9. These chapters are the intricate, anonymous retellings of untold stories: they grew out of interviews with people who did not report their sexual assault/rape. We consider how the system made it impossible to report, and then contrast their stories with case studies in which people did.

Part 3 contains Chapters 10-13. Here, we pair anecdotal evidence from the women’s stories in Part 2 with expert interviews and facts. A former detective, advocates, best-selling journalist, and a therapist help create our vision for a better system going forward.
 

What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2020.

The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)

The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book

Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

Early access to the Introduction of my Book and some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

And more...

About the Author

Kaley Roberts is a freelance creator and journalist. After college, she moved to LA and worked on-set for three different TV shows before landing at HBO for two years. This year, she moved to New York to work in documentary film.

Kaley is a fiercely curious person with a passion for connecting with people. She loves nothing more than listening to the stories of others, and has won awards for the way she retells them.  

When she’s not thinking about how to transform and improve the criminal justice system, Kaley likes to hang out with her family on their front porch, watch true crime docu-series, and read at the beach.

For more information, you can connect with Kaley at kaleynyc@gmail.com and @kalechipsndip on Instagram.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

story_txt: The Book's Story"Why didn't she report?" We've all heard the question. As the #MeToo movement pulls our country towards sexual violence realities, that question is the undercurrent that allows us to pull back."But, why didn't she report?" We ask, and we remain doubtful. We remain safe. Sometimes it sounds different, sandwiched between words that make it softer. Less critical. "I totally believe her, what I just don't get is, if it actually happened, why didn't she report back then?"Sometimes it sounds like a valid point. As Dr. Christine Blasey-Ford testified against her assailant in 2018, the question echoed across America. We were all forced to consider, "Well, why didn't she report?"Our president tweeted it: "I have no doubt that, if the attack on Dr. Ford was as bad as she says, charges would have been immediately filed with local Law Enforcement Authorities by either her or her loving parents. I ask that she bring those filings forward so that we can learn date, time, and place!" (@realDonaldTrump, September 21, 2018)Unreported explains why those filings don't exist. This book answers the question once and for all, by asking different women: "Why didn't you report?" Unreported is a compilation of conversations with those women, a renowned detective, and authors and advocates in the sexual assault spheres. The author analyzes famous case studies of people who did report, and draws on her own story. She, too, has been asked: "Why didn't you report?"To read Unreported is to sit with your doubt, and risk feeling a little unsafe. Note: People of color (Black women, in particular), are at disproportionate risk of sexual violence. With that truth in mind, and considering the purpose of this book, a percentage of the profits will be donated to The Loveland Foundation, which brings opportunity and healing to communities of color, and especially to Black women and girls. The Book - UnreportedThe book is written in 3 Parts.Part 1 contains the introduction + a few chapters on how to read the book — a manual to get you going.Part 2 contains Chapters 4-9. These chapters are the intricate, anonymous retellings of untold stories: they grew out of interviews with people who did not report their sexual assault/rape. We consider how the system made it impossible to report, and then contrast their stories with case studies in which people did.Part 3 contains Chapters 10-13. Nós Mesmas nace hace casi 6 años de un grupo de mujeres dispuestas a todo con un objetivo:

Ir eliminando del mapa la discriminación que sufren las personas homosexuales, bisexuales y transexuales a través de su acción social en el día a día.

Todas ellas mujeres, con historias y características diferentes, sienten que la realidad de la mujer lesbiana y bisexual se encuentra, en los entornos rurales como el suyo, mucho más amenazada, por lo que se centran en defender sus derechos:

Maternidad, Matrimonio, Reproducción, Visibilidad, Educación en la igualdad, No discriminación, Respeto a la diversidad, Igualdad de trato...

Pon nos cara aquí: 

Un año más, Nós Mesmas quiere llenar las calles de colores por el día del Orgullo LGTB con una semana de actos sociales, educativos y reivindicativos que haga abrir su entorno a la diversidad y todas y todos se lleven un poquito de arcoiris consigo.

-Exposición fotográfica que muestra la vida de dos parejas de mujeres del colectivo viviendo su día a día como una pareja más, "Abriendo las puertas a la diversidad".

-Mesa redonda "Por los Derechos Humanos LGTB" donde expondremos la situación real del colectivo, no sólo aquí, sino también en los 77 países donde ser homosexual está castigado y debatir sobre qué podemos hacer nosotrxs para cambiarlo.

-Cuenta cuentos Diverso, entre risas y fantasía, los más peques disfrutarán de historias que los enriquecerán un poquito más.

Con esta contribución podremos hacer posibles estás actividades dentro de un programa aún mayor que financiamos con nuestros propios recursos recaudados durante el año y con la ayuda en las infraestructuras del Ayuntamiento de Vigo.

Y porqué esto es importante? por que sigue habiendo discriminación laboral de las personas transexuales, por que un 17% de lxs jóvenes LGTB confiesan que han sufrido violencia homofóbica de algún tipo, por que quieren excluir a las parejas lésbicas de la reproducción asistida por la sanidad pública quitándonos derechos, por que ser gay, lesbiana, bisexual o transexual sigue estándo perseguido en muchos entornos....y un largo etcétera que queremos acortar.

Si no puedes colaborar económicamente, no te preocupes! ayúdanos a darle difusión, comparte nuestra petición entre tus contactos, háblale a tus amistades de que es lo que hacemos....y GRACIAS!!

story:
What is “...And Justice For Art”?

Hello, my name is Ramón Martos and I write for several Heavy Metal publications around the world, including MetalUnderground.com, This Is Metal Magazine, PureGrainAudio.com, HeavyMetalArtwork.com and many others. I’m also the author of “...And Justice For Art: Stories About Heavy Metal Album Covers.”

“...And Justice For Art” (softcover edition) is a one-of-a-kind collection of stories, stunning graphics, and  revealing interviews about the making of some of the greatest album covers in the history of Heavy Metal music. It includes all the particulars behind artworks as iconic as Slayer's "Reign In Blood," Morbid Angel's "Blessed Are The Sick," Metallica's "And Justice For All," Death's "Symbolic," Carcass "Heartwork," Black Sabbath’s “13”, Cormorant's "Dwellings,” At The Gates' "Slaughter Of The Soul,"Testament's "Dark Roots Of Earth," Opeth's "Heritage," Mayhem’s “Grand Declaration Of War,” and dozens of others. 

After three years researching, interviewing musicians and visual artists, and securing the rights to showcase the 400+ graphics featured in the book, “And Justice For Art” is ready to be printed... Now, I would like to share with you a great opportunity to make history together, to become partners in this effort that is aimed to change the way the world looks at Heavy Metal album covers.

Your contributions would make a tremendous difference in the outcome of this project, that—according to Morbid Angel’s frontman, David Vincent (who wrote the foreword)—has all the potential to become “a historical document about the importance of Metal album covers.”

The Book's Impact

“And Justice For Art” is the result of my 3-decades-old obsession with album covers. This started at a very early age when I was growing up in Cuba, as a Metal fan.  In my youth, I basically relied on 3rd generation tapes, usually obtained from the black market. These cassettes didn't feature any kind of artworks, so my friends and I had to create our own graphics in order to give some visual context to the music we were listening to.

Many years later, after moving to United States, I started developing the online series "And Justice For Art" and its companion Facebook community. Both are dedicated to promoting the works of many talented artists and the artworks accompanying the hundreds of Metal albums that are released every month.

This book is an extension of those online efforts. It's also a space to coherently compile the 100 exclusive interviews I conducted with  Metal icons like Jeff Walker (Carcass), Charlie Benante (Anthrax), Max Cavalera (Soulfly, ex-Sepultura), Fenriz (Darkthrone), Sebastian Bach (Skid Row), Maniac (ex-Mayhem), Paul Masvidal (Cynic), Chris Adler (Lamb Of God) David Vincent (Morbid Angel) and celebrated visual artists like Michael Whelan, Eliran Kantor, Dan Seagrave, Joe Petagno, Travis Smith, Arik Roper, and Paul Elledge, among many others.  

I believe that “And Justice For Art” will provide fans plenty of first-hand information regarding to the creation of these fabulous images. As Cattle Decapitation’s frontman, Travis Ryan, recently commented, this could be “exactly what the music world needs to remind us all just how important album covers have been to all of us that grew up surrounding ourselves with physical media.”

What We Need 

“And Justice For Art” is finished and ready to go to the printer. With your help, the book could be available before the end of 2014! I've already spent more than $6,000.00 securing the permissions I needed to use most of the images featured in the book and paying for the cover's and layout's design... However, manufacturing a book like this (264 pages long and full color) is a costly enterprise. I've reached a point where, sadly, my limited financial resources are just not enough. 

That's why I believe your support through this crowd-funding campaign will help me to raise the rest of the money I need to manufacture “And Justice For Art.” The specific amount of money I’m asking will allow me to produce a considerable amount of copies (between 300 and 500, depending on the raised amount) under reasonable costs per unit, without sacrificing high quality printing standards. 

Even if the campaign's goal is not met, I will combine whatever raised amount with the modest funds I have left from my original $7,000.00 budget to print as many physical books as possible.

What You Get

The perks offered to those who will support this effort are worth the commitment. To begin with, everyone contributing, no matter the amount, will be included in the book’s Thanks & Acknowledgement credits. Also, some of the bands involved on the project, like At The Gates, Cattle Decapitation, Morbid Angel, Obituary, While Heaven Wept, Katatonia and others, were extremely generous and donated really cool items for the campaign. Some of them are signed and in some cases, even personalized! Please, feel free to check the list of perks for more info.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are not interested or can’t collaborate with the making of this book, please help us to share this campaign with the rest of the world via Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and other social media. Even one Like, Tweet or Share could help to make the difference.  You can also follow the book’s development and find out more news about album covers via the ...And Justice For Art’s Facebook site: https://www.facebook.com/pages/And-Justice-For-Art/123376774515018

If you have any additional questions about the perks, about this campaign or for any other queries, contact author Ramon Martos at: andjusticeforart@gmail.com

Short Summary 

Hello!  My name is Colin Eldred-Cohen, a writer and critic living in San Jose.  What you see before you is the culmination of a year of love and hard work -- a children's book named The Fire Truck Who Got Lost.  It's a story about getting lost somewhere big and imposing and finding a solution by being smart.  What started as a simple story for my nephew about the importance of family and perseverance has come to life through Amber De Joya's beautiful artwork and care and attention from both sides.  Now I need your help to share it with young children everywhere.  This campaign is meant to fund the production and distribution of this book, turning it from a simple bedtime story into something that everyone can share.


What We Need & What You Get

For this campaign, we'll need a total of $2,000 to get it produced. We hope to reach at least $3,000 or $4,000 to market and print enough copies to sell.  $1600 will go to the production of the book, $250 will go towards distribution, $250 will be for the Indiegogo fees. The additional $1,000 or more will be our safety net if things go wrong and to market it and print additional copies. A simple donation of $5 will get you a digital copy of the book, which is perfect if your child uses the iPad.  Go up to $10 and you'll get a physical copy mailed to you.  $20 and above will get you a signed copy personalized to you, your child, or anyone you want.

If we don't reach our goal, we'll still put it towards distribution and production and find a way to pay for the rest.  If we go past our goal, we'll use those funds for additional compensation for the artist and marketing. We're committed to making this happen, one way or the other.

The Impact

Your contribution is important to me. 

This is my first published book in what I hope will be a long writing career.   It will show a larger audience what I can do and give me greater self-confidence as a writer.  I will learn a lot about publishing, as well as how to distribute and market my work that will help me enormously in future projects. 

But the most important impact will be the lessons children will learn about perseverance and cooperation. And, of course, it will bring smiles to the faces of the toddlers and parents who read Fire Truck together before bedtime.

Risks & Challenges

There may, of course, be some bumps along the way.  There could be printing errors that could cause pages to be unreadable or completely mess up the colors or the like.  Fortunately, I'm not one to send things into massive production without triple-checking them first.  I plan on doing a few test prints to see what goes wrong before fixing them and getting them properly printed.  In fact, with your contributions we'll hire a professional book production specialist.   

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute or don't have children as an incentive, there are other ways you can help too.  Share it with your friends and colleagues, especially those with kids just learning to read.  Spread it as far as you can on social media, be it Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, or whatever you can think of.  Remember to use Indiegogo's share tools to help.

UPDATE 12/19: With less than two days left to go, we’ve met our first stretch goal, and all of the paperback backer copies will be signed! Now we’re working on our last two stretch goals: At $31,000, we will produce a signed and numbered special edition hardcover of the first edition for all $100+ backers. And at $36,000, we’ll produce a limited-edition letterpress copy of the original Sanskrit and translated sutra for all backers at $250 and above. Help us get there!

 

Illuminating a 1,000-year-old spiritual masterpiece

One thousand years ago in the valley of Kashmīr, a great Tantric master named Kṣhemarāja wrote his masterpiece: the Pratyabhijñā-hṛdayam, which means “The Essence of the Recognition Philosophy” or “The Heart of the Teachings on Recognition”—recognition, that is, of oneself as a direct expression of the universal divine Consciousness. Recognition also that that Consciousness is in truth all that exists, and that its five fundamental powers of awareness, enjoyment, willing, knowing, and acting are the sacred endowments of every sentient being.

The Recognition philosophy is the most fully developed body of teachings in nondual Tantric Shaivism, and perhaps the most fully developed spiritual philosophy in the history of India. It arose in Kashmīr over a thousand years ago and eventually spread through the whole of India. Even back then, it was considered an intellectually challenging philosophy, and so, to make the teachings accessible to a wider public, Kshemarāja composed this text, comprising about fifty pages in the original Sanskrit.

It was a concise primer, written, he said, to introduce spiritual seekers to the Recognition philosophy in less formally philosophical, more approachable language. What he created turned out to be one of the great spiritual masterpieces, breathtaking in its brevity but stunning in its power. It came to be considered equivalent to scripture itself by later generations, because of its undeniable inspiration.

Since the text is anchored by twenty key sūtras (aphorisms), Wallis’ forthcoming translation of the work is called The Recognition Sutras.

Who are we?

I’m Christopher Wallis, also known as Hareesh. I was introduced to Indian spirituality at the age of seven and initiated into the practice of yogic meditation at sixteen. I’ve been a full-time scholar-practitioner for eighteen years. My degrees include a B.A. in Religion and Classics from the University of Rochester, an M.A. in Sanskrit from U.C. Berkeley, an M.Phil. in Classical Indian Religions from Oxford, and a Ph.D. on the traditions of Śaiva Tantra from Berkeley. I received traditional education at yoga āshrams in upstate New York and India in meditation, kīrtan, mantra-science, āsana, karma-yoga, and more. I currently teach meditation, yoga darśana (philosophy), Tantrik philosophy, Sanskrit, and mantra-science, and I offers spiritual counseling. My first book, Tantra Illuminated: The Philosophy, History, and Practice of a Timeless Tradition, was published in 2011 and has sold over 11,000 copies.

I’ve partnered with the publications firm in Vancouver, Canada, that produced and manages the second edition of Tantra Illuminated. They are handling the editing, design, indexing, proofreading and printing of the book, as well as managing the fulfilment of this campaign. Their terrific organization has produced dozens of books, including The Goddess and the Guru: A Spiritual Biography of Sri Amritananda Natha Saraswati and the second edition of Exquisite Love: Reflections on the Spiritual Life based on Nārada’s Bhakti Sūtra by William Mahony.

 

The Rewards

 

Of course, at most levels of support, you can receive a printed, electronic, or audiobook copy of The Recognition Sutras. In gratitude for your support, I’m also offering a wide range of books, courses, and other opportunities for study and experiential learning of Tantrik philosophy.

Copies of my first book, Tantra Illuminated: The Philosophy, History, and Practice of a Timeless Tradition, in electronic, paperback and audiobook format.

A Śrī Yantra poster produced on a 19th-century letterpress.

An original illustration from Tantra Illuminated, signed by the artist, Ekabhumi Charles Ellik. Note that the image below is a sample of the illustrations in Tantra Illuminated, but may not be the actual image you receive. If there’s a specific illustration you want, get in touch with us first to make sure it’s available!

Space for one or two people in the sold-out Sacred Sites of Southern India tour, December 27, 2016, through January 7, 2017 (airfare not included).

More rewards, including classes and coaching over Skype, are described in the perks!

 

Budget and stretch goals

 

The money raised in this campaign will go toward the fees for these services, as well as to print the first edition paperback.

 

Stretch goals!

 

As you can see in the chart above, this campaign will not cover our full costs—I’m funding any difference myself—so I’ve set some stretch goals to help me reach the full amount!

$26,000—MET 12/19! All of the paperback backer copies will be signed!

$31,000: At this level, we will be able to produce a signed and numbered special edition hardcover of the first edition, which will go out to all $100+ backers.

$36,000: At this level, we will produce a limited-edition letterpress copy of the original Sanskrit and translated sutra (with Kshemarāja's commentary but without my explanation), to be sent to all backers at $250 and above.

 

Questions?

Got a question about something not covered here? Send an email to eve@talksciencetome.com.

 

Thank you for your support!

story:
Launched in early 2015 after a successful Indiegogo campaign, SPOKE magazine distinguished itself in Philly’s media landscape by bringing deep, focused reportage to bicycling in the city. Supported by advertising and events, the magazine featured work from some of the best journalists in town, not to mention sleek visuals and gorgeous photography. Soon its focus expanded to report on not only bikes, but also walking and mass transit. Today, its mission is to cover Philadelphia through the prism of mobility.

We’ve learned a lot in two years, and our work is closer than ever to the pulse of the city. Now, we need your help to put out our most ambitious issue yet. Issue Six will include many great stories, such as a deep dive into the transportation challenges of South Philly’s immigrant community, a visual investigation of one of the city’s most iconic avenues, and a personal account of how a fractured sidewalk complaint system fails parents with strollers. As always, SPOKE tells human stories without shying away from the nitty-gritty of politics and policy. It takes a long time to strike this balance, but the perennial issue of mobility — of a citizen’s right to move around his or her own city safely, affordably and efficiently — is worth the effort.

 

Although run by a team of volunteers, SPOKE has always made sure to pay its freelancers for their work. Printing a physical magazine, and distributing it for free, allows us to serve a broad cross section of the Philadelphia community. But these commitments come with costs that can put financial strain on an independent operation like ours. In order to provide the best possible version of Issue Six, we ask for $3,500 in contributions so that we can fairly compensate our freelancers and print the kind of magazine that our readers deserve.

Can't donate? You can still help. Spread the word and tell your friends, neighbors and coworkers about SPOKE magazine. Follow us on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram. If you are interested in advertising with SPOKE or partnering on future events, please email spokemagazine@gmail.com.

Short Summary

This is my biggest event yet!!!! Downtown, NEW YORK CITY--the big apple! I'm going to be putting together a conference and social at a beautiful boutique hotel in NYC! But all of this is coming from my own pocket! In order to keep my artistic integrity and not sell out to some major publishing corporation I have to put my own money up! :/ 

 

But the good thing is that I can maintain a relationship with the people! I can continue to move forward and produce the art and literature that people need WITHOUT compromising the truth!!! 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • For your contribution you'll get a bunch of perks!
  • You'll also get access to my newest book due to release VERY soon! It's a philosophy book that helps us understand our purpose and our relationship with the whole universe, how to deal with negative energy, how to harness your own super powers and much more!!!

The Impact

Yo, honestly, you make this insane dream a reality! I'm just a kid from kentucky ! None of this is supposed to be happening but because I have real people in my life that are willing to support, we can make spectacular things happen!!!!! THANK YOU FOR ALL YOUR LOVE!

Risks & Challenges

IF WE DONT RAISE THE 1000 ITS NOT GOING TO BE A SHAME BUT WE MUST MOVE FORWARD! I'M COUNTING ON YOU! I APPRECIATE YOU!!!

Other Ways You Can Help

SPREAD THE WORD, CONTRIBUTE ON THE BEHALF OF OTHER PEOPLE.

 

 

SENDING LOVE, CAN'T WAIT FOR YOU TO SEE THIS NEW EVENT!

 

- SINCERELY 

 

JABRIL POWER

story:
About OSIRIS

Those who know me will know I've been writing seriously and working to become a professional writer for the last decade. Earlier this year I was absolutely thrilled to announce that my dystopian SF novel OSIRIS is to be published by Night Shade Books in June 2012, with two sequels to follow. OSIRIS will be published in the USA and Canada, but not as yet in the UK.

To help promote the book, a group of other Night Shade authors have asked me to join them at the World Science Fiction Convention in Chicago (Chicon) in September, which gets a huge amount of traffic. As a new author it's difficult to get your name out and this is a fantastic opportunity for me to showcase the book and ensure that it has the best chance possible to do well.

There is only one hitch to this: the cost of getting there. Flights to Chicago cost around £480 (circa $765), and as a struggling writer (I hate to be a cliché but it's true :)) I simply can't afford the fare.

(To put this into some sort of context, the last time I was on a plane was in 2006!)

What I Need & What I Can Give

My goal is to cover my full costs for:

The London-Chicago flight - $765 (£480)
The Convention membership - $215 (£135)

Anything you can contribute, however small, will go towards this.

Anything I raise in addition will help with the costs for the Night Shade party, accommodation, buying some more books to take with me, and day-to-day expenses while I'm over there.

I'm offering:

For an $4 (£3) donation - a smile and a thank you!

For an $8 (£5) donation - an e-copy of my short story The Complex, previously published in Interzone magazine

For a $15 (£10) donation - a signed printed copy of my short story The Complex

For a $23 (£15) donation - a signed printed copy of my story Super Falcon and the Peregrine Nation

For a $32 (£20) donation - a signed first edition of OSIRIS (hardback) after publication in June

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • You can pass on this link to anyone who might be able to contribute
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools to link to the campaign

If you'd like to find out more about the book, you can visit my website .

 

Thank you for your help! You're marvellous!

Emma x

story:
Update: Good News! With the money raised outside of the indiegogo campaign, we now have enough to put out the next two issues of OBSOLETE! BUT… there is still time for you to help out. Even a couple bucks will get us a little closer to putting out 3, or even 4 great issues in 2013. THREE DAYS LEFT to contribute

What is OBSOLETE!?

OBSOLETE! is an old-school newsprint tabloid, complete with slapdash layout, smudgy printing and inflammatory rhetoric. Published in the tradition of the International Times, OZ, The East Village Other, The Berkely Barb, The Chicago Seed, The Whole Earth Catalog, PUNK! and the other great underground rags of days past, some might think that OBSOLETE! is anachronistic throwback, a vestigial appendage on the body of the digital info-organism, a bit of paper best suited to line the cat box or wrap a fish. However, it is not just the newspaper that has become obsolete. In post-post-post-modern society even the term “obsolete” is becoming obsolete- products are obsolete before they hit the market-place, technology is only good as long as its replacement is in beta-testing. At OBSOLETE! We decided that maybe it’s time to re-examine the printed word. Perhaps newspapers and books are for the early adopters of post-apocalyptic technology. Read More

 

WHERE DOES YOUR OBSOLETE! CONTRIBUTION GO?

We want to keep putting out OBSOLETE!- making it bigger and better every issue, and building the community of people who still enjoy creating and sharing analog media. It's not just about the physical act of reading a paper, and it's not about rejecting technology. It's sharing ideas about design beyond obsolescence, repurposing technology and the interplay between the physical and digital world. This year, we started Obsolete Press to publish books and ebooks by our writers and artists, to spread the word even farther.

We want to get you involved- not just as a financial backer, but as a reader, a contributor and a distributor. We are grateful for financial contributions of any size, but whether or not you are able to contribute money, we want to invite you to get involved. You can find out more about OBSOLETE! and read back issues for free online. After checking it out, we hope you will join the Obsolete Community!

How much does it cost to put out OBSOLETE!?

It costs us about $1000 to put out each issue of OBSOLETE! That includes paying writers and artists for original content, printing and distributing 3000 copies. We would like to increase the budget per issue in order to pay more to our contributors, and increase our distribution. If we can reach our goal, we can be assured of continuing publication for the next 4 issues and get those issues out to an even wider audience.

Thanks for your help, and please check out Obsolete Press for updates, and for loads of free online content!

 

New T-Shirt Design

 

Newspaper delivery bag

story:
The "Back Flap" Summary

William Peregoy was always awful at languages. The first 'F' he ever made in his life was in middle school Spanish. Even in high school, he would constantly make dismal grades on English vocabulary tests. His SAT score to get into college was very lopsided (high in math, mediocre at best in verbal). Why? Because he was "bad" at learning vocabulary, he was "bad" at memorization. Things just didn't stick - even English vocabulary! But in his mid-20s something changed. He decided to no longer accept the fact that he as "good at math, but horrible at memorization" and he studied how human memory works, how to remember things, and how to learn. In order to test his findings he set out to Japan to do the "impossible" - to learn Japanese in only 3 months! Japanese is largely considered one of the "hardest" languages for an English speaker to learn. So, how did he do it? How did somebody who struggled to memorize even English vocabulary in high school learn thousands of Japanese words and characters in only a couple of months? How is it that someone who took years of Spanish but struggled to get anywhere in the language can now hold whole conversations completely in Japanese - about virtually any topic: ranging from religion to politics to even sports? Read on to enjoy his inspiring story of his 3 months studying Japanese in Tokyo, discover the real secrets behind memory and learning, and even learn Japanese yourself - if you want to, that is.

Learning New Skills

Learning new skills. This is something I've always had interest in, and maybe you do too. It's something I've been reading a lot about and studying up on for the past few years. I've come up with all sorts of ideas and theories about how to achieve things and how to learn new things. So I recently decided to put some of these theories of learning to the test in the best example I could come up with - something I have always struggled with personally - learning new languages. 

In order to test this, I wanted to start from scratch and I wanted to pick something good and challenging. So, I chose Japanese. A language that instills fear in the hearts of most English speakers: it has 3 different alphabets (all of them derived from Chinese characters), completely backwards grammar, and not much in common with the English language at all.

The Challenge & What I Learned

So, I decided to give it a shot. I moved to Tokyo for 3 months and worked really hard at studying and speaking Japanese. Yes, it was difficult. At times it was down right frustrating. I almost threw my computer out of the 2nd story window at Starbucks. But, guess what?  I did it. Now, I won't call myself fluent by any means, but I am fairly conversational. I've had conversations strictly in Japanese that have lasted for hours and have covered topics as wide ranging as business, sports, and even politics. I've pretty much shocked every Japanese person I met when I told them I've only been studying for a couple of months. And, I've shocked myself a few times too. ("I just had an hour long conversation in Japanese about the difference between Japanese and American politics?!? What!!??")  That's much better than my Spanish has ever been… and I've taken Spanish in school virtually my whole life.

Needless to say, I learned a lot. And, I didn't just learn Japanese. I learned how people learn and how to learn things effectively. Throughout my life, I always thought I was good at math, but bad at memorizing things (like vocabulary in a language) and now I've finally figured out why. I also figured out that that's just not true. We are all capable of learning new things; pretty much whatever we want to learn. It's just that most conventional methods of learning either teach us poorly or only teach us in one particular way that only works for a small subset of people. But there are much better methods to learning things. Methods that will work for everybody.

The Plan: What Your Money Will Go Toward

So, here's what I plan to do: I'm going to write a book. It will be a book focused on learning new skills quickly, and it will use Japanese as an example. It's going to be written in a way where if you actually want to learn Japanese - it will be the only book you would ever need to buy; and if you don't want to learn Japanese you will still be able to get a lot out of it as you can still apply the foundation and methods presented to learn whatever it is you want to learn - in probably less than half of the time you previously thought possible. I already have the framework for it laid out and some of the chapters started, but I need your help…

I'm launching an Indiegogo campaign to crowdfund the completion and launch of the book. Here's what the budget entails and what the money will go towards:

  • hiring an assistant to help me organize and plan everything (likely based in either India or the Philippines),
  • some light travel to meet and discuss theories and methods with experts on learning (have to have expert opinions of course. I want this book to be as complete as possible), and perhaps most importantly
  • the launch and initial marketing surrounding the launch of the book.

My expected timeline for the completion of the book is 6-8 months and of course I promise to keep you updated along the way. And, better yet - anybody who donates anything over $5 will get a digital copy of the book when it comes out. Just let me know if you want it in Kindle, Nook, or PDF and we'll figure it out and get it sent to you when the book is completed. I hope you will enjoy reading it as much as I think you will.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you feel like you can help out and any other ways please let me know.

For example:

  • Spread the word about this campaign: tell your family and friends
  • If you know someone who is an expert or focuses in research/academic study in fields such as human memory and/or learning, please let me know.

Thank you for your time and your interest in my project.

story_txt:
The "Back Flap" Summary
William Peregoy was always awful at languages. The first 'F' he ever made in his life was in middle school Spanish. Even in high school, he would constantly make dismal grades on English vocabulary tests. His SAT score to get into college was very lopsided (high in math, mediocre at best in verbal). Why? Because he was "bad" at learning vocabulary, he was "bad" at memorization. Things just didn't stick - even English vocabulary! But in his mid-20s something changed. He decided to no longer accept the fact that he as "good at math, but horrible at memorization" and he studied how human memory works, how to remember things, and how to learn. In order to test his findings he set out to Japan to do the "impossible" - to learn Japanese in only 3 months! Japanese is largely considered one of the "hardest" languages for an English speaker to learn. So, how did he do it? How did somebody who struggled to memorize even English vocabulary in high school learn thousands of Japanese words and characters in only a couple of months? How is it that someone who took years of Spanish but struggled to get anywhere in the language can now hold whole conversations completely in Japanese - about virtually any topic: ranging from religion to politics to even sports? Read on to enjoy his inspiring story of his 3 months studying Japanese in Tokyo, discover the real secrets behind memory and learning, and even learn Japanese yourself - if you want to, that is.


Learning New Skills
Learning new skills. This is something I've always had interest in, and maybe you do too. It's something I've been reading a lot about and studying up on for the past few years. I've come up with all sorts of ideas and theories about how to achieve things and how to learn new things. So I recently decided to put some of these theories of learning to the test in the best example I could come up with - something I have always struggled with personally - learning new languages. 
In order to test this, I wanted to start from scratch and I wanted to pick something good and challenging. So, I chose Japanese. A language that instills fear in the hearts of most English speakers: it has 3 different alphabets (all of them derived from Chinese characters), completely backwards grammar, and not much in common with the English language at all.


The Challenge & What I Learned
So, I decided to give it a shot. I moved to Tokyo for 3 months and worked really hard at studying and speaking Japanese. Yes, it was difficult. At times it was down right frustrating. I almost threw my computer out of the 2nd story window at Starbucks. But, guess what?  I did it. Now, I won't call myself fluent by any means, but I am fairly conversational. I've had conversations strictly in Japanese that have lasted for hours and have covered topics as wide ranging as business, sports, and even politics. I've pretty much shocked every Japanese person I met when I told them I've only been studying for a couple of months. And, I've shocked myself a few times too. ("I just had an hour long conversation in Japanese about the difference between Japanese and American politics?!? What!!??")  That's much better than my Spanish has ever been… and I've taken Spanish in school virtually my whole life.
Needless to say, I learned a lot. And, I didn't just learn Japanese. I learned how people learn and how to learn things effectively. Throughout my life, I always thought I was good at math, but bad at memorizing things (like vocabulary in a language) and now I've finally figured out why. I also figured out that that's just not true. We are all capable of learning new things; pretty much whatever we want to learn. It's just that most conventional methods of learning either teach us poorly or only teach us in one particular way that only works for a small subset of people. But there are much better methods to learning things. Methods that will work for everybody.


The Plan: What Your Money Will Go Toward
So, here's what I plan to do: I'm going to write a book. It will be a book focused on learning new skills quickly, and it will use Japanese as an example. It's going to be written in a way where if you actually want to learn Japanese - it will be the only book you would ever need to buy; and if you don't want to learn Japanese you will still be able to get a lot out of it as you can still apply the foundation and methods presented to learn whatever it is you want to learn - in probably less than half of the time you previously thought possible. I already have the framework for it laid out and some of the chapters started, but I need your help…
I'm launching an Indiegogo campaign to crowdfund the completion and launch of the book. Here's what the budget entails and what the money will go towards:

hiring an assistant to help me organize and plan everything (likely based in either India or the Philippines),
some light travel to meet and discuss theories and methods with experts on learning (have to have expert opinions of course. I want this book to be as complete as possible), and perhaps most importantly
the launch and initial marketing surrounding the launch of the book.

My expected timeline for the completion of the book is 6-8 months and of course I promise to keep you updated along the way. And, better yet - anybody who donates anything over $5 will get a digital copy of the book when it comes out. Just let me know if you want it in Kindle, Nook, or PDF and we'll figure it out and get it sent to you when the book is completed. I hope you will enjoy reading it as much as I think you will.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you feel like you can help out and any other ways please let me know.
For example:

Spread the word about this campaign: tell your family and friends
If you know someone who is an expert or focuses in research/academic study in fields such as human memory and/or learning, please let me know.
If you or somebody you know would be willing to review and edit draft copies of the book before the final book is completed, please let me know.
Thank you for your time and your interest in my project.
- William

NOTE: The video above contains content that may be a trigger to people with a history of self-harm. 

What is The Mirror?

The Mirror will be a new literary arts magazine working in alliance with Active Minds on Ithaca College campus. Active Minds is an organization that works to increase the discussion surrounding mental health and decrease the stigma surrounding mental illness. The Mirror is a project working under the umbrella of Active Minds, therefore working towards the same goals. The Mirror hopes to highlight the individual narratives within the collective mental health experience through creative media, such as poetry, creative writing, photography, personal narrative, painting, etc. In addition, we aim to spread awareness about the mental health resources available in the Ithaca community.

Where does your money go?

Any money you donate will go directly towards printing costs to ensure that The Mirror will be made available to anyone and everyone. 

Where and Why

One of the major ongoing projects that Active Minds completes is Speak Your Mind panel discussions (SYM panels). The SYM Panel was created in 2010 by the Ithaca College chapter of Active Minds. Its goal is to change the conversation about mental health by using the student voice to raise awareness about mental illness. This unique program educates students through direct interaction with their peers and encourages attendees to ask questions about mental health in a completely judgment-free, safe environment. Each panel consists of 3-5 Ithaca College students sharing intimate stories about their experiences with mental health in order to further benefit the student community, promote education, and to eliminate the stigma around seeking help.  The main distribution of The Mirror will occur after these panel discussions. The idea is that people will literally be able to carry the discussion out the door. We hope that this will inspire further conversion in new environments; therefore, normalizing the topic. The magazine will also be available in select areas of the greater Ithaca community and throughout campus, including the Counseling and Psychological Services building. The funds we raise through this indiegogo will be used to directly fund the printing costs of The Mirror. The magazine will be totally submission based. We have been working to gain submissions by creating a Facebook page, in class advertisements, public announcements, etc. Furthermore, we are excited to work with the local Ithaca New Roots High School. A sophomore class will be having a competition, and the best piece will be published in The Mirror. Hopefully this will increase good mental health practices at younger ages. We are also holding fundraising events to try to gain the rest of the money for printing costs.

Spread the word

Please help us continue to raise money by sharing this page with your friends.

If you'd like to learn more about our submissions, check out our facebook page.

http://www.facebook.com/TheMirrorWeWantYourSubmissions

And if you have any questions please email us at:

themirrormagazine1@gmail.com

THANK YOU!

* If you have trouble with the "Contribute Now" button, you can also send a check payable to "Fractured Atlas" (my fiscal sponsor) with "Lorelei Williams" in the memo and email me for address.  

 

 

JANAÍNA

Three continents.  One ocean.  Four centuries. 

A sacred journey of twins

 

Ever had a dream that woudn't let you go?  A bold longing that dared you to move beyond your fear to deeper faith?  I'm finally saying yes and I invite you to join me on this journey.  

My name is Lorelei.  I’m a poet and social entrepreneur from Harlem and I arrived in the world two minutes after my identical twin sister, a filmmaker and TV producer.  With Andrea, I took my first trip to Brazil, igniting a decade-long love affair with that land.  My wombmate and my enchantment with Brazil inspired me to write my first novel Janaína. 

My new  book is a magical realism thriller set in Harlem and Brazil.  It traces the lives of three generations of twins beginning with their ancestral mothers in West Africa to modern day twins Dia and Mia who are separated as toddlers when their own mother is imprisoned. Dia becomes a “menina da rua,” one of Brazil’s many street children.  Mia is secretly adopted by an American couple that head a Harlem church.  Ten years later, Mia receives a shocking medical prognosis and returns to search for her twin in the streets of Brazil where Dia is embroiled in a high-stakes gamble with organ traffickers.  The twins are reunited in the fight of their lives during Brazilian Carnival. 

My writing has appeared in Essence Magazine, Meridians Journal and African Voices.  It’s been featured in several anthologies, most recently, Women Warriors of the Afro-Latina Diaspora.  With Janaína, I’m fully surrendering to my passion, taking my creativity to the next level, and hoping to tell an important story about the resilience, struggles and beauty of Black girls growing up in the US and Brazil. 

Your help will bring this story to life!  I’ve already written a 236-page first draft and I need your help to raise a minimum of $11,000 to cover project expenses (travel costs, archival research, copy-editing, fiscal sponsorship fees, book design) and an additional $10,000 enabling me to fully engage in writing this empowering story.  Through my fiscal sponsor, Fractured Atlas, your donation is tax-deductible.

 

What’s in it For You?

  • A scandalous virtual vacation during Brazilian Carnival
  • Connection to your body’s self-healing wisdom: body as flute, altar, bridge
  • Glimpses into the secret world of twins
  • Life affirming instruction from healers in Black-Indigenous spiritual traditions
  • Lyrical communion with the sacred in nature
  • A window on Black children’s ingenuity and challenges in the US and Brazil

I’m also handcrafting appreciation gifts for donors to correspond with themes in the book.  I’m using the gifts as a way to fuel my passion for craft making; a different way to get my art out into the world.  Donate now, and you will have unique, memorable gifts to give for any occasion!  Claim rewards at the right side of your screen.

 

The Roots of Janaína

Janaína embodies so many strands of my identity, work, and travels across the African Diaspora: I am a twin from a line of eight sets of twins.  I’ve dedicated my life to empowering young people in Africa and its Diaspora for nearly fifteen years.  I am an initiate of the Afro-Brazilian religion candomblé and you’ll also find me in a Black Baptist church many Sundays.  My father, a Jamaican merchant marine, named me for a mermaid.  I share his quixotic madness, his passion for trans-Atlantic travel, and his obsession with Black freedom movements.  I’m also a domestic violence survivor and recently began training as a somatic healer to work with other survivors of violence and trauma. In writing Janaína, I’ve found a place for imagination, memory, ancestry and activism to intersect. It is a thrilling and healing process.    

In Brazil, the name Janaína is synonymous with the orixá (divine spirit) Iemanjá.  She is associated with oceans, motherhood and with Atlantic Ocean, which carried so many of our ancestors through the Middle Passage. Iemanjá has been a powerful force in my life.  

Read more on the roots of the book here: including the legendary tale of twin girls, Otampê and Gogorisa Ojaro, who survived the Middle Passage to Brazil in the 18th century.  

And check out samples of my writing here.

 

Big Risk, Big Reward: Why Trust Me? 

Janaína is my most ambitious project to date.  My writing has been acknowledged through fellowships from the Breadloaf Young Writer’s Conference, Cave Canem and the New York Foundation for the Arts.  My work has appeared in Essence Magazine, Meridians, and African Voices and featured in anthologies: Be the Dream (Algonquin Books); Women Warriors of the Afro-Latina Diaspora (University of Houston Arte Público Press); Beyond the Frontier: African-American Poetry for the 21st Century (Black Classic Press); and Daddy Can I Tell You Something? (Sela Press). 

For info on my other big risks that paid off (at Yale and in Brazil), click here.

 

Where Will the Money Go?

  • Travel costs and related fees for a return to Brazil to complete research for the book (archival study on the slave trade in Brazil, first-person interviews with young people living in the streets and in the prisons of Bahia, Carnival producers, and people impacted by the public tensions around religious intolerance in Brazil).
  • A novel-writing workshop to fine-tune and workshop chapters of the book
  • Professional copy-editing services for a publication-ready final manuscript  
  • Cover design artist honorarium
  • Printing and production of limited edition book prototypes
  • Fees collected by IndieGogo (@4%) & fiscal sponsor Fractured Atlas (7%) 
  • Production, processing and postage for supporter rewards
  • Mini-Grants to 2-4* US and Brazilian youth/community-based organizations.  Aligned with my values of reciprocity, I’d like to give something in return to the US and Brazilian young people I interview.  Where appropriate, I’d like to give small grants to support organizations working with these young people.  Beyond mini-grants, I’ll also donate poetry / writing workshops where there is interest, but I want to honor the financial challenges that these groups face in delivering their services. *Number of mini-grants depends on how much is raised.

Want to really invest in the success of this book?  Support my reach goal: an additional $10,000.  It would be ideal to have three months to attend a writers colony, incorporate all the edits from my writing class and copy-editor, review the book layout and design and do final rewrites with exclusive focus.

Can't donate but want to help?  Make some noise!  Tweet, tweet, tweet, email your friends, share on Facebook, post on blogs and connect with your community.  Write an article or blog about the campaign.  Call your buddies to ask them to invest!  And send up some affirming prayers – your positive energy will be a wonderful contribution! 

 

Why IndieGogo Before Publishing?

Before I submit a manuscript to a potential publisher (or self-publish it), I want it to be fully polished.  Debut novelists and short story writers (especially those with few publications in the same genre) often struggle to land publishing deals.  I want to strengthen my manuscript as much as possible.  Publishers also want to ensure that there is a viable market for my novel.  My IndieGogo supporters (hopefully, including you!) will affirm that readers are interested in Janaína.  Building community around the themes in the novel is an important personal goal for me – and IndieGogo is a great tool for that.

 

 

Let’s Raise $11K in 35 days!!! 

I’m counting on you to make

the Janaína project a resounding success!

Love and Blessings,

Lorelei

                                    

 

 FAQs

1. What is IndieGogo and how does this thing work? IndieGogo is one of the world’s largest crowdfunding websites, generating millions of projects in over 160 countries.  IndieGogo charges 4% for successful projects and 9% for projects that don’t meet fundraising goals.  Founded in 2008, the company has appeared on Bloomberg, Oprah, Today, and the BBC, as well as in the Wall Street Journal and The New York Times.  Learn more here.  

2. How do I donate? Click the “CONTRIBUTE NOW” button on the right hand side of the page.  You will be asked to input your pledge amount and select a reward. From there, you will go to the checkout page.  Enter your total gift amount and choose your Reward/Donor Appreciation Gift.   Enter your credit card information.  (FYI, your credit card information is protected and is never saved by Indiegogo].  Enter an email address where you would like to receive your contribution receipt.  Once my IndieGogo campaign ends in July, I will request  your address and to follow-up on any additional reward related matters.  

3. What happens if you surpass your fundraising goal?  I will be over the moon!  If I pass the first goal ($11K), funds will go towards focused writing time for the reach goal ($10K).  If I surpass the entire goal ($21K), funds would be used to enhance my marketing plan and to give additional donations to the youth organizations receiving mini-grants through this project.

4. What happens to the funds if you don’t reach your fundraising goal?  This is a two-tiered fundraising campaign.  If I don’t raise the entire first goal ($11K) then I may not be able to complete some of the items outlined above – or each phase  take a significantly longer time to complete.  If I don’t reach the second fundraising goal (an additional $10K), I will not be able to dedicate three months of full-time writing to finish the manuscript, interrupting the momentum and delaying the writing process..

5. I want to get in your suitcase?  When are we going to Brazil?  I’ve coordinated tours to Brazil in the past and led a group of 21 people there in 2010.  I don’t have plans to lead a tour this year, but I will personally create a tour agenda for you and connect you to contacts in Brazil (Salvador, Rio and São Paulo) for donors over $1,000.  

6. Can I make an anonymous donation?  You can adjust how your name and contribution amount is displayed publicly on my campaign’s “Funders tab ”on the IndieGogo website. There are three visibility levels (below).  You will be able to elect your contribution's visibility status during the Share stage of the contribution process, right after you submit your payment information.  I’ll note your preferences for donor listings on my own personal website also.

Options:

  • Your name & contribution amount will be shown on the campaign page.
  • Your contribution amount will be shown on the campaign page, but only the campaigner will see your name.
  • Your name will be shown on the campaign page, but only the campaigner will see your contribution amount.

 

7. What if I can’t give right now?  All your support and encouragement is so valued.  Creative suggestions are so welcome.  And you can get your friends to pledge.  Shout it out from the hills!!!  If you’ve got even $5 that helps boost our backer numbers as much as someone giving $500 or $5,000. 

8. Why don’t you get a fellowship to complete this writing project – why raise individual funds on IndieGogo?  That’s a great idea.  I am actually applying for fellowships for the project – and if you know of grants I should apply for, please let me know.  Since I’m registered with a fiscal sponsor (Fractured Atlas), I can receive grants from foundations, corporations, faith-based organizations, etc.  Often, grant cycles can take a long time between submission and notification.  I want to complete my research and start conversations with you around the research and themes in the novel as soon as possible and your support will help me do this.  [Also see Q7 above re: building community and demonstrating public support for this project.

9. Is shipping and handling covered for the rewards?  S&H is including for all items being shipped within the U.S.  International shipping costs will depend on the country where rewards will be shipped.  Please allow for additional time for international delivery – and contact me directly for the associated shipping costs.

10. Have another question?  If so, please feel free to contact me directly

 

Like the Janaína project on Facebook:

https://www.facebook.com/Janaina.book

From there, you will go to the checkout page.  Enter your total gift amount and choose your Reward/Donor Appreciation Gift.   Enter your credit card information.  (FYI, your credit card information is protected and is never saved by Indiegogo].  Enter an email address where you would like to receive your contribution receipt.  Once my IndieGogo campaign ends in July, I will request  your address and to follow-up on any additional reward related matters.  
3. What happens if you surpass your fundraising goal?  I will be over the moon!  If I pass the first goal ($11K), funds will go towards focused writing time for the reach goal ($10K).  If I surpass the entire goal ($21K), funds would be used to enhance my marketing plan and to give additional donations to the youth organizations receiving mini-grants through this project.
4. What happens to the funds if you don’t reach your fundraising goal?  This is a two-tiered fundraising campaign.  If I don’t raise the entire first goal ($11K) then I may not be able to complete some of the items outlined above – or each phase  take a significantly longer time to complete.  If I don’t reach the second fundraising goal (an additional $10K), I will not be able to dedicate three months of full-time writing to finish the manuscript, interrupting the momentum and delaying the writing process..
5. I want to get in your suitcase?  When are we going to Brazil?  I’ve coordinated tours to Brazil in the past and led a group of 21 people there in 2010.  I don’t have plans to lead a tour this year, but I will personally create a tour agenda for you and connect you to contacts in Brazil (Salvador, Rio and São Paulo) for donors over $1,000.  
6. Can I make an anonymous donation?  You can adjust how your name and contribution amount is displayed publicly on my campaign’s “Funders tab ”on the IndieGogo website. There are three visibility levels (below).  You will be able to elect your contribution's visibility status during the Share stage of the contribution process, right after you submit your payment information.  I’ll note your preferences for donor listings on my own personal website also.
Options: 

Your name & contribution amount will be shown on the campaign page.
Your contribution amount will be shown on the campaign page, but only the campaigner will see your name.
Your name will be shown on the campaign page, but only the campaigner will see your contribution amount.
 
7. What if I can’t give right now?  All your support and encouragement is so valued.  Creative suggestions are so welcome.  And you can get your friends to pledge.  Shout it out from the hills!!!  If you’ve got even $5 that helps boost our backer numbers as much as someone giving $500 or $5,000. 
8. Why don’t you get a fellowship to complete this writing project – why raise individual funds on IndieGogo?  That’s a great idea.  I am actually applying for fellowships for the project – and if you know of grants I should apply for, please let me know.  Since I’m registered with a fiscal sponsor (Fractured Atlas), I can receive grants from foundations, corporations, faith-based organizations, etc.  Often, grant cycles can take a long time between submission and notification.  I want to complete my research and start conversations with you around the research and themes in the novel as soon as possible and your support will help me do this.  [Also see Q7 above re: building community and demonstrating public support for this project.
9. Is shipping and handling covered for the rewards?  S&H is including for all items being shipped within the U.S.  International shipping costs will depend on the country where rewards will be shipped.  Please allow for additional time for international delivery – and contact me directly for the associated shipping costs.
10. Have another question?  If so, please feel free to contact me directly
 
Like the Janaína project on Facebook:
https://www.facebook.com/Janaina.book

story:
Short Summary

Greetings. This book, this project, has been a long time coming. 

It has taken me forever to be able to publicly express what only a few people have known about me: I am a survivor of childhood abuse- physical, emotional, and sexual. 

I grew up in a house where bruises, beatings, and threats were the norm. Where the cold crept in during the winter, chilling you to the bone, because the missing glass in the window panes had been stuffed with old trash bags. Where the living room smelled of urine because my stepfather was often so drunk, he'd mistake the television stand for the toilet.  Where you had to be as... quiet... as... possible... so you didn't draw attention to yourself.  Where the roles of "victim" and "abuser" were often held by the same people.

I grew up in a house of violence, all of it culminating with my stepfather shooting my mother.

This book is my own "purging",if you will, my own form of self-administered therapy.  It was difficult to write, and will no doubt be difficult to read.  I have decided to publish it, and I wish to self-publish, so I have full control over everything that is in the final product.  While writing, I noticed there is scant literature available for how men are affected by domestic violence and child abuse.  This project is not an attempt to politicize the issue, to try to take attention away from the women who need help.  Instead, it is a plea to the world at large to remember that we are all in this together, that no matter what your gender, growing up in a stable, loving household is paramount to producing stable, loving, healthy adults.  It is also a warning of what can happen to a child raised in a disturbed, disfunctional home, and how the scars he developed as a child shape the way he views the world as an adult.

The Impact

I want to do genuine good with this book.  First, I want to provide a voice, to show other men who were abused as a child that they need not be silent, that they need not "tough it out" or "suck it up" and "get over it".  Victims of abuse, no matter what their gender, race, or orientation, need the opportunity to heal.  Part of healing is knowing and accepting that there are others out there who have survived.

Secondly, I intend to make a difference in my own community.  I now live in Puerto Rico, and my adopted home has an high incidence of domestic violence:

http://womensenews.org/story/domestic-violence/100820/puerto-rican-women-face-rising-tide-violence#.UJ2KuWd5GFB

I have decided that 1/3 of all profits from every sale of this book will be donated to La Casa Protegida Julia de Burgos, an organization that provides temporary housing and other services for victims of domestic violence:

www.casajulia.org/

Thus, you have a chance to do real good by contributing to this project.  If you contribute enough to obtain a copy of the book, every time you look at it on the shelf, you'll know that not only did you help that very book come to fruition, but through the donations this project will make to La Casa Protegida Julia de Burgos, you helped someone desperate, alone, and frightened to have a place to sleep while they tried to start repairing their shattered lives.

Your Donation

Your donation will be used for the following:

1.  Payment to my editing staff.

2.  Promotions and advertisements, especially in small bookstores.

3.  Costs associated with hard-copy self-publishing.  Full disclosure:  Currently, I am leaning towards using Amazon's self-publishing service, as it seems professional and easy to use, but if anyone knows of other self-publishing services, I am open to suggestions.

4.  Costs associated with distributing the printed copies of the books (mailing, USPS, Fedex, etc).

5.  Fees for using this site.  This is a great site, that is why I chose it, but you get what you pay for.  A free site wouldn't have given me this amount of exposure.  Basically, if I make my goal of $4,000.00, I get to keep about $3,750.00.

6.  If there is any money left over after the project is realized, this money will be treated as if it were "profit" money, and 1/3 will be donated to Casa Protegida Julia de Burgos.

How You Can Help

If you cannot make a donation, there are other ways you can help. In the world of social media, everyone has a voice.  Please don't spam and annoy your friends, but please do spread the word- consider linking my campaign to your Facebook or Twitter.  Everything you can do to help spread the word about this project is appreciated.

Updates

I will make weekly updates on this page.  These updates will consist of selected writings from my book, with the hope of generating interest in this project, as well as giving examples of what the finished project will be like.  Each update will remain on this site for only a week, and then will be replaced by the subsequent update.

Next week, I'll upload the entire introduction to my book.

story:
The Morning of 9/11/2001

When we think back and talk with others about what happened on the morning of 9/11/2001, the familiar question always arises, “Where were you and what did you experience?” Standing Tall details the accounts of people from all over the world as they share their thoughts and experiences on the morning of September 11th, 2001. Compiled to raise funds for the World Trade Center memorial, Standing Tall gives an exceptional response from professional writers, composers, military personnel, and a pacifist struggling to come to terms with what that moment would bring. We hear from a twelve year old girl attempting to make sense of something so inconceivable, we also are given firsthand accounts from people inside the towers, and volunteers who have up everything to be there.

The Indigogo funds are needed to promote the book, do a book signing tour and to give books to the generous people who contributed their writings to the work. In order to reside the optimum founds for the memorial the book needs maximum exposure.

 

My Story

Less than a week after the World Trade Center was taken down by two of our own domestic airplanes…I left New York. Not because I was fearful, although I admit to that at times, but because my family lives in other states. My 90-year-old Grandmother was in Grand Rapids Michigan. So I took a journey across our country, just as it was starting to come to terms with its violation.

What struck me was that every place I went, I was greeted with warmth and with curiosity. Being from New York had a new spin on it. No longer were you the hardened sophisticate from the big city. You were a survivor of a war act. Everyone I spoke with wanted to know my tale. Where had I been at the time of the attack? How were the people of New York?

Likewise, they were anxious to share their place in this event. How they had heard of the attack. What they believed would happen next. During this trip I decided that this book should be born. The world was in a collective consciousness. The tales of shock, horror and heroism needed to be shared. There was no better reason to collect this than to help the victims of September 11th. So my proceeds from this book will go to charity.

There were literally thousands of emails that flooded the Internet over the weeks following the tragedy. I began to collect personal accounts, articles, spiritual writings, creative writings and journals expressing the spirit of the world during this time. It was not a particularly easy task to track down some of the original origins of the emails. Luckily many people I know are extremely articulate and firsthand accounts of the impact worldwide daily appeared in my mailbox.

I have included my own email and journal of the event, which includes the process of putting together this book. I have used photos that I have taken over the life of the World Trade Center. I wish now I had taken more, but as Richard said in his journal ”They were so much a part of our skyline they had become incidental to most photographs.” The cover photo was taken through my car sunroof while sitting at a light on the West Side Highway. I looked up and could not believe the strength of the towers above. Now I look downtown with sadness that they are gone. And say a prayer that those that went with them know in some measure know how much they are mourned.

Years later we are still standing tall. New York, the USA and the World. It is up to each of us to make sure we continue to do so by not allowing fear to run our lives. May this book help heal through communication some of the pain but also community that was felt on September 11 2001.

About the Author

Lynn Manuell has published articles for Broadwayworld.com, Playbill.com and has poetry published in Evening Musings and Unicorns and Golden Traces.  Ms. Manuell teaches theatre in the Department of Education in the City of New York to special needs students and travels each summer with People to People Student Ambassadors whose emblem is “Peace Through Understanding” – a program created by President Eisenhower.  Ms. Manuell, has a degree in photography from Columbia College in Chicago and was born in Grand Rapids Michigan, she was raised in Park Forest Illinois where she worked at the Illinois Theatre Center, in the Press Department of Columbia College and then as now volunteers for social causes.  She is the Assistant Outreach Minister of Unity of New York and a her portion of the proceeds from the book STANDING TALL will go to the World Trade Center Museum.

Thank you for your contribution!

Lynn Manuell

Author of Standing Tall
